built with pdoc

safeincave

SafeInCave

A FEniCSx-based 3D simulator designed to simulate the mechanical behavior of salt caverns under different operational conditions.

This module exposes the public API for the package and sets version information.

 1"""
 2SafeInCave
 3=========
 4
 5A FEniCSx-based 3D simulator designed to simulate the mechanical behavior of salt caverns under different operational conditions.
 6
 7This module exposes the public API for the package and
 8sets version information.
 9"""
10
11# Version info
12__version__ = "2.0.0"
13
14from .Grid import GridHandlerGMSH
15from .HeatEquation import HeatDiffusion
16from .MomentumEquation import LinearMomentumBase, LinearMomentum
17from .MaterialProps import Material, NonElasticElement, Spring, Thermoelastic, Viscoelastic, DislocationCreep, PressureSolutionCreep, ViscoplasticDesai
18from .OutputHandler import SaveFields
19from .Simulators import Simulator_TM, Simulator_T, Simulator_M, Simulator_GUI
20from .ScreenOutput import ScreenPrinter
21from .TimeHandler import TimeControllerBase, TimeController, TimeControllerParabolic
22from . import MomentumBC
23from . import HeatBC
24from . import PostProcessingTools
25from . import Utils
26
27

29    "GridHandlerGMSH",
30    "HeatBC",
31    "HeatDiffusion",
32    "LinearMomentumBase",
33    "LinearMomentum",
34    "Material",
35    "NonElasticElement",
36    "Spring",
37    "Thermoelastic",
38    "Viscoelastic",
39    "DislocationCreep",
40    "PressureSolutionCreep",
41    "ViscoplasticDesai",
42    "SaveFields",

56
57__author__ = "Hermínio T. Honório"
58__email__ = "h.tasinafohonor@tudelft.nl"
class GridHandlerGMSH: 
 28class GridHandlerGMSH(object):
 29	"""
 30	Handler for reading a Gmsh mesh into DOLFINx and exposing convenient
 31	grid-related utilities (tags, regions, volumes, smoothers).
 32
 33	The constructor loads the mesh, builds tag maps, extracts subdomain and
 34	boundary metadata, computes bounding-box dimensions, derives region-wise
 35	element indices, and constructs node–element smoothing operators.
 36
 37	Parameters
 38	----------
 39	geometry_name : str
 40	    Base name (without extension) of the `.msh` file to read.
 41	grid_folder : str
 42	    Directory where the mesh file `{geometry_name}.msh` resides.
 43
 44	Attributes
 45	----------
 46	grid_folder : str
 47	    Mesh directory provided at construction.
 48	geometry_name : str
 49	    Mesh base name provided at construction.
 50	comm : MPI.Comm
 51	    MPI communicator (defaults to `MPI.COMM_WORLD`).
 52	rank : int
 53	    Rank of the current process.
 54	mesh : dolfinx.mesh.Mesh
 55	    Loaded DOLFINx mesh.
 56	subdomains : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
 57	    Cell (volume) tags read from the mesh.
 58	boundaries : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
 59	    Facet (surface) tags read from the mesh.
 60	domain_dim : int
 61	    Topological dimension of the mesh cells.
 62	boundary_dim : int
 63	    Dimension of boundary entities (`domain_dim - 1`).
 64	n_elems : int
 65	    Number of local cells including ghosts.
 66	n_nodes : int
 67	    Number of local vertices including ghosts.
 68	tags : dict[int, dict[str, int]]
 69	    Mapping `dimension -> {name -> tag_id}` parsed from the Gmsh file.
 70	dolfin_tags : dict
 71	    Alias of `tags` for convenience.
 72	subdomain_tags : dict[str, list[int]]
 73	    Placeholder for subdomain-wise cell indices (filled later).
 74	boundary_tags : dict[str, list[int]]
 75	    Mapping from boundary name to list of exterior facet indices.
 76	Lx, Ly, Lz : float
 77	    Extents of the mesh bounding box in x, y, z.
 78	region_names : list[str]
 79	    List of subdomain (region) names.
 80	n_regions : int
 81	    Number of regions.
 82	region_indices : dict[str, list[int]]
 83	    Mapping from region name to list of cell indices in that region.
 84	tags_dict : dict[int, str]
 85	    Reverse mapping `{tag_id -> region_name}`.
 86	volumes : numpy.ndarray
 87	    Per-cell volumes, shape `(n_elems,)`. Created by `build_smoother()`.
 88	stencil : list[list[int]]
 89	    Node-to-element adjacency (per-node list of incident cell indices).
 90	A_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
 91	    Node-to-element averaging weights, shape `(n_nodes, n_elems)`.
 92	B_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
 93	    Element-to-node averaging weights, shape `(n_elems, n_nodes)`.
 94	smoother : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
 95	    Element-wise smoother `B_csr @ A_csr`, shape `(n_elems, n_elems)`.
 96
 97	Notes
 98	-----
 99	- Assumes a tetrahedral volume mesh for volume and centroid calculations.
100	- Counts (`n_elems`, `n_nodes`) include local ghosts for parallel runs.
101	"""
102	def __init__(self, geometry_name, grid_folder):
103		self.grid_folder = grid_folder
104		self.geometry_name = geometry_name
105		self.comm = MPI.COMM_WORLD
106		self.rank = self.comm.rank
107
108		self.load_mesh()
109		self.build_tags()
110		self.load_subdomains()
111		self.load_boundaries()
112		self.build_box_dimensions()
113		self.__extract_grid_data()
114		self.build_smoother()
115
116	def __tetrahedron_volume(self, x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, x3, y3, z3, x4, y4, z4):
117		"""
118		Compute the absolute volume of a tetrahedron from its 4 vertices.
119
120		Parameters
121		----------
122		x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, x3, y3, z3, x4, y4, z4 : float
123		    Coordinates of the four tetrahedron vertices.
124
125		Returns
126		-------
127		float
128		    Absolute volume of the tetrahedron.
129
130		Notes
131		-----
132		Uses the scalar triple product formula:
133		:math:`V = |((a-b) \\cdot ((c-b) \\times (d-b)))/6|`.
134		"""
135		volume = abs((1/6) * ((x2 - x1) * ((y3 - y1)*(z4 - z1) - (z3 - z1)*(y4 - y1)) + 
136		             (y2 - y1) * ((z3 - z1)*(x4 - x1) - (x3 - x1)*(z4 - z1)) + 
137		             (z2 - z1) * ((x3 - x1)*(y4 - y1) - (y3 - y1)*(x4 - x1))))
138		return volume
139
140	def __compute_volumes(self):
141		"""
142        Compute per-cell volumes for all tetrahedral elements.
143
144        Parameters
145        ----------
146        None
147
148        Returns
149        -------
150        None
151
152        Side Effects
153        ------------
154        volumes : numpy.ndarray
155            Sets `self.volumes` with shape `(n_elems,)`.
156
157        Notes
158        -----
159        Extracts connectivity (3→0) and coordinates from the DOLFINx mesh and
160        applies `__tetrahedron_volume` to each cell.
161        """
162		conn = self.mesh.topology.connectivity(3, 0).array.reshape(-1, 4)
163		coord = self.mesh.geometry.x
164		self.volumes = np.zeros(self.n_elems)
165		for i in range(self.n_elems):
166			nodes = conn[i]
167			x1, y1, z1 = coord[nodes[0], 0], coord[nodes[0], 1], coord[nodes[0], 2]
168			x2, y2, z2 = coord[nodes[1], 0], coord[nodes[1], 1], coord[nodes[1], 2]
169			x3, y3, z3 = coord[nodes[2], 0], coord[nodes[2], 1], coord[nodes[2], 2]
170			x4, y4, z4 = coord[nodes[3], 0], coord[nodes[3], 1], coord[nodes[3], 2]
171			self.volumes[i] = self.__tetrahedron_volume(x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, x3, y3, z3, x4, y4, z4)
172
173	def __build_node_elem_stencil(self):
174		"""
175        Build node-to-element adjacency lists.
176
177        Parameters
178        ----------
179        None
180
181        Returns
182        -------
183        None
184
185        Side Effects
186        ------------
187        stencil : list[list[int]]
188            Sets `self.stencil` such that `self.stencil[i]` contains the
189            indices of elements shared by node `i`.
190        """
191		conn = self.mesh.topology.connectivity(3, 0).array.reshape(-1, 4)
192		coord = self.mesh.geometry.x
193		self.stencil = [[] for i in range(self.n_nodes)]
194		for elem, elem_conn in enumerate(conn):
195			for node in elem_conn:
196				if elem not in self.stencil[node]:
197					self.stencil[node].append(elem)
198
199	def build_smoother(self):
200		"""
201        Construct element–node smoothing operators and their product.
202
203        Parameters
204        ----------
205        None
206
207        Returns
208        -------
209        None
210
211        Side Effects
212        ------------
213        A_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
214            Node-to-element weights, shape `(n_nodes, n_elems)`.
215        B_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
216            Element-to-node weights, shape `(n_elems, n_nodes)`.
217        smoother : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
218            Product `B_csr @ A_csr`, shape `(n_elems, n_elems)`.
219
220        Notes
221        -----
222        - `A_csr[i, e] = vol_e / sum(vol_e' for e' in stencil[i])`.
223        - `B_csr[e, i] = 1/4` for tetrahedra (uniform average over the 4 nodes).
224        """
225		self.__compute_volumes()
226		self.__build_node_elem_stencil()
227		A_row, A_col, A_data = [], [], []
228		for node in range(self.n_nodes):
229			vol = self.volumes[self.stencil[node]].sum()
230			for elem in self.stencil[node]:
231				A_row.append(node)
232				A_col.append(elem)
233				A_data.append(self.volumes[elem]/vol)
234		self.A_csr = csr_matrix((A_data, (A_row, A_col)), shape=(self.n_nodes, self.n_elems))
235		conn = self.mesh.topology.connectivity(3, 0).array.reshape(-1, 4)
236		B_row, B_col, B_data = [], [], []
237		for elem, nodes in enumerate(conn):
238			for node in nodes:
239				B_row.append(elem)
240				B_col.append(node)
241				B_data.append(1/len(nodes))
242		self.B_csr = csr_matrix((B_data, (B_row, B_col)), shape=(self.n_elems, self.n_nodes))
243		self.smoother = self.B_csr.dot(self.A_csr)
244
245	def load_mesh(self):
246		"""
247        Load mesh and tag metadata from a Gmsh `.msh` file.
248
249        Parameters
250        ----------
251        None
252
253        Returns
254        -------
255        None
256
257        Side Effects
258        ------------
259        mesh : dolfinx.mesh.Mesh
260            Sets `self.mesh`.
261        subdomains : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
262            Sets `self.subdomains` (cell tags).
263        boundaries : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
264            Sets `self.boundaries` (facet tags).
265        domain_dim : int
266            Sets `self.domain_dim` from mesh topology.
267        boundary_dim : int
268            Sets `self.boundary_dim = domain_dim - 1`.
269        n_elems, n_nodes : int
270            Sets local counts including ghosts.
271
272        Notes
273        -----
274        Uses `gmshio.read_from_msh(os.path.join(grid_folder, f"{geometry_name}.msh"), comm, rank=0)`.
275        """
276		self.mesh, self.subdomains, self.boundaries = gmshio.read_from_msh(
277													    os.path.join(self.grid_folder, f"{self.geometry_name}.msh"),
278													    self.comm,
279													    rank=0
280													)
281		self.domain_dim = self.mesh.topology.dim
282		self.boundary_dim = self.domain_dim - 1
283		self.n_elems = self.mesh.topology.index_map(self.domain_dim).size_local + len(self.mesh.topology.index_map(self.domain_dim).ghosts)
284		self.n_nodes = self.mesh.topology.index_map(0).size_local + len(self.mesh.topology.index_map(0).ghosts)
285
286	def build_tags(self):
287		"""
288        Parse Gmsh field data into a dimension→name→tag mapping.
289
290        Parameters
291        ----------
292        None
293
294        Returns
295        -------
296        None
297
298        Side Effects
299        ------------
300        dolfin_tags : dict[int, dict[str, int]]
301            Populates `self.dolfin_tags` with entries for dims 1, 2, 3.
302
303        Notes
304        -----
305        Reads the `.msh` via `meshio.read` to access `field_data`.
306        """
307		grid = meshio.read(os.path.join(self.grid_folder, self.geometry_name+".msh"))
308		# self.tags = {1:{}, 2:{}, 3:{}}
309		# for key, value in grid.field_data.items():
310		# 	self.tags[value[1]][key] = value[0]
311		# self.dolfin_tags = self.tags
312		self.dolfin_tags = {1:{}, 2:{}, 3:{}}
313		for key, value in grid.field_data.items():
314			self.dolfin_tags[value[1]][key] = value[0]
315
316	def load_subdomains(self):
317		"""
318        Initialize container for subdomain cell indices per region name.
319
320        Parameters
321        ----------
322        None
323
324        Returns
325        -------
326        None
327
328        Side Effects
329        ------------
330        subdomain_tags : dict[str, list[int]]
331            Initializes empty lists keyed by subdomain names.
332        """
333		self.subdomain_tags = {}
334		for subdomain_name in self.get_subdomain_names():
335			self.subdomain_tags[subdomain_name] = []
336
337
338	def load_boundaries(self):
339		"""
340        Build a map from boundary name to exterior facet indices.
341
342        Parameters
343        ----------
344        None
345
346        Returns
347        -------
348        None
349
350        Side Effects
351        ------------
352        boundary_tags : dict[str, list[int]]
353            Populates with facet indices for each named boundary.
354
355        Notes
356        -----
357        Uses `mesh.exterior_facet_indices(self.mesh.topology)` and the facet
358        tag values in `self.boundaries` to assign names via `self.dolfin_tags[2]`.
359        """
360		self.boundary_tags = {}
361
362		for boundary_name in self.get_boundary_names():
363			self.boundary_tags[boundary_name] = []
364		
365		tag_to_name = {fd: name for name, fd in self.dolfin_tags[2].items()}
366		boundary_facets = mesh.exterior_facet_indices(self.mesh.topology)
367		for i, facet in zip(boundary_facets, self.boundaries.values):
368			boundary_name = tag_to_name[facet]
369			self.boundary_tags[boundary_name].append(i)
370
371
372	def build_box_dimensions(self):
373		"""
374        Compute axis-aligned bounding-box extents (Lx, Ly, Lz).
375
376        Parameters
377        ----------
378        None
379
380        Returns
381        -------
382        None
383
384        Side Effects
385        ------------
386        Lx, Ly, Lz : float
387            Sets the extents along x, y, z.
388        """
389		self.Lx = self.mesh.geometry.x[:,0].max() - self.mesh.geometry.x[:,0].min()
390		self.Ly = self.mesh.geometry.x[:,1].max() - self.mesh.geometry.x[:,1].min()
391		self.Lz = self.mesh.geometry.x[:,2].max() - self.mesh.geometry.x[:,2].min()
392
393	def get_boundaries(self):
394		"""
395        Return the facet `MeshTags` object.
396
397        Returns
398        -------
399        dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
400            The boundary tags read from the mesh.
401        """
402		return self.boundaries
403
404	def get_boundary_tags(self, BOUNDARY_NAME):
405		"""
406        Get list of exterior facet indices for a named boundary.
407
408        Parameters
409        ----------
410        BOUNDARY_NAME : str or None
411            Boundary name as defined in the Gmsh field data. If `None`,
412            returns `None`.
413
414        Returns
415        -------
416        list[int] or None
417            Facet indices on the exterior boundary corresponding to the name,
418            or `None` if `BOUNDARY_NAME` is `None`.
419        """
420		if BOUNDARY_NAME == None:
421			return None
422		else:
423			return self.boundary_tags[BOUNDARY_NAME]
424
425	def get_boundary_tag(self, BOUNDARY_NAME):
426		"""
427        Get the integer tag ID for a named boundary.
428
429        Parameters
430        ----------
431        BOUNDARY_NAME : str or None
432            Boundary name. If `None`, returns `None`.
433
434        Returns
435        -------
436        int or None
437            Integer tag in `self.dolfin_tags[self.boundary_dim]`, or `None`.
438        """
439		if BOUNDARY_NAME == None:
440			return None
441		else:
442			tag_number = self.dolfin_tags[self.boundary_dim][BOUNDARY_NAME]
443			return tag_number
444
445	def get_boundary_names(self):
446		"""
447        List all boundary names present in the mesh.
448
449        Returns
450        -------
451        list[str]
452            Boundary names from `self.dolfin_tags[self.boundary_dim]`.
453        """
454		boundary_names = list(self.dolfin_tags[self.boundary_dim].keys())
455		return boundary_names
456
457	def get_subdomain_tag(self, DOMAIN_NAME):
458		"""
459        Get the integer tag ID for a named subdomain (cell region).
460
461        Parameters
462        ----------
463        DOMAIN_NAME : str
464            Subdomain name.
465
466        Returns
467        -------
468        int
469            Integer tag for the subdomain in `self.dolfin_tags[self.domain_dim]`.
470        """
471		tag_number = self.dolfin_tags[self.domain_dim][DOMAIN_NAME]
472		return tag_number
473
474	def get_subdomains(self):
475		"""
476        Return the cell `MeshTags` object.
477
478        Returns
479        -------
480        dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
481            The subdomain (cell) tags read from the mesh.
482        """
483		return self.subdomains
484
485	def get_subdomain_names(self):
486		"""
487        List all subdomain (region) names present in the mesh.
488
489        Returns
490        -------
491        list[str]
492            Subdomain names from `self.dolfin_tags[self.domain_dim]`.
493        """
494		subdomain_names = list(self.dolfin_tags[self.domain_dim].keys())
495		return subdomain_names
496
497	def __extract_grid_data(self):
498		"""
499        Build region indices for elements based on cell tags.
500
501        Parameters
502        ----------
503        None
504
505        Returns
506        -------
507        None
508
509        Side Effects
510        ------------
511        region_names : list[str]
512            Sets from `get_subdomain_names()`.
513        n_regions : int
514            Total number of regions.
515        region_indices : dict[str, list[int]]
516            Maps each region name to a list of cell indices.
517        tags_dict : dict[int, str]
518            Reverse mapping from integer tag to region name.
519
520        Notes
521        -----
522        Iterates over local elements; if running in parallel, these are
523        local (including ghosts).
524        """
525		self.region_names = self.get_subdomain_names()
526		self.n_regions = len(self.region_names)
527		self.region_indices = {}
528		self.tags_dict = {}
529
530		for i in range(len(self.region_names)):
531			self.region_indices[self.region_names[i]] = []
532			tag = self.get_subdomain_tag(self.region_names[i])
533			self.tags_dict[tag] = self.region_names[i]
534
535		for cell in range(self.n_elems):
536			region_marker = self.subdomains.values[cell]
537			self.region_indices[self.tags_dict[region_marker]].append(cell)
538
539	def get_parameter(self, param):
540		"""
541        Expand a parameter specification to per-element values.
542
543        Parameters
544        ----------
545        param : int or float or sequence or torch.Tensor
546            - Scalar (`int`/`float`): broadcast to all elements.
547            - Sequence of length `n_regions`: values per region in the
548              order of `self.region_indices.keys()`.
549            - Sequence or tensor of length `n_elems`: per-element values.
550
551        Returns
552        -------
553        torch.Tensor
554            1D tensor of length `n_elems` with parameter values.
555
556        Raises
557        ------
558        Exception
559            If `param` length is neither `n_regions` nor `n_elems`.
560
561        Notes
562        -----
563        Converts Python sequences to `torch.Tensor` when needed. For the
564        region-wise case, elements are filled according to
565        `self.region_indices[region]` for each region name.
566        """
567		if type(param) == int or type(param) == float:
568			return to.tensor([param for i in range(self.n_elems)])
569		elif len(param) == self.n_regions:
570			param_to = to.zeros(self.n_elems)
571			for i, region in enumerate(self.region_indices.keys()):
572				param_to[self.region_indices[region]] = param[i]
573			return param_to
574		elif len(param) == self.n_elems:
575			if type(param) == to.Tensor:
576				return param
577			else:
578				return to.tensor(param)
579		else:
580			raise Exception("Size of parameter list does not match neither # of elements nor # of regions.")

Handler for reading a Gmsh mesh into DOLFINx and exposing convenient grid-related utilities (tags, regions, volumes, smoothers).

The constructor loads the mesh, builds tag maps, extracts subdomain and boundary metadata, computes bounding-box dimensions, derives region-wise element indices, and constructs node–element smoothing operators.

Parameters
  • geometry_name (str): Base name (without extension) of the .msh file to read.
  • grid_folder (str): Directory where the mesh file {geometry_name}.msh resides.
Attributes
  • grid_folder (str): Mesh directory provided at construction.
  • geometry_name (str): Mesh base name provided at construction.
  • comm (MPI.Comm): MPI communicator (defaults to MPI.COMM_WORLD).
  • rank (int): Rank of the current process.
  • mesh (dolfinx.mesh.Mesh): Loaded DOLFINx mesh.
  • subdomains (dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags): Cell (volume) tags read from the mesh.
  • boundaries (dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags): Facet (surface) tags read from the mesh.
  • domain_dim (int): Topological dimension of the mesh cells.
  • boundary_dim (int): Dimension of boundary entities (domain_dim - 1).
  • n_elems (int): Number of local cells including ghosts.
  • n_nodes (int): Number of local vertices including ghosts.
  • tags (dict[int, dict[str, int]]): Mapping dimension -> {name -> tag_id} parsed from the Gmsh file.
  • dolfin_tags (dict): Alias of tags for convenience.
  • subdomain_tags (dict[str, list[int]]): Placeholder for subdomain-wise cell indices (filled later).
  • boundary_tags (dict[str, list[int]]): Mapping from boundary name to list of exterior facet indices.
  • Lx, Ly, Lz (float): Extents of the mesh bounding box in x, y, z.
  • region_names (list[str]): List of subdomain (region) names.
  • n_regions (int): Number of regions.
  • region_indices (dict[str, list[int]]): Mapping from region name to list of cell indices in that region.
  • tags_dict (dict[int, str]): Reverse mapping {tag_id -> region_name}.
  • volumes (numpy.ndarray): Per-cell volumes, shape (n_elems,). Created by build_smoother().
  • stencil (list[list[int]]): Node-to-element adjacency (per-node list of incident cell indices).
  • A_csr (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix): Node-to-element averaging weights, shape (n_nodes, n_elems).
  • B_csr (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix): Element-to-node averaging weights, shape (n_elems, n_nodes).
  • smoother (scipy.sparse.csr_matrix): Element-wise smoother B_csr @ A_csr, shape (n_elems, n_elems).
Notes
  • Assumes a tetrahedral volume mesh for volume and centroid calculations.
  • Counts (n_elems, n_nodes) include local ghosts for parallel runs.
GridHandlerGMSH(geometry_name, grid_folder) 
102	def __init__(self, geometry_name, grid_folder):
103		self.grid_folder = grid_folder
104		self.geometry_name = geometry_name
105		self.comm = MPI.COMM_WORLD
106		self.rank = self.comm.rank
107
108		self.load_mesh()
109		self.build_tags()
110		self.load_subdomains()
111		self.load_boundaries()
112		self.build_box_dimensions()
113		self.__extract_grid_data()
114		self.build_smoother()
grid_folder
geometry_name
comm
rank
def build_smoother(self): 
199	def build_smoother(self):
200		"""
201        Construct element–node smoothing operators and their product.
202
203        Parameters
204        ----------
205        None
206
207        Returns
208        -------
209        None
210
211        Side Effects
212        ------------
213        A_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
214            Node-to-element weights, shape `(n_nodes, n_elems)`.
215        B_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
216            Element-to-node weights, shape `(n_elems, n_nodes)`.
217        smoother : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix
218            Product `B_csr @ A_csr`, shape `(n_elems, n_elems)`.
219
220        Notes
221        -----
222        - `A_csr[i, e] = vol_e / sum(vol_e' for e' in stencil[i])`.
223        - `B_csr[e, i] = 1/4` for tetrahedra (uniform average over the 4 nodes).
224        """
225		self.__compute_volumes()
226		self.__build_node_elem_stencil()
227		A_row, A_col, A_data = [], [], []
228		for node in range(self.n_nodes):
229			vol = self.volumes[self.stencil[node]].sum()
230			for elem in self.stencil[node]:
231				A_row.append(node)
232				A_col.append(elem)
233				A_data.append(self.volumes[elem]/vol)
234		self.A_csr = csr_matrix((A_data, (A_row, A_col)), shape=(self.n_nodes, self.n_elems))
235		conn = self.mesh.topology.connectivity(3, 0).array.reshape(-1, 4)
236		B_row, B_col, B_data = [], [], []
237		for elem, nodes in enumerate(conn):
238			for node in nodes:
239				B_row.append(elem)
240				B_col.append(node)
241				B_data.append(1/len(nodes))
242		self.B_csr = csr_matrix((B_data, (B_row, B_col)), shape=(self.n_elems, self.n_nodes))
243		self.smoother = self.B_csr.dot(self.A_csr)

Construct element–node smoothing operators and their product.

Parameters
  • None
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

A_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix Node-to-element weights, shape (n_nodes, n_elems). B_csr : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix Element-to-node weights, shape (n_elems, n_nodes). smoother : scipy.sparse.csr_matrix Product B_csr @ A_csr, shape (n_elems, n_elems).

Notes
  • A_csr[i, e] = vol_e / sum(vol_e' for e' in stencil[i]).
  • B_csr[e, i] = 1/4 for tetrahedra (uniform average over the 4 nodes).
def load_mesh(self): 
245	def load_mesh(self):
246		"""
247        Load mesh and tag metadata from a Gmsh `.msh` file.
248
249        Parameters
250        ----------
251        None
252
253        Returns
254        -------
255        None
256
257        Side Effects
258        ------------
259        mesh : dolfinx.mesh.Mesh
260            Sets `self.mesh`.
261        subdomains : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
262            Sets `self.subdomains` (cell tags).
263        boundaries : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags
264            Sets `self.boundaries` (facet tags).
265        domain_dim : int
266            Sets `self.domain_dim` from mesh topology.
267        boundary_dim : int
268            Sets `self.boundary_dim = domain_dim - 1`.
269        n_elems, n_nodes : int
270            Sets local counts including ghosts.
271
272        Notes
273        -----
274        Uses `gmshio.read_from_msh(os.path.join(grid_folder, f"{geometry_name}.msh"), comm, rank=0)`.
275        """
276		self.mesh, self.subdomains, self.boundaries = gmshio.read_from_msh(
277													    os.path.join(self.grid_folder, f"{self.geometry_name}.msh"),
278													    self.comm,
279													    rank=0
280													)
281		self.domain_dim = self.mesh.topology.dim
282		self.boundary_dim = self.domain_dim - 1
283		self.n_elems = self.mesh.topology.index_map(self.domain_dim).size_local + len(self.mesh.topology.index_map(self.domain_dim).ghosts)
284		self.n_nodes = self.mesh.topology.index_map(0).size_local + len(self.mesh.topology.index_map(0).ghosts)

Load mesh and tag metadata from a Gmsh .msh file.

Parameters
  • None
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

mesh : dolfinx.mesh.Mesh Sets self.mesh. subdomains : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags Sets self.subdomains (cell tags). boundaries : dolfinx.mesh.MeshTags Sets self.boundaries (facet tags). domain_dim : int Sets self.domain_dim from mesh topology. boundary_dim : int Sets self.boundary_dim = domain_dim - 1. n_elems, n_nodes : int Sets local counts including ghosts.

Notes

Uses gmshio.read_from_msh(os.path.join(grid_folder, f"{geometry_name}.msh"), comm, rank=0).

def build_tags(self): 
286	def build_tags(self):
287		"""
288        Parse Gmsh field data into a dimension→name→tag mapping.
289
290        Parameters
291        ----------
292        None
293
294        Returns
295        -------
296        None
297
298        Side Effects
299        ------------
300        dolfin_tags : dict[int, dict[str, int]]
301            Populates `self.dolfin_tags` with entries for dims 1, 2, 3.
302
303        Notes
304        -----
305        Reads the `.msh` via `meshio.read` to access `field_data`.
306        """
307		grid = meshio.read(os.path.join(self.grid_folder, self.geometry_name+".msh"))
308		# self.tags = {1:{}, 2:{}, 3:{}}
309		# for key, value in grid.field_data.items():
310		# 	self.tags[value[1]][key] = value[0]
311		# self.dolfin_tags = self.tags
312		self.dolfin_tags = {1:{}, 2:{}, 3:{}}
313		for key, value in grid.field_data.items():
314			self.dolfin_tags[value[1]][key] = value[0]

Parse Gmsh field data into a dimension→name→tag mapping.

Parameters
  • None
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

dolfin_tags : dict[int, dict[str, int]] Populates self.dolfin_tags with entries for dims 1, 2, 3.

Notes

Reads the .msh via meshio.read to access field_data.

def load_subdomains(self): 
316	def load_subdomains(self):
317		"""
318        Initialize container for subdomain cell indices per region name.
319
320        Parameters
321        ----------
322        None
323
324        Returns
325        -------
326        None
327
328        Side Effects
329        ------------
330        subdomain_tags : dict[str, list[int]]
331            Initializes empty lists keyed by subdomain names.
332        """
333		self.subdomain_tags = {}
334		for subdomain_name in self.get_subdomain_names():
335			self.subdomain_tags[subdomain_name] = []

Initialize container for subdomain cell indices per region name.

Parameters
  • None
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

subdomain_tags : dict[str, list[int]] Initializes empty lists keyed by subdomain names.

def load_boundaries(self): 
338	def load_boundaries(self):
339		"""
340        Build a map from boundary name to exterior facet indices.
341
342        Parameters
343        ----------
344        None
345
346        Returns
347        -------
348        None
349
350        Side Effects
351        ------------
352        boundary_tags : dict[str, list[int]]
353            Populates with facet indices for each named boundary.
354
355        Notes
356        -----
357        Uses `mesh.exterior_facet_indices(self.mesh.topology)` and the facet
358        tag values in `self.boundaries` to assign names via `self.dolfin_tags[2]`.
359        """
360		self.boundary_tags = {}
361
362		for boundary_name in self.get_boundary_names():
363			self.boundary_tags[boundary_name] = []
364		
365		tag_to_name = {fd: name for name, fd in self.dolfin_tags[2].items()}
366		boundary_facets = mesh.exterior_facet_indices(self.mesh.topology)
367		for i, facet in zip(boundary_facets, self.boundaries.values):
368			boundary_name = tag_to_name[facet]
369			self.boundary_tags[boundary_name].append(i)

Build a map from boundary name to exterior facet indices.

Parameters
  • None
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

boundary_tags : dict[str, list[int]] Populates with facet indices for each named boundary.

Notes

Uses mesh.exterior_facet_indices(self.mesh.topology) and the facet tag values in self.boundaries to assign names via self.dolfin_tags[2].

def build_box_dimensions(self): 
372	def build_box_dimensions(self):
373		"""
374        Compute axis-aligned bounding-box extents (Lx, Ly, Lz).
375
376        Parameters
377        ----------
378        None
379
380        Returns
381        -------
382        None
383
384        Side Effects
385        ------------
386        Lx, Ly, Lz : float
387            Sets the extents along x, y, z.
388        """
389		self.Lx = self.mesh.geometry.x[:,0].max() - self.mesh.geometry.x[:,0].min()
390		self.Ly = self.mesh.geometry.x[:,1].max() - self.mesh.geometry.x[:,1].min()
391		self.Lz = self.mesh.geometry.x[:,2].max() - self.mesh.geometry.x[:,2].min()

Compute axis-aligned bounding-box extents (Lx, Ly, Lz).

Parameters
  • None
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Lx, Ly, Lz : float Sets the extents along x, y, z.

def get_boundary_tags(self, BOUNDARY_NAME): 
404	def get_boundary_tags(self, BOUNDARY_NAME):
405		"""
406        Get list of exterior facet indices for a named boundary.
407
408        Parameters
409        ----------
410        BOUNDARY_NAME : str or None
411            Boundary name as defined in the Gmsh field data. If `None`,
412            returns `None`.
413
414        Returns
415        -------
416        list[int] or None
417            Facet indices on the exterior boundary corresponding to the name,
418            or `None` if `BOUNDARY_NAME` is `None`.
419        """
420		if BOUNDARY_NAME == None:
421			return None
422		else:
423			return self.boundary_tags[BOUNDARY_NAME]

Returns
  • list[int] or None: Facet indices on the exterior boundary corresponding to the name, or None if BOUNDARY_NAME is None.
def get_boundary_tag(self, BOUNDARY_NAME): 
425	def get_boundary_tag(self, BOUNDARY_NAME):

427        Get the integer tag ID for a named boundary.

434        Returns
435        -------

438        """
439		if BOUNDARY_NAME == None:
440			return None
441		else:
442			tag_number = self.dolfin_tags[self.boundary_dim][BOUNDARY_NAME]
443			return tag_number

def get_parameter(self, param): 
539	def get_parameter(self, param):
540		"""
541        Expand a parameter specification to per-element values.
542
543        Parameters
544        ----------
545        param : int or float or sequence or torch.Tensor
546            - Scalar (`int`/`float`): broadcast to all elements.
547            - Sequence of length `n_regions`: values per region in the
548              order of `self.region_indices.keys()`.
549            - Sequence or tensor of length `n_elems`: per-element values.
550
551        Returns
552        -------
553        torch.Tensor
554            1D tensor of length `n_elems` with parameter values.
555
556        Raises
557        ------
558        Exception
559            If `param` length is neither `n_regions` nor `n_elems`.
560
561        Notes
562        -----
563        Converts Python sequences to `torch.Tensor` when needed. For the
564        region-wise case, elements are filled according to
565        `self.region_indices[region]` for each region name.
566        """
567		if type(param) == int or type(param) == float:
568			return to.tensor([param for i in range(self.n_elems)])
569		elif len(param) == self.n_regions:
570			param_to = to.zeros(self.n_elems)
571			for i, region in enumerate(self.region_indices.keys()):
572				param_to[self.region_indices[region]] = param[i]
573			return param_to
574		elif len(param) == self.n_elems:
575			if type(param) == to.Tensor:
576				return param
577			else:
578				return to.tensor(param)
579		else:
580			raise Exception("Size of parameter list does not match neither # of elements nor # of regions.")

Expand a parameter specification to per-element values.

Parameters
  • param (int or float or sequence or torch.Tensor):
    • Scalar (int/float): broadcast to all elements.
    • Sequence of length n_regions: values per region in the order of self.region_indices.keys().
    • Sequence or tensor of length n_elems: per-element values.
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: 1D tensor of length n_elems with parameter values.
Raises
  • Exception: If param length is neither n_regions nor n_elems.
Notes

Converts Python sequences to torch.Tensor when needed. For the region-wise case, elements are filled according to self.region_indices[region] for each region name.

class HeatDiffusion: 
 35class HeatDiffusion():
 36    """
 37    Transient heat-diffusion solver on a DOLFINx mesh.
 38
 39    This class sets up the finite-element spaces, fields, measures, and linear
 40    system for the implicit θ-method (backward Euler when θ=1). It assembles
 41    the bilinear and linear forms, applies time-dependent boundary conditions,
 42    and solves for the temperature increment/field at each time step.
 43
 44    Parameters
 45    ----------
 46    grid : GridHandlerGMSH
 47        Grid/mesh handler providing the DOLFINx mesh and mesh tags
 48        (subdomains/boundaries).
 49
 50    Attributes
 51    ----------
 52    grid : GridHandlerGMSH
 53        Input grid handler.
 54    DG0_1 : dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
 55        Discontinuous Galerkin (degree 0) space for cell-wise material fields.
 56    V : dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
 57        Lagrange (degree 1) space for temperature.
 58    n_elems : int
 59        Number of (local + ghost) cells in the mesh.
 60    n_nodes : int
 61        Number of (local + ghost) nodes in the mesh.
 62    dt : dolfinx.fem.Constant
 63        Time-step parameter (as a scalar Constant on the mesh).
 64    dT : ufl.trialfunctions.TrialFunction
 65        Trial function in space `V` (temperature increment).
 66    T_ : ufl.testfunctions.TestFunction
 67        Test function in space `V`.
 68    ds, dx : ufl.Measure
 69        Boundary and volume measures with subdomain data.
 70    k, rho, cp : dolfinx.fem.Function
 71        Cell-wise material properties (DG0_1): conductivity, density, heat capacity.
 72    T_old, T, X : dolfinx.fem.Function
 73        Temperature at previous step, current temperature, and solver vector
 74        (all in `V`).
 75    mat : Material
 76        Material properties container (set via :meth:`set_material`).
 77    solver : petsc4py.PETSc.KSP
 78        Linear solver (set via :meth:`set_solver`).
 79    bc : BcHandler
 80        Boundary-condition handler (set via :meth:`set_boundary_conditions`).
 81
 82    Notes
 83    -----
 84    - Voigt/tensor conventions are irrelevant here; only scalar temperature is solved.
 85    - The class expects that a solver (:class:`PETSc.KSP`), a material
 86      (:class:`Material`), and a BC handler (:class:`BcHandler`) are set
 87      before calling :meth:`solve`.
 88    """
 89    def __init__(self, grid: GridHandlerGMSH):
 90        self.grid = grid
 91
 92        self.create_function_spaces()
 93
 94        self.n_elems = self.DG0_1.dofmap.index_map.size_local + len(self.DG0_1.dofmap.index_map.ghosts)
 95        self.n_nodes = self.V.dofmap.index_map.size_local + len(self.V.dofmap.index_map.ghosts)
 96        self.dt = do.fem.Constant(self.grid.mesh, 1.0)
 97
 98        self.create_trial_test_functions()
 99        self.create_ds_dx()
100        self.create_fenicsx_fields()
101        # self.create_pytorch_fields()
102
103    def set_material(self, material: Material) -> None:
104        """
105        Attach material properties and initialize FE fields.
106
107        Parameters
108        ----------
109        material : Material
110            Container with per-element tensors/vectors (`k`, `density`, `cp`).
111
112        Returns
113        -------
114        None
115
116        Side Effects
117        ------------
118        Calls :meth:`initialize` to copy material arrays into FE functions.
119        """
120        self.mat = material
121        self.initialize()
122
123    def set_solver(self, solver: PETSc.KSP) -> None:
124        """
125        Set the PETSc linear solver.
126
127        Parameters
128        ----------
129        solver : petsc4py.PETSc.KSP
130            Configured Krylov solver (e.g., with preconditioner and tolerances).
131
132        Returns
133        -------
134        None
135        """
136        self.solver = solver
137
138    def set_boundary_conditions(self, bc: BcHandler) -> None:
139        """
140        Set the boundary-condition handler.
141
142        Parameters
143        ----------
144        bc : BcHandler
145            Boundary-condition manager providing Dirichlet, Neumann, and Robin
146            contributions and update routines.
147
148        Returns
149        -------
150        None
151        """
152        self.bc = bc
153
154    def create_trial_test_functions(self) -> None:
155        """
156        Create trial and test functions in `V`.
157
158        Returns
159        -------
160        None
161
162        Side Effects
163        ------------
164        Defines :attr:`dT` and :attr:`T_` as UFL trial/test functions.
165        """
166        self.dT = ufl.TrialFunction(self.V)
167        self.T_ = ufl.TestFunction(self.V)
168
169    def create_function_spaces(self) -> None:
170        """
171        Build function spaces for materials (DG0) and temperature (P1).
172
173        Returns
174        -------
175        None
176
177        Side Effects
178        ------------
179        Defines :attr:`DG0_1` and :attr:`V`.
180        """
181        self.DG0_1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0))
182        self.V = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("Lagrange", 1))
183
184    def create_ds_dx(self) -> None:
185        """
186        Create UFL measures with subdomain data for integration.
187
188        Returns
189        -------
190        None
191
192        Side Effects
193        ------------
194        Defines :attr:`ds` for boundary integrals and :attr:`dx` for domain integrals,
195        using mesh tags from :attr:`grid`.
196        """
197        self.ds = ufl.Measure("ds", domain=self.grid.mesh, subdomain_data=self.grid.get_boundaries())
198        self.dx = ufl.Measure("dx", domain=self.grid.mesh, subdomain_data=self.grid.get_subdomains())
199
200    def create_fenicsx_fields(self) -> None:
201        """
202        Allocate DOLFINx Functions for material and temperature fields.
203
204        Returns
205        -------
206        None
207
208        Side Effects
209        ------------
210        Creates :attr:`k`, :attr:`rho`, :attr:`cp` in `DG0_1` and
211        :attr:`T_old`, :attr:`T`, :attr:`X` in `V`.
212        """
213        self.k = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
214        self.rho = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
215        self.cp = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
216        self.T_old = do.fem.Function(self.V)
217        self.T = do.fem.Function(self.V)
218        self.X = do.fem.Function(self.V)
219
220    def initialize(self) -> None:
221        """
222        Copy material arrays into FE functions (`k`, `rho`, `cp`).
223
224        Returns
225        -------
226        None
227
228        Side Effects
229        ------------
230        Writes into `self.k.x.array`, `self.rho.x.array`, and `self.cp.x.array`
231        from the arrays stored in :attr:`mat`.
232        """
233        self.k.x.array[:] = self.mat.k
234        self.rho.x.array[:] = self.mat.density
235        self.cp.x.array[:] = self.mat.cp
236
237    def split_solution(self) -> None:
238        """
239        Assign the solver vector `X` to the temperature field `T`.
240
241        Returns
242        -------
243        None
244
245        Notes
246        -----
247        This sets `self.T = self.X` (rebinds the reference), rather than copying
248        underlying arrays. If you need a deep copy, copy `self.X.x.array` into
249        `self.T.x.array`.
250        """
251        self.T = self.X
252
253    def update_T_old(self) -> None:
254        """
255        Copy the current temperature into the `T_old` storage.
256
257        Returns
258        -------
259        None
260
261        Side Effects
262        ------------
263        Overwrites `self.T_old.x.array` with `self.T.x.array`.
264        """
265        self.T_old.x.array[:] = self.T.x.array
266
267    def set_initial_T(self, T_field: to.Tensor) -> None:
268        """
269        Initialize both current and previous temperature fields.
270
271        Parameters
272        ----------
273        T_field : torch.Tensor
274            Temperature values for all nodal DOFs (shape `(n_nodes,)` or compatible).
275
276        Returns
277        -------
278        None
279
280        Side Effects
281        ------------
282        Writes into `self.T_old.x.array` and `self.T.x.array`.
283        """
284        self.T_old.x.array[:] = T_field
285        self.T.x.array[:] = T_field
286
287    def get_T_elems(self) -> None:
288        """
289        Project the nodal temperature to DG0 and return as a torch tensor.
290
291        Returns
292        -------
293        torch.Tensor
294            Cell-wise constant temperature values of length `n_elems`.
295
296        Notes
297        -----
298        Uses :func:`Utils.project` to project `T` onto `DG0_1` and
299        :func:`Utils.numpy2torch` to convert to a Torch tensor.
300        """
301        T_elems = project(self.T, self.DG0_1)
302        return numpy2torch(T_elems.x.array)
303
304
305    def solve(self, t: float, dt: float) -> None:
306        """
307        Assemble and solve one implicit time step.
308
309        The method:
310        1. Update boundary conditions at time ``t`` via :class:`BcHandler`.
311        2. Set the time-step constant ``dt``.
312        3. Assemble the bilinear form :math:`(\\rho c_p / \\Delta t) (dT, T_) + (k \\nabla dT, \\nabla T_)` plus Robin terms.
313        4. Assemble the right-hand side :math:`(\\rho c_p / \\Delta t) (T_{old}, T_)` plus Neumann and Robin terms.
314        5. Apply Dirichlet BCs, solve the linear system for :attr:`X`, and update :attr:`T` and :attr:`T_old`.
315
316        Parameters
317        ----------
318        t : float
319            Current time at which boundary conditions are evaluated.
320        dt : float
321            Time-step size to advance.
322
323        Returns
324        -------
325        None
326
327        Raises
328        ------
329        AttributeError
330            If solver, BC handler, or material fields are not set.
331
332        Notes
333        -----
334        - The linear system is solved via the user-provided :class:`PETSc.KSP`.
335        - Dirichlet conditions are enforced strongly; Neumann/Robin are added
336          to the forms via the handler lists.
337        """
338        # Update boundary conditions
339        self.bc.update_bcs(t)
340
341        self.dt.value = dt
342
343        # Build bilinear form
344        a = (self.rho*self.cp*self.dT*self.T_/self.dt + self.k*ufl.dot(ufl.grad(self.dT), ufl.grad(self.T_)))*self.dx
345        a += sum(self.bc.robin_bcs_a)
346        bilinear_form = do.fem.form(a)
347        A = do.fem.petsc.assemble_matrix(bilinear_form, bcs=self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
348        A.assemble()
349
350        # Build linear form
351        L = (self.rho*self.cp*self.T_old*self.T_/self.dt)*self.dx + sum(self.bc.neumann_bcs) + sum(self.bc.robin_bcs_b)
352        linear_form = do.fem.form(L)
353        b = do.fem.petsc.assemble_vector(linear_form)
354        do.fem.petsc.apply_lifting(b, [bilinear_form], [self.bc.dirichlet_bcs])
355        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.ADD_VALUES, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.REVERSE)
356        do.fem.petsc.set_bc(b, self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
357        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.INSERT, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.FORWARD)
358
359        # Solve linear system
360        self.solver.setOperators(A)
361        self.solver.solve(b, self.X.x.petsc_vec)
362        self.X.x.scatter_forward()
363        self.split_solution()
364
365        # Update old temperature field
366        self.update_T_old()

Transient heat-diffusion solver on a DOLFINx mesh.

This class sets up the finite-element spaces, fields, measures, and linear system for the implicit θ-method (backward Euler when θ=1). It assembles the bilinear and linear forms, applies time-dependent boundary conditions, and solves for the temperature increment/field at each time step.

Parameters
  • grid (GridHandlerGMSH): Grid/mesh handler providing the DOLFINx mesh and mesh tags (subdomains/boundaries).
Attributes
  • grid (GridHandlerGMSH): Input grid handler.
  • DG0_1 (dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace): Discontinuous Galerkin (degree 0) space for cell-wise material fields.
  • V (dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace): Lagrange (degree 1) space for temperature.
  • n_elems (int): Number of (local + ghost) cells in the mesh.
  • n_nodes (int): Number of (local + ghost) nodes in the mesh.
  • dt (dolfinx.fem.Constant): Time-step parameter (as a scalar Constant on the mesh).
  • dT (ufl.trialfunctions.TrialFunction): Trial function in space V (temperature increment).
  • T_ (ufl.testfunctions.TestFunction): Test function in space V.
  • ds, dx (ufl.Measure): Boundary and volume measures with subdomain data.
  • k, rho, cp (dolfinx.fem.Function): Cell-wise material properties (DG0_1): conductivity, density, heat capacity.
  • T_old, T, X (dolfinx.fem.Function): Temperature at previous step, current temperature, and solver vector (all in V).
  • mat (Material): Material properties container (set via set_material()).
  • solver (petsc4py.PETSc.KSP): Linear solver (set via set_solver()).
  • bc (BcHandler): Boundary-condition handler (set via set_boundary_conditions()).
Notes
  • Voigt/tensor conventions are irrelevant here; only scalar temperature is solved.
  • The class expects that a solver (PETSc.KSP), a material (Material), and a BC handler (BcHandler) are set before calling solve().
HeatDiffusion(grid: GridHandlerGMSH) 
 89    def __init__(self, grid: GridHandlerGMSH):
 90        self.grid = grid
 91
 92        self.create_function_spaces()
 93
 94        self.n_elems = self.DG0_1.dofmap.index_map.size_local + len(self.DG0_1.dofmap.index_map.ghosts)
 95        self.n_nodes = self.V.dofmap.index_map.size_local + len(self.V.dofmap.index_map.ghosts)
 96        self.dt = do.fem.Constant(self.grid.mesh, 1.0)
 97
 98        self.create_trial_test_functions()
 99        self.create_ds_dx()
100        self.create_fenicsx_fields()
101        # self.create_pytorch_fields()
grid
n_elems
n_nodes
dt

115
116        Side Effects

def get_T_elems(self) -> None: 
287    def get_T_elems(self) -> None:
288        """
289        Project the nodal temperature to DG0 and return as a torch tensor.
290
291        Returns
292        -------
293        torch.Tensor
294            Cell-wise constant temperature values of length `n_elems`.
295
296        Notes
297        -----
298        Uses :func:`Utils.project` to project `T` onto `DG0_1` and
299        :func:`Utils.numpy2torch` to convert to a Torch tensor.
300        """
301        T_elems = project(self.T, self.DG0_1)
302        return numpy2torch(T_elems.x.array)

Project the nodal temperature to DG0 and return as a torch tensor.

Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Cell-wise constant temperature values of length n_elems.
Notes

Uses Utils.project() to project T onto DG0_1 and Utils.numpy2torch() to convert to a Torch tensor.

def solve(self, t: float, dt: float) -> None: 
305    def solve(self, t: float, dt: float) -> None:
306        """
307        Assemble and solve one implicit time step.
308
309        The method:
310        1. Update boundary conditions at time ``t`` via :class:`BcHandler`.
311        2. Set the time-step constant ``dt``.
312        3. Assemble the bilinear form :math:`(\\rho c_p / \\Delta t) (dT, T_) + (k \\nabla dT, \\nabla T_)` plus Robin terms.
313        4. Assemble the right-hand side :math:`(\\rho c_p / \\Delta t) (T_{old}, T_)` plus Neumann and Robin terms.
314        5. Apply Dirichlet BCs, solve the linear system for :attr:`X`, and update :attr:`T` and :attr:`T_old`.
315
316        Parameters
317        ----------
318        t : float
319            Current time at which boundary conditions are evaluated.
320        dt : float
321            Time-step size to advance.
322
323        Returns
324        -------
325        None
326
327        Raises
328        ------
329        AttributeError
330            If solver, BC handler, or material fields are not set.
331
332        Notes
333        -----
334        - The linear system is solved via the user-provided :class:`PETSc.KSP`.
335        - Dirichlet conditions are enforced strongly; Neumann/Robin are added
336          to the forms via the handler lists.
337        """
338        # Update boundary conditions
339        self.bc.update_bcs(t)
340
341        self.dt.value = dt
342
343        # Build bilinear form
344        a = (self.rho*self.cp*self.dT*self.T_/self.dt + self.k*ufl.dot(ufl.grad(self.dT), ufl.grad(self.T_)))*self.dx
345        a += sum(self.bc.robin_bcs_a)
346        bilinear_form = do.fem.form(a)
347        A = do.fem.petsc.assemble_matrix(bilinear_form, bcs=self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
348        A.assemble()
349
350        # Build linear form
351        L = (self.rho*self.cp*self.T_old*self.T_/self.dt)*self.dx + sum(self.bc.neumann_bcs) + sum(self.bc.robin_bcs_b)
352        linear_form = do.fem.form(L)
353        b = do.fem.petsc.assemble_vector(linear_form)
354        do.fem.petsc.apply_lifting(b, [bilinear_form], [self.bc.dirichlet_bcs])
355        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.ADD_VALUES, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.REVERSE)
356        do.fem.petsc.set_bc(b, self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
357        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.INSERT, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.FORWARD)
358
359        # Solve linear system
360        self.solver.setOperators(A)
361        self.solver.solve(b, self.X.x.petsc_vec)
362        self.X.x.scatter_forward()
363        self.split_solution()
364
365        # Update old temperature field
366        self.update_T_old()

Assemble and solve one implicit time step.

The method:

  1. Update boundary conditions at time t via BcHandler.
  2. Set the time-step constant dt.
  3. Assemble the bilinear form \( (\rho c_p / \Delta t) (dT, T_) + (k \nabla dT, \nabla T_) \) plus Robin terms.
  4. Assemble the right-hand side \( (\rho c_p / \Delta t) (T_{old}, T_) \) plus Neumann and Robin terms.
  5. Apply Dirichlet BCs, solve the linear system for X, and update T and T_old.
Parameters
  • t (float): Current time at which boundary conditions are evaluated.
  • dt (float): Time-step size to advance.
Returns
  • None
Raises
  • AttributeError: If solver, BC handler, or material fields are not set.
Notes
  • The linear system is solved via the user-provided PETSc.KSP.
  • Dirichlet conditions are enforced strongly; Neumann/Robin are added to the forms via the handler lists.
class LinearMomentumBase(abc.ABC): 
 37class LinearMomentumBase(ABC):
 38    """
 39    Abstract base for a thermo-(visco)elastic linear momentum solver on a DOLFINx mesh.
 40
 41    Sets up common FE spaces, measures, and fields; provides utilities for
 42    assembling body forces, computing invariants, and coordinating inelastic
 43    elements via the `Material` container. Concrete subclasses supply the
 44    variational forms and solve routines.
 45
 46    Parameters
 47    ----------
 48    grid : GridHandlerGMSH
 49        Mesh/grid handler that provides the DOLFINx mesh and meshtags.
 50    theta : float
 51        Time integration parameter: 0 for fully implicit, 0.5 for Crank-Nicolson, 1 for explicit.
 52
 53    Attributes
 54    ----------
 55    grid : GridHandlerGMSH
 56        Input grid handler.
 57    theta : float
 58        Time integration parameter.
 59    DG0_1, CG1_1 : dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
 60        Scalar DG0 (per element) and CG1 (per node) spaces.
 61    CG1_3x1 : dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
 62        Vector CG1 space of size equal to the spatial dimension.
 63    DG0_3x3, DG0_6x6 : dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
 64        Tensor DG0 spaces for 3×3 and 6×6 (Voigt) fields.
 65    n_elems : int
 66        Number of local+ghost elements.
 67    n_nodes : int
 68        Number of local+ghost nodes.
 69    u : dolfinx.fem.Function
 70        Displacement field (vector).
 71    sig, eps_tot : dolfinx.fem.Function
 72        Stress and total strain (DG0 3×3 tensors).
 73    q_nodes, q_elems, p_nodes, p_elems : dolfinx.fem.Function
 74        Von Mises magnitude and pressure in node/element spaces.
 75    Temp, T0 : torch.Tensor
 76        Current and reference temperatures per element, shape ``(n_elems,)``.
 77    normal : ufl.core.expr.Expr
 78        Test-function-weighted outward normal used for Neumann terms.
 79    ds, dx : ufl.Measure
 80        Boundary and domain measures with subdomain data.
 81    X : dolfinx.fem.Function
 82        Solution vector (same space as :meth:`get_uV()`).
 83    mat : Material
 84        Material container (set via :meth:`set_material`).
 85    solver : petsc4py.PETSc.KSP
 86        PETSc linear solver (set via :meth:`set_solver`).
 87    bc : BcHandler
 88        Boundary-condition handler (set via :meth:`set_boundary_conditions`).
 89    """
 90    def __init__(self, grid: GridHandlerGMSH, theta: float):
 91        self.grid = grid
 92        self.theta = theta
 93
 94        self.create_function_spaces()
 95        self.create_ds_dx()
 96
 97        self.n_elems = self.DG0_1.dofmap.index_map.size_local + len(self.DG0_1.dofmap.index_map.ghosts)
 98        self.n_nodes = self.CG1_1.dofmap.index_map.size_local + len(self.CG1_1.dofmap.index_map.ghosts)
 99
100        self.commom_fields()
101        self.create_fenicsx_fields()
102        self.create_pytorch_fields()
103
104    def commom_fields(self) -> None:
105        """
106        Allocate common storage for temperature, stresses, and strains.
107
108        Returns
109        -------
110        None
111
112        Side Effects
113        ------------
114        Initializes tensors/functions:
115        `T0`, `Temp`, `sig`, `eps_tot`, `u`, `q_elems`, `q_nodes`, `p_elems`, `p_nodes`.
116        """
117        self.T0 = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
118        self.Temp = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
119        self.sig = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_3x3)
120        self.eps_tot = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_3x3)
121        self.u = do.fem.Function(self.CG1_3x1)
122        self.q_elems = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
123        self.q_nodes = do.fem.Function(self.CG1_1)
124        self.p_elems = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
125        self.p_nodes = do.fem.Function(self.CG1_1)
126
127    def set_material(self, material: Material) -> None:
128        """
129        Attach a material model and initialize FE fields from it.
130
131        Parameters
132        ----------
133        material : Material
134            Material container with elastic and non-elastic elements.
135
136        Returns
137        -------
138        None
139
140        Side Effects
141        ------------
142        Calls :meth:`initialize`.
143        """
144        self.mat = material
145        self.initialize()
146
147    def set_T(self, T: to.Tensor) -> None:
148        """
149        Set the current element-wise temperature.
150
151        Parameters
152        ----------
153        T : torch.Tensor
154            Temperature per element, shape ``(n_elems,)``.
155
156        Returns
157        -------
158        None
159        """
160        self.Temp = T
161
162    def set_T0(self, T0: to.Tensor) -> None:
163        """
164        Set the reference element-wise temperature.
165
166        Parameters
167        ----------
168        T0 : torch.Tensor
169            Reference temperature per element, shape ``(n_elems,)``.
170
171        Returns
172        -------
173        None
174        """
175        self.T0 = T0
176
177    def set_solver(self, solver: PETSc.KSP) -> None:
178        """
179        Set the PETSc linear solver.
180
181        Parameters
182        ----------
183        solver : petsc4py.PETSc.KSP
184            Preconfigured Krylov solver.
185
186        Returns
187        -------
188        None
189        """
190        self.solver = solver
191
192    def set_boundary_conditions(self, bc: BcHandler) -> None:
193        """
194        Set the boundary-condition handler.
195
196        Parameters
197        ----------
198        bc : BcHandler
199            Handler providing Dirichlet/Neumann terms and updates.
200
201        Returns
202        -------
203        None
204        """
205        self.bc = bc
206
207    def create_function_spaces(self) -> None:
208        """
209        Create function spaces used by the formulation.
210
211        Returns
212        -------
213        None
214
215        Side Effects
216        ------------
217        Defines :attr:`CG1_3x1`, :attr:`DG0_1`, :attr:`CG1_1`,
218        :attr:`DG0_3x3`, and :attr:`DG0_6x6`.
219        """
220        self.CG1_3x1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("Lagrange", 1, (self.grid.domain_dim, )))
221        self.DG0_1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0))
222        self.CG1_1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("Lagrange", 1))
223        self.DG0_3x3 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0, (3, 3)))
224        self.DG0_6x6 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0, (6, 6)))
225
226    def create_ds_dx(self) -> None:
227        """
228        Create boundary and domain measures with subdomain data.
229
230        Returns
231        -------
232        None
233
234        Side Effects
235        ------------
236        Defines :attr:`ds` and :attr:`dx` from grid meshtags.
237        """
238        self.ds = ufl.Measure("ds", domain=self.grid.mesh, subdomain_data=self.grid.get_boundaries())
239        self.dx = ufl.Measure("dx", domain=self.grid.mesh, subdomain_data=self.grid.get_subdomains())
240
241    def create_normal(self) -> None:
242        """
243        Create a test-function-weighted outward normal for surface terms.
244
245        Returns
246        -------
247        None
248
249        Side Effects
250        ------------
251        Defines :attr:`normal` as ``dot(FacetNormal(mesh), self.u_)``.
252        """
253        n = ufl.FacetNormal(self.grid.mesh)
254        self.normal = ufl.dot(n, self.u_)
255
256    def build_body_force(self, g: list) -> None:
257        """
258        Build the body-force linear form ``∫ ρ g · u_ dx``.
259
260        Parameters
261        ----------
262        g : list of float
263            Gravity/body acceleration vector components.
264
265        Returns
266        -------
267        None
268
269        Side Effects
270        ------------
271        Defines :attr:`b_body` as a UFL form for the right-hand side.
272        """
273        density = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
274        density.x.array[:] = self.mat.density
275        body_force = density*do.fem.Constant(self.grid.mesh, do.default_scalar_type(tuple(g)))
276        self.b_body = ufl.dot(body_force, self.u_)*self.dx
277
278	# def compute_q_nodes(self) -> do.fem.Function:
279	# 	dev = self.sig - (1/3)*ufl.tr(self.sig)*ufl.Identity(3)
280	# 	q_form = ufl.sqrt((3/2)*ufl.inner(dev, dev))
281	# 	self.q_nodes = project(q_form, self.CG1_1)
282
283	# def compute_q_elems(self) -> do.fem.Function:
284	# 	dev = self.sig - (1/3)*ufl.tr(self.sig)*ufl.Identity(3)
285	# 	q_form = ufl.sqrt((3/2)*ufl.inner(dev, dev))
286	# 	self.q_elems = project(q_form, self.DG0_1)
287
288    def compute_q_nodes(self) -> None:
289        """
290        Compute von Mises equivalent stress and smooth it to nodes.
291
292        Returns
293        -------
294        None
295
296        Side Effects
297        ------------
298        Sets :attr:`q_nodes` by applying a node-element averaging matrix
299        (:attr:`grid.A_csr`) to the element-wise von Mises values.
300        """
301        stress = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
302        I1 = stress[:,0,0] + stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,2,2]
303        I2 = stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,1,1]*stress[:,2,2] + stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,2,2] - stress[:,0,1]**2 - stress[:,0,2]**2 - stress[:,1,2]**2
304        J2 = (1/3)*I1**2 - I2
305        q_to = to.sqrt(3*J2)
306        self.q_nodes.x.array[:] = self.grid.A_csr.dot(q_to.numpy())
307
308    def compute_q_elems(self) -> None:
309        """
310        Compute von Mises equivalent stress and smooth it to elements.
311
312        Returns
313        -------
314        None
315
316        Side Effects
317        ------------
318        Sets :attr:`q_elems` by applying :attr:`grid.smoother` to nodal values.
319        """
320        stress = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
321        I1 = stress[:,0,0] + stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,2,2]
322        I2 = stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,1,1]*stress[:,2,2] + stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,2,2] - stress[:,0,1]**2 - stress[:,0,2]**2 - stress[:,1,2]**2
323        J2 = (1/3)*I1**2 - I2
324        q_to = to.sqrt(3*J2)
325        self.q_elems.x.array[:] = self.grid.smoother.dot(q_to.numpy())
326
327    def compute_total_strain(self) -> to.Tensor:
328        """
329        Project total small-strain tensor to DG0 and return as torch.
330
331        Returns
332        -------
333        torch.Tensor
334            Total strain per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
335
336        Notes
337        -----
338        Uses :func:`project` on ``ε(u)``.
339        """
340        self.eps_tot = project(epsilon(self.u), self.DG0_3x3)
341        eps_to = numpy2torch(self.eps_tot.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
342        return eps_to
343
344    def compute_eps_th(self) -> to.Tensor:
345        """
346        Compute element-wise thermal strain by aggregating thermoelastic elements.
347
348        Returns
349        -------
350        torch.Tensor
351            Thermal strain per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
352        """
353        eps_th = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
354        deltaT = self.Temp - self.T0
355        for elem_th in self.mat.elems_th:
356        	elem_th.compute_eps_th(deltaT)
357        	eps_th += elem_th.eps_th
358        return eps_th
359
360    def compute_eps_ne_k(self, dt: float) -> to.Tensor:
361        """
362        Compute predictor of non-elastic strain at the previous iteration k.
363
364        Parameters
365        ----------
366        dt : float
367            Time-step size.
368
369        Returns
370        -------
371        torch.Tensor
372            Predicted non-elastic strain per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
373        """
374        eps_ne_k = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
375        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
376        	elem_ne.compute_eps_ne_k(dt*self.theta, dt*(1 - self.theta))
377        	eps_ne_k += elem_ne.eps_ne_k
378        return eps_ne_k
379
380    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
381        """
382        Update non-elastic strain rate for all non-elastic elements.
383
384        Parameters
385        ----------
386        stress : torch.Tensor
387            Stress per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
388        dt : float
389            Time-step size.
390
391        Returns
392        -------
393        None
394        """
395        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
396        	elem_ne.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress, dt*self.theta, self.Temp, return_eps_ne=False)
397
398    def update_eps_ne_rate_old(self) -> None:
399        """
400        Update non-elastic strain rate from the previous time step “old”.
401
402        Returns
403        -------
404        None
405        """
406        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
407        	elem_ne.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
408
409    def update_eps_ne_old(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
410        """
411        Update non-elastic strain tensor from the previous time step “old”.
412
413        Parameters
414        ----------
415        stress : torch.Tensor
416            Stress at current iteration k+1, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
417        stress_k : torch.Tensor
418            Stress from previous iteration k, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
419        dt : float
420            Time-step size.
421
422        Returns
423        -------
424        None
425        """
426        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
427        	elem_ne.update_eps_ne_old(stress, stress_k, dt*(1-self.theta))
428
429    def increment_internal_variables(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
430        """
431        Increment material internal variables (e.g., hardening).
432
433        Parameters
434        ----------
435        stress : torch.Tensor
436        stress_k : torch.Tensor
437        dt : float
438
439        Returns
440        -------
441        None
442        """
443        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
444        	elem_ne.increment_internal_variables(stress, stress_k, dt)
445
446    def update_internal_variables(self) -> None:
447        """
448        Commit internal variables at the end of a time step.
449
450        Returns
451        -------
452        None
453        """
454        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
455        	elem_ne.update_internal_variables()
456
457    def create_solution_vector(self) -> None:
458        """
459        Allocate the solution function `X` in the primary space.
460
461        Returns
462        -------
463        None
464
465        Side Effects
466        ------------
467        Sets :attr:`X` as a `dolfinx.fem.Function(self.V)`.
468        """
469        self.X = do.fem.Function(self.V)
470
471    def run_after_solve(self) -> None:
472        """
473        Optional hook called after each linear solve.
474
475        Returns
476        -------
477        None
478        """
479        pass
480
481    @abstractmethod
482    def compute_CT(self, dt: float, stress_k: to.Tensor):
483        """
484        Build the consistent tangent operator (per element).
485
486        Parameters
487        ----------
488        dt : float
489            Time-step size.
490        stress_k : torch.Tensor
491            Stress from previous iteration k, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
492
493        Returns
494        -------
495        None
496        """
497        pass
498
499    @abstractmethod
500    def compute_eps_rhs(self, dt: float, stress_k: to.Tensor, eps_k: to.Tensor):
501        """
502        Compute the right-hand-side strain term used in the linear form.
503
504        Parameters
505        ----------
506        dt : float
507            Time-step size.
508        stress_k : torch.Tensor
509            Intermediate stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
510        eps_k : torch.Tensor
511            Optional strain input for schemes that need it.
512
513        Returns
514        -------
515        None
516        """
517        pass
518
519    @abstractmethod
520    def compute_elastic_stress(self, eps_e: to.Tensor):
521        """
522        Compute elastic stress from elastic strain using `C`.
523
524        Parameters
525        ----------
526        eps_e : torch.Tensor
527            Elastic strain, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
528
529        Returns
530        -------
531        torch.Tensor
532            Stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
533        """
534        pass
535
536    @abstractmethod
537    def compute_stress(self, eps_tot: to.Tensor, eps_rhs: to.Tensor, p: to.Tensor):
538        """
539        Compute stress from total strain and RHS strain (and optionally pressure).
540
541        Parameters
542        ----------
543        eps_tot : torch.Tensor
544            Total strain, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
545        eps_rhs : torch.Tensor
546            RHS strain term, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
547        p : torch.Tensor
548            Optional pressure term.
549
550        Returns
551        -------
552        torch.Tensor
553            Stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
554        """
555        pass
556
557    @abstractmethod
558    def create_fenicsx_fields(self) -> None:
559        """
560        Create FE functions specific to the concrete formulation.
561
562        Returns
563        -------
564        None
565        """
566        pass
567
568    @abstractmethod
569    def create_pytorch_fields(self) -> None:
570        """
571        Create torch tensors specific to the concrete formulation.
572
573        Returns
574        -------
575        None
576        """
577        pass
578
579    @abstractmethod
580    def create_trial_test_functions(self) -> None:
581        """
582        Create UFL trial and test functions in the primary space.
583
584        Returns
585        -------
586        None
587        """
588        pass
589
590    @abstractmethod
591    def get_uV(self) -> do.fem.FunctionSpace:
592        """
593        Return the primary function space for displacements.
594
595        Returns
596        -------
597        dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
598            Vector function space used for `u`.
599        """
600        pass
601
602    @abstractmethod
603    def initialize(self) -> None:
604        """
605        Initialize FE fields from the material container.
606
607        Returns
608        -------
609        None
610        """
611        pass
612
613    @abstractmethod
614    def split_solution(self) -> None:
615        """
616        Assign the computed solution `X` to the primary field (e.g., `u`).
617
618        Returns
619        -------
620        None
621        """
622        pass
623
624    @abstractmethod
625    def split_solution(self) -> None:
626        """
627        Duplicate abstract declaration (kept for API compatibility).
628        """
629        pass
630
631    @abstractmethod
632    def compute_p_nodes(self) -> None:
633        """
634        Compute nodal pressure (mean stress) from the stress field.
635
636        Returns
637        -------
638        None
639        """
640        pass
641
642    @abstractmethod
643    def solve_elastic_response(self) -> None:
644        """
645        Solve the purely elastic problem (e.g., for initialization).
646
647        Returns
648        -------
649        None
650        """
651        pass
652
653    @abstractmethod
654    def solve(self) -> None:
655        """
656        Assemble and solve one step of the inelastic problem.
657
658        Returns
659        -------
660        None
661        """
662        pass

Abstract base for a thermo-(visco)elastic linear momentum solver on a DOLFINx mesh.

Sets up common FE spaces, measures, and fields; provides utilities for assembling body forces, computing invariants, and coordinating inelastic elements via the Material container. Concrete subclasses supply the variational forms and solve routines.

Parameters
  • grid (GridHandlerGMSH): Mesh/grid handler that provides the DOLFINx mesh and meshtags.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter: 0 for fully implicit, 0.5 for Crank-Nicolson, 1 for explicit.
Attributes
  • grid (GridHandlerGMSH): Input grid handler.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter.
  • DG0_1, CG1_1 (dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace): Scalar DG0 (per element) and CG1 (per node) spaces.
  • CG1_3x1 (dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace): Vector CG1 space of size equal to the spatial dimension.
  • DG0_3x3, DG0_6x6 (dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace): Tensor DG0 spaces for 3×3 and 6×6 (Voigt) fields.
  • n_elems (int): Number of local+ghost elements.
  • n_nodes (int): Number of local+ghost nodes.
  • u (dolfinx.fem.Function): Displacement field (vector).
  • sig, eps_tot (dolfinx.fem.Function): Stress and total strain (DG0 3×3 tensors).
  • q_nodes, q_elems, p_nodes, p_elems (dolfinx.fem.Function): Von Mises magnitude and pressure in node/element spaces.
  • Temp, T0 (torch.Tensor): Current and reference temperatures per element, shape (n_elems,).
  • normal (ufl.core.expr.Expr): Test-function-weighted outward normal used for Neumann terms.
  • ds, dx (ufl.Measure): Boundary and domain measures with subdomain data.
  • X (dolfinx.fem.Function): Solution vector (same space as get_uV()()).
  • mat (Material): Material container (set via set_material()).
  • solver (petsc4py.PETSc.KSP): PETSc linear solver (set via set_solver()).
  • bc (BcHandler): Boundary-condition handler (set via set_boundary_conditions()).
grid
theta
n_elems
n_nodes
def commom_fields(self) -> None: 
104    def commom_fields(self) -> None:
105        """
106        Allocate common storage for temperature, stresses, and strains.
107
108        Returns
109        -------
110        None
111
112        Side Effects
113        ------------
114        Initializes tensors/functions:
115        `T0`, `Temp`, `sig`, `eps_tot`, `u`, `q_elems`, `q_nodes`, `p_elems`, `p_nodes`.
116        """
117        self.T0 = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
118        self.Temp = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
119        self.sig = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_3x3)
120        self.eps_tot = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_3x3)
121        self.u = do.fem.Function(self.CG1_3x1)
122        self.q_elems = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
123        self.q_nodes = do.fem.Function(self.CG1_1)
124        self.p_elems = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
125        self.p_nodes = do.fem.Function(self.CG1_1)

Allocate common storage for temperature, stresses, and strains.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Initializes tensors/functions: T0, Temp, sig, eps_tot, u, q_elems, q_nodes, p_elems, p_nodes.

def set_material(self, material: Material) -> None: 
127    def set_material(self, material: Material) -> None:
128        """
129        Attach a material model and initialize FE fields from it.
130
131        Parameters
132        ----------
133        material : Material
134            Material container with elastic and non-elastic elements.
135
136        Returns
137        -------
138        None
139
140        Side Effects
141        ------------
142        Calls :meth:`initialize`.
143        """
144        self.mat = material
145        self.initialize()

Attach a material model and initialize FE fields from it.

Parameters
  • material (Material): Material container with elastic and non-elastic elements.
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Calls initialize().

def set_T(self, T: torch.Tensor) -> None: 
147    def set_T(self, T: to.Tensor) -> None:
148        """
149        Set the current element-wise temperature.
150
151        Parameters
152        ----------
153        T : torch.Tensor
154            Temperature per element, shape ``(n_elems,)``.
155
156        Returns
157        -------
158        None
159        """
160        self.Temp = T

Set the current element-wise temperature.

Parameters
  • T (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element, shape (n_elems,).
Returns
  • None

171        Returns

173        None
174        """

Set the reference element-wise temperature.

  • None

def set_boundary_conditions(self, bc: 'BcHandler') -> None:
