def create_function_spaces(self) -> None: 
207    def create_function_spaces(self) -> None:
208        """
209        Create function spaces used by the formulation.
210
211        Returns
212        -------
213        None
214
215        Side Effects
216        ------------
217        Defines :attr:`CG1_3x1`, :attr:`DG0_1`, :attr:`CG1_1`,
218        :attr:`DG0_3x3`, and :attr:`DG0_6x6`.
219        """
220        self.CG1_3x1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("Lagrange", 1, (self.grid.domain_dim, )))
221        self.DG0_1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0))
222        self.CG1_1 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("Lagrange", 1))
223        self.DG0_3x3 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0, (3, 3)))
224        self.DG0_6x6 = do.fem.functionspace(self.grid.mesh, ("DG", 0, (6, 6)))

Create function spaces used by the formulation.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Defines CG1_3x1, DG0_1, CG1_1, DG0_3x3, and DG0_6x6.

def create_ds_dx(self) -> None: 
226    def create_ds_dx(self) -> None:
227        """
228        Create boundary and domain measures with subdomain data.
229
230        Returns
231        -------
232        None
233
234        Side Effects
235        ------------
236        Defines :attr:`ds` and :attr:`dx` from grid meshtags.
237        """
238        self.ds = ufl.Measure("ds", domain=self.grid.mesh, subdomain_data=self.grid.get_boundaries())
239        self.dx = ufl.Measure("dx", domain=self.grid.mesh, subdomain_data=self.grid.get_subdomains())

Create boundary and domain measures with subdomain data.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Defines ds and dx from grid meshtags.

def create_normal(self) -> None: 
241    def create_normal(self) -> None:
242        """
243        Create a test-function-weighted outward normal for surface terms.
244
245        Returns
246        -------
247        None
248
249        Side Effects
250        ------------
251        Defines :attr:`normal` as ``dot(FacetNormal(mesh), self.u_)``.
252        """
253        n = ufl.FacetNormal(self.grid.mesh)
254        self.normal = ufl.dot(n, self.u_)

Create a test-function-weighted outward normal for surface terms.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Defines normal as dot(FacetNormal(mesh), self.u_).

def build_body_force(self, g: list) -> None: 
256    def build_body_force(self, g: list) -> None:
257        """
258        Build the body-force linear form ``∫ ρ g · u_ dx``.
259
260        Parameters
261        ----------
262        g : list of float
263            Gravity/body acceleration vector components.
264
265        Returns
266        -------
267        None
268
269        Side Effects
270        ------------
271        Defines :attr:`b_body` as a UFL form for the right-hand side.
272        """
273        density = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_1)
274        density.x.array[:] = self.mat.density
275        body_force = density*do.fem.Constant(self.grid.mesh, do.default_scalar_type(tuple(g)))
276        self.b_body = ufl.dot(body_force, self.u_)*self.dx

Build the body-force linear form ∫ ρ g · u_ dx.

Parameters
  • g (list of float): Gravity/body acceleration vector components.
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Defines b_body as a UFL form for the right-hand side.

def compute_q_nodes(self) -> None: 
288    def compute_q_nodes(self) -> None:
289        """
290        Compute von Mises equivalent stress and smooth it to nodes.
291
292        Returns
293        -------
294        None
295
296        Side Effects
297        ------------
298        Sets :attr:`q_nodes` by applying a node-element averaging matrix
299        (:attr:`grid.A_csr`) to the element-wise von Mises values.
300        """
301        stress = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
302        I1 = stress[:,0,0] + stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,2,2]
303        I2 = stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,1,1]*stress[:,2,2] + stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,2,2] - stress[:,0,1]**2 - stress[:,0,2]**2 - stress[:,1,2]**2
304        J2 = (1/3)*I1**2 - I2
305        q_to = to.sqrt(3*J2)
306        self.q_nodes.x.array[:] = self.grid.A_csr.dot(q_to.numpy())

Compute von Mises equivalent stress and smooth it to nodes.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets q_nodes by applying a node-element averaging matrix (grid.A_csr) to the element-wise von Mises values.

def compute_q_elems(self) -> None: 
308    def compute_q_elems(self) -> None:
309        """
310        Compute von Mises equivalent stress and smooth it to elements.
311
312        Returns
313        -------
314        None
315
316        Side Effects
317        ------------
318        Sets :attr:`q_elems` by applying :attr:`grid.smoother` to nodal values.
319        """
320        stress = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
321        I1 = stress[:,0,0] + stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,2,2]
322        I2 = stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,1,1]*stress[:,2,2] + stress[:,0,0]*stress[:,2,2] - stress[:,0,1]**2 - stress[:,0,2]**2 - stress[:,1,2]**2
323        J2 = (1/3)*I1**2 - I2
324        q_to = to.sqrt(3*J2)
325        self.q_elems.x.array[:] = self.grid.smoother.dot(q_to.numpy())

Compute von Mises equivalent stress and smooth it to elements.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets q_elems by applying grid.smoother to nodal values.

def compute_total_strain(self) -> torch.Tensor: 
327    def compute_total_strain(self) -> to.Tensor:
328        """
329        Project total small-strain tensor to DG0 and return as torch.
330
331        Returns
332        -------
333        torch.Tensor
334            Total strain per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
335
336        Notes
337        -----
338        Uses :func:`project` on ``ε(u)``.
339        """
340        self.eps_tot = project(epsilon(self.u), self.DG0_3x3)
341        eps_to = numpy2torch(self.eps_tot.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
342        return eps_to

Project total small-strain tensor to DG0 and return as torch.

Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Total strain per element, shape (n_elems, 3, 3).
Notes

Uses project() on ε(u).

def compute_eps_th(self) -> torch.Tensor: 
344    def compute_eps_th(self) -> to.Tensor:
345        """
346        Compute element-wise thermal strain by aggregating thermoelastic elements.
347
348        Returns
349        -------
350        torch.Tensor
351            Thermal strain per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
352        """
353        eps_th = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
354        deltaT = self.Temp - self.T0
355        for elem_th in self.mat.elems_th:
356        	elem_th.compute_eps_th(deltaT)
357        	eps_th += elem_th.eps_th
358        return eps_th

Compute element-wise thermal strain by aggregating thermoelastic elements.

Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Thermal strain per element, shape (n_elems, 3, 3).
def compute_eps_ne_k(self, dt: float) -> torch.Tensor: 
360    def compute_eps_ne_k(self, dt: float) -> to.Tensor:
361        """
362        Compute predictor of non-elastic strain at the previous iteration k.
363
364        Parameters
365        ----------
366        dt : float
367            Time-step size.
368
369        Returns
370        -------
371        torch.Tensor
372            Predicted non-elastic strain per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
373        """
374        eps_ne_k = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
375        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
376        	elem_ne.compute_eps_ne_k(dt*self.theta, dt*(1 - self.theta))
377        	eps_ne_k += elem_ne.eps_ne_k
378        return eps_ne_k

Compute predictor of non-elastic strain at the previous iteration k.

Parameters
  • dt (float): Time-step size.
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Predicted non-elastic strain per element, shape (n_elems, 3, 3).
def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float) -> None: 
380    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
381        """
382        Update non-elastic strain rate for all non-elastic elements.
383
384        Parameters
385        ----------
386        stress : torch.Tensor
387            Stress per element, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
388        dt : float
389            Time-step size.
390
391        Returns
392        -------
393        None
394        """
395        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
396        	elem_ne.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress, dt*self.theta, self.Temp, return_eps_ne=False)

Update non-elastic strain rate for all non-elastic elements.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (n_elems, 3, 3).
  • dt (float): Time-step size.
Returns
  • None

def update_eps_ne_old(self, stress: torch.Tensor, stress_k: torch.Tensor, dt: float) -> None: 
409    def update_eps_ne_old(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
410        """

412
413        Parameters

419        dt : float
420            Time-step size.
421
422        Returns
423        -------
424        None
425        """
426        for elem_ne in self.mat.elems_ne:
427        	elem_ne.update_eps_ne_old(stress, stress_k, dt*(1-self.theta))

  • None

@abstractmethod
def compute_stress(self, eps_tot: torch.Tensor, eps_rhs: torch.Tensor, p: torch.Tensor):

  • None
class LinearMomentum(safeincave.LinearMomentumBase): 
668class LinearMomentum(LinearMomentumBase):
669    """
670    Linear momentum formulation with thermo-(visco)elastic tangent.
671
672    Implements the concrete FE fields, consistent tangent assembly, right-hand
673    side strain, and linear solves for both elastic and inelastic steps.
674    """
675    def __init__(self, grid: GridHandlerGMSH, theta: float):
676        """
677        Initialize spaces, measures, fields, and solution vector.
678
679        Parameters
680        ----------
681        grid : GridHandlerGMSH
682        theta : float
683        """
684        super().__init__(grid, theta)
685        self.V = self.CG1_3x1
686        self.create_trial_test_functions()
687        self.create_normal()
688        self.create_solution_vector()
689
690    def create_fenicsx_fields(self) -> None:
691        """
692        Allocate FE functions specific to this formulation.
693
694        Returns
695        -------
696        None
697
698        Side Effects
699        ------------
700        Creates :attr:`C`, :attr:`CT` (DG0 6×6 tangents), and :attr:`eps_rhs`
701        (DG0 3×3 RHS strain).
702        """
703        self.C = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_6x6)
704        self.CT = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_6x6)
705        self.eps_rhs = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_3x3)
706
707    def create_pytorch_fields(self) -> None:
708        """
709        Allocate torch tensors specific to this formulation.
710
711        Returns
712        -------
713        None
714
715        Side Effects
716        ------------
717        Creates :attr:`eps_rhs_to` with shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
718        """
719        self.eps_rhs_to = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3))
720
721    def create_trial_test_functions(self) -> None:
722        """
723        Create UFL trial/test functions for displacement.
724
725        Returns
726        -------
727        None
728
729        Side Effects
730        ------------
731        Defines :attr:`du` (trial) and :attr:`u_` (test) in :attr:`V`.
732        """
733        self.du = ufl.TrialFunction(self.V)
734        self.u_ = ufl.TestFunction(self.V)
735
736    def get_uV(self) -> do.fem.FunctionSpace:
737        """
738        Return the primary displacement function space.
739
740        Returns
741        -------
742        dolfinx.fem.FunctionSpace
743        """
744        return self.V
745
746    def initialize(self) -> None:
747        """
748        Initialize elastic tangent from the material container.
749
750        Returns
751        -------
752        None
753
754        Side Effects
755        ------------
756        Flattens and copies `mat.C` into :attr:`C`.
757        """
758        self.C.x.array[:] = to.flatten(self.mat.C)
759
760    def compute_CT(self, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
761        """
762        Assemble consistent tangent operator `CT` for the current step.
763
764        Parameters
765        ----------
766        stress_k : torch.Tensor
767            Stress from previous iteration k, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
768        dt : float
769            Time-step size.
770
771        Returns
772        -------
773        None
774
775        Side Effects
776        ------------
777        Updates material operators (`G`, `B`, `CT`) and copies to FE field :attr:`CT`.
778        """
779        self.mat.compute_G_B(stress_k, dt, self.theta, self.Temp)
780        self.mat.compute_CT(dt, self.theta)
781        self.CT.x.array[:] = to.flatten(self.mat.CT)
782
783    def compute_elastic_stress(self, eps_e: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
784        """
785        Compute elastic Cauchy stress using the elastic stiffness `C`.
786
787        Parameters
788        ----------
789        eps_e : torch.Tensor
790            Elastic strain, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
791
792        Returns
793        -------
794        torch.Tensor
795            Stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
796
797        Side Effects
798        ------------
799        Copies the stress into :attr:`sig`.
800        """
801        stress_to = dotdot_torch(self.mat.C, eps_e)
802        self.sig.x.array[:] = to.flatten(stress_to)
803        return stress_to
804
805    def compute_stress(self, eps_tot_to: to.Tensor, *_) -> to.Tensor:
806        """
807        Compute stress using the consistent tangent and RHS strain.
808
809        Parameters
810        ----------
811        eps_tot_to : torch.Tensor
812            Total strain, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
813        *_
814            Unused extra arguments (kept for signature compatibility).
815
816        Returns
817        -------
818        torch.Tensor
819            Stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
820
821        Side Effects
822        ------------
823        Copies the stress into :attr:`sig`.
824        """
825        stress_to = dotdot_torch(self.mat.CT, eps_tot_to - self.eps_rhs_to)
826        self.sig.x.array[:] = to.flatten(stress_to)
827        return stress_to
828
829    def compute_eps_rhs(self, dt: float, stress_k: to.Tensor) -> None:
830        """
831        Compute the right-hand-side strain term for the variational form.
832
833        Parameters
834        ----------
835        dt : float
836            Time-step size.
837        stress_k : torch.Tensor
838            Intermediate stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
839
840        Returns
841        -------
842        None
843
844        Side Effects
845        ------------
846        Sets :attr:`eps_rhs_to` (torch) and :attr:`eps_rhs` (FE field).
847        """
848        eps_ne_k = self.compute_eps_ne_k(dt)
849        eps_th = self.compute_eps_th()
850        self.eps_rhs_to = eps_ne_k + eps_th - dt*(1 - self.theta)*(self.mat.B + dotdot_torch(self.mat.G, stress_k))
851        self.eps_rhs.x.array[:] = to.flatten(self.eps_rhs_to)
852
853    def solve_elastic_response(self) -> None:
854        """
855        Solve the purely elastic boundary-value problem.
856
857        Returns
858        -------
859        None
860
861        Side Effects
862        ------------
863        - Assembles and solves the linear system with :math:`C`.
864        - Updates :attr:`X` and calls :meth:`split_solution`.
865        """
866        # Build bilinear form
867        a = ufl.inner(dotdot_ufl(self.C, epsilon(self.du)), epsilon(self.u_))*self.dx
868        bilinear_form = do.fem.form(a)
869        A = do.fem.petsc.assemble_matrix(bilinear_form, bcs=self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
870        A.assemble()
871
872        # Build linear form
873        linear_form = do.fem.form(self.b_body + sum(self.bc.neumann_bcs))
874        b = fem_petsc.assemble_vector(linear_form)
875        fem_petsc.apply_lifting(b, [bilinear_form], [self.bc.dirichlet_bcs])
876        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.ADD_VALUES, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.REVERSE)
877        fem_petsc.set_bc(b, self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
878        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.INSERT, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.FORWARD)
879
880        # Solve linear system
881        self.solver.setOperators(A)
882        self.solver.solve(b, self.X.x.petsc_vec)
883        self.X.x.scatter_forward()
884        self.split_solution()
885
886    def split_solution(self) -> None:
887        """
888        Assign displacement solution `X` to the primary field `u`.
889
890        Returns
891        -------
892        None
893        """
894        self.u = self.X
895
896	# def compute_p_nodes(self) -> do.fem.Function:
897	# 	self.p_nodes = project(ufl.tr(self.sig)/3, self.CG1_1)
898
899	# def compute_p_elems(self) -> do.fem.Function:
900	# 	# self.p_elems = project(ufl.tr(self.sig)/3, self.DG0_1)
901	# 	stress_to = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
902	# 	p_to = to.einsum("kii->k", stress_to)
903	# 	self.p_elems.x.array[:] = to.flatten(p_to)
904
905    def compute_p_nodes(self) -> None:
906        """
907        Compute nodal pressure ``p = tr(σ)/3`` via node-element averaging.
908
909        Returns
910        -------
911        None
912
913        Side Effects
914        ------------
915        Writes to :attr:`p_nodes`.
916        """
917        stress = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
918        I1 = stress[:,0,0] + stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,2,2]
919        p_to = I1/3
920        self.p_nodes.x.array[:] = self.grid.A_csr.dot(p_to)
921
922    def compute_p_elems(self) -> None:
923        """
924        Compute element pressure by smoothing the nodal trace of stress.
925
926        Returns
927        -------
928        None
929
930        Side Effects
931        ------------
932        Writes to :attr:`p_elems`.
933        """
934        stress_to = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
935        p_to = to.einsum("kii->k", stress_to)
936        p_to = self.grid.smoother.dot(p_to.numpy())
937        self.p_elems.x.array[:] = p_to
938
939    def solve(self, stress_k_to: to.Tensor, t: float, dt: float) -> None:
940        """
941        Assemble and solve one implicit time step for the inelastic problem.
942
943        Parameters
944        ----------
945        stress_k_to : torch.Tensor
946            Stress at previous iteration k, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
947        t : float
948            Current time (used by BC handler externally).
949        dt : float
950            Time-step size.
951
952        Returns
953        -------
954        None
955
956        Side Effects
957        ------------
958        - Builds `CT` and `eps_rhs`, assembles and solves the linear system.
959        - Updates :attr:`X`, calls :meth:`split_solution`, then :meth:`run_after_solve`.
960        """
961
962        # Compute consistent tangent matrix
963        self.compute_CT(stress_k_to, dt)
964
965        # Compute right-hand side epsilon
966        self.compute_eps_rhs(dt, stress_k_to)
967
968        # Build bilinear form
969        a = ufl.inner(dotdot_ufl(self.CT, epsilon(self.du)), epsilon(self.u_))*self.dx
970        bilinear_form = do.fem.form(a)
971        A = fem_petsc.assemble_matrix(bilinear_form, bcs=self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
972        A.assemble()
973
974        # Build linear form
975        b_rhs = ufl.inner(dotdot_ufl(self.CT, self.eps_rhs), epsilon(self.u_))*self.dx
976        linear_form = do.fem.form(self.b_body + sum(self.bc.neumann_bcs) + b_rhs)
977        b = fem_petsc.assemble_vector(linear_form)
978        fem_petsc.apply_lifting(b, [bilinear_form], [self.bc.dirichlet_bcs])
979        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.ADD_VALUES, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.REVERSE)
980        fem_petsc.set_bc(b, self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
981        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.INSERT, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.FORWARD)
982
983        # Solve linear system
984        self.solver.setOperators(A)
985        self.solver.solve(b, self.X.x.petsc_vec)
986        self.X.x.scatter_forward()
987        self.split_solution()
988
989        self.run_after_solve()

Linear momentum formulation with thermo-(visco)elastic tangent.

Implements the concrete FE fields, consistent tangent assembly, right-hand side strain, and linear solves for both elastic and inelastic steps.

LinearMomentum(grid: GridHandlerGMSH, theta: float) 
675    def __init__(self, grid: GridHandlerGMSH, theta: float):
676        """
677        Initialize spaces, measures, fields, and solution vector.
678
679        Parameters
680        ----------
681        grid : GridHandlerGMSH
682        theta : float
683        """
684        super().__init__(grid, theta)
685        self.V = self.CG1_3x1
686        self.create_trial_test_functions()
687        self.create_normal()
688        self.create_solution_vector()

Initialize spaces, measures, fields, and solution vector.

Parameters

  • grid (GridHandlerGMSH):

  • theta (float):

V
def create_fenicsx_fields(self) -> None: 
690    def create_fenicsx_fields(self) -> None:
691        """
692        Allocate FE functions specific to this formulation.
693
694        Returns
695        -------
696        None
697
698        Side Effects
699        ------------
700        Creates :attr:`C`, :attr:`CT` (DG0 6×6 tangents), and :attr:`eps_rhs`
701        (DG0 3×3 RHS strain).
702        """
703        self.C = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_6x6)
704        self.CT = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_6x6)
705        self.eps_rhs = do.fem.Function(self.DG0_3x3)

Allocate FE functions specific to this formulation.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Creates C, CT (DG0 6×6 tangents), and eps_rhs (DG0 3×3 RHS strain).

def create_pytorch_fields(self) -> None: 
707    def create_pytorch_fields(self) -> None:
708        """
709        Allocate torch tensors specific to this formulation.
710
711        Returns
712        -------
713        None
714
715        Side Effects
716        ------------
717        Creates :attr:`eps_rhs_to` with shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
718        """
719        self.eps_rhs_to = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3))

Side Effects

def create_trial_test_functions(self) -> None: 
721    def create_trial_test_functions(self) -> None:
722        """
723        Create UFL trial/test functions for displacement.
724
725        Returns
726        -------
727        None
728
729        Side Effects
730        ------------
731        Defines :attr:`du` (trial) and :attr:`u_` (test) in :attr:`V`.
732        """
733        self.du = ufl.TrialFunction(self.V)
734        self.u_ = ufl.TestFunction(self.V)

Returns

def initialize(self) -> None:

def compute_CT(self, stress_k: torch.Tensor, dt: float) -> None: 
760    def compute_CT(self, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
761        """
762        Assemble consistent tangent operator `CT` for the current step.
763
764        Parameters
765        ----------
766        stress_k : torch.Tensor
767            Stress from previous iteration k, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
768        dt : float
769            Time-step size.
770
771        Returns
772        -------
773        None
774
775        Side Effects
776        ------------
777        Updates material operators (`G`, `B`, `CT`) and copies to FE field :attr:`CT`.
778        """
779        self.mat.compute_G_B(stress_k, dt, self.theta, self.Temp)
780        self.mat.compute_CT(dt, self.theta)
781        self.CT.x.array[:] = to.flatten(self.mat.CT)

Assemble consistent tangent operator CT for the current step.

Parameters
  • stress_k (torch.Tensor): Stress from previous iteration k, shape (n_elems, 3, 3).
  • dt (float): Time-step size.
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Updates material operators (G, B, CT) and copies to FE field CT.

def compute_elastic_stress(self, eps_e: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor: 
783    def compute_elastic_stress(self, eps_e: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:

796
797        Side Effects
798        ------------
799        Copies the stress into :attr:`sig`.
800        """
801        stress_to = dotdot_torch(self.mat.C, eps_e)
802        self.sig.x.array[:] = to.flatten(stress_to)
803        return stress_to

def compute_stress(self, eps_tot_to: torch.Tensor, *_) -> torch.Tensor: 
805    def compute_stress(self, eps_tot_to: to.Tensor, *_) -> to.Tensor:
806        """
807        Compute stress using the consistent tangent and RHS strain.
808
809        Parameters
810        ----------

813        *_

815

824        """

def compute_eps_rhs(self, dt: float, stress_k: torch.Tensor) -> None: 
829    def compute_eps_rhs(self, dt: float, stress_k: to.Tensor) -> None:
830        """
831        Compute the right-hand-side strain term for the variational form.
832
833        Parameters
834        ----------
835        dt : float
836            Time-step size.
837        stress_k : torch.Tensor
838            Intermediate stress, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
839
840        Returns
841        -------
842        None
843
844        Side Effects
845        ------------
846        Sets :attr:`eps_rhs_to` (torch) and :attr:`eps_rhs` (FE field).
847        """
848        eps_ne_k = self.compute_eps_ne_k(dt)
849        eps_th = self.compute_eps_th()
850        self.eps_rhs_to = eps_ne_k + eps_th - dt*(1 - self.theta)*(self.mat.B + dotdot_torch(self.mat.G, stress_k))
851        self.eps_rhs.x.array[:] = to.flatten(self.eps_rhs_to)

def solve_elastic_response(self) -> None: 
853    def solve_elastic_response(self) -> None:
854        """
855        Solve the purely elastic boundary-value problem.
856
857        Returns
858        -------
859        None
860
861        Side Effects
862        ------------
863        - Assembles and solves the linear system with :math:`C`.
864        - Updates :attr:`X` and calls :meth:`split_solution`.
865        """
866        # Build bilinear form
867        a = ufl.inner(dotdot_ufl(self.C, epsilon(self.du)), epsilon(self.u_))*self.dx
868        bilinear_form = do.fem.form(a)
869        A = do.fem.petsc.assemble_matrix(bilinear_form, bcs=self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
870        A.assemble()
871
872        # Build linear form
873        linear_form = do.fem.form(self.b_body + sum(self.bc.neumann_bcs))
874        b = fem_petsc.assemble_vector(linear_form)
875        fem_petsc.apply_lifting(b, [bilinear_form], [self.bc.dirichlet_bcs])
876        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.ADD_VALUES, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.REVERSE)
877        fem_petsc.set_bc(b, self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
878        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.INSERT, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.FORWARD)
879
880        # Solve linear system
881        self.solver.setOperators(A)
882        self.solver.solve(b, self.X.x.petsc_vec)
883        self.X.x.scatter_forward()
884        self.split_solution()

Solve the purely elastic boundary-value problem.

Returns

def compute_p_nodes(self) -> None: 
905    def compute_p_nodes(self) -> None:
906        """
907        Compute nodal pressure ``p = tr(σ)/3`` via node-element averaging.
908
909        Returns
910        -------
911        None
912
913        Side Effects
914        ------------
915        Writes to :attr:`p_nodes`.
916        """
917        stress = numpy2torch(self.sig.x.array.reshape((self.n_elems, 3, 3)))
918        I1 = stress[:,0,0] + stress[:,1,1] + stress[:,2,2]
919        p_to = I1/3
920        self.p_nodes.x.array[:] = self.grid.A_csr.dot(p_to)

Compute nodal pressure p = tr(σ)/3 via node-element averaging.

def compute_p_elems(self) -> None: 
922    def compute_p_elems(self) -> None:
923        """
924        Compute element pressure by smoothing the nodal trace of stress.
925

927        -------
928        None
929
930        Side Effects
931        ------------
932        Writes to :attr:`p_elems`.
933        """

935        p_to = to.einsum("kii->k", stress_to)
936        p_to = self.grid.smoother.dot(p_to.numpy())
937        self.p_elems.x.array[:] = p_to

def solve(self, stress_k_to: torch.Tensor, t: float, dt: float) -> None: 
939    def solve(self, stress_k_to: to.Tensor, t: float, dt: float) -> None:
940        """
941        Assemble and solve one implicit time step for the inelastic problem.
942
943        Parameters
944        ----------
945        stress_k_to : torch.Tensor
946            Stress at previous iteration k, shape ``(n_elems, 3, 3)``.
947        t : float
948            Current time (used by BC handler externally).
949        dt : float
950            Time-step size.
951
952        Returns
953        -------
954        None
955
956        Side Effects
957        ------------
958        - Builds `CT` and `eps_rhs`, assembles and solves the linear system.
959        - Updates :attr:`X`, calls :meth:`split_solution`, then :meth:`run_after_solve`.
960        """
961
962        # Compute consistent tangent matrix
963        self.compute_CT(stress_k_to, dt)
964
965        # Compute right-hand side epsilon
966        self.compute_eps_rhs(dt, stress_k_to)
967
968        # Build bilinear form
969        a = ufl.inner(dotdot_ufl(self.CT, epsilon(self.du)), epsilon(self.u_))*self.dx
970        bilinear_form = do.fem.form(a)
971        A = fem_petsc.assemble_matrix(bilinear_form, bcs=self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
972        A.assemble()
973
974        # Build linear form
975        b_rhs = ufl.inner(dotdot_ufl(self.CT, self.eps_rhs), epsilon(self.u_))*self.dx
976        linear_form = do.fem.form(self.b_body + sum(self.bc.neumann_bcs) + b_rhs)
977        b = fem_petsc.assemble_vector(linear_form)
978        fem_petsc.apply_lifting(b, [bilinear_form], [self.bc.dirichlet_bcs])
979        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.ADD_VALUES, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.REVERSE)
980        fem_petsc.set_bc(b, self.bc.dirichlet_bcs)
981        b.ghostUpdate(addv=PETSc.InsertMode.INSERT, mode=PETSc.ScatterMode.FORWARD)
982
983        # Solve linear system
984        self.solver.setOperators(A)
985        self.solver.solve(b, self.X.x.petsc_vec)
986        self.X.x.scatter_forward()
987        self.split_solution()
988
989        self.run_after_solve()

Assemble and solve one implicit time step for the inelastic problem.

Parameters
  • stress_k_to (torch.Tensor): Stress at previous iteration k, shape (n_elems, 3, 3).
  • t (float): Current time (used by BC handler externally).
  • dt (float): Time-step size.
Returns
  • None
Side Effects
  • Builds CT and eps_rhs, assembles and solves the linear system.
  • Updates X, calls split_solution(), then run_after_solve().
class Material: 
 23class Material():
 24	"""
 25    Composite material model that aggregates elastic, thermoelastic,
 26    and non-elastic (e.g., viscoelastic/viscoplastic) elements.
 27
 28    The class stores element-wise stiffness operators in Voigt form
 29    and assembles effective operators used during constitutive updates.
 30
 31    Parameters
 32    ----------
 33    n_elems : int
 34        Number of finite elements (batch size).
 35
 36    Attributes
 37    ----------
 38    n_elems : int
 39        Number of elements.
 40    elems_ne : list[NonElasticElement]
 41        Collection of non-elastic elements contributing to non-elastic response.
 42    elems_th : list[Thermoelastic]
 43        Collection of thermoelastic contributors (thermal strain).
 44    elems_e : list[Spring]
 45        Collection of elastic contributors (linear isotropic springs).
 46    C_inv, C : torch.Tensor
 47        Element-wise stiffness (and inverse) in tensorial Voigt form, shape (N, 6, 6).
 48    C_tilde_inv, C_tilde : torch.Tensor
 49        Element-wise deviatoric stiffness (and inverse), shape (N, 6, 6).
 50    G, B : torch.Tensor
 51        Assembled non-elastic tangent-like (G) and state variable (B) operators, shapes
 52        (N, 6, 6) and (N, 3, 3).
 53    IT, T : torch.Tensor
 54        Volumetric coupling tensors assembled from non-elastic elements.
 55    B_vol, T_vol : torch.Tensor
 56        Element-wise volumetric parts (scalars), shape (N,).
 57    G_tilde, B_tilde : torch.Tensor
 58        Deviatoric parts of G and B, shapes (N, 6, 6) and (N, 3, 3).
 59    CT, CT_tilde : torch.Tensor
 60        Effective consistent tangents after time integration, shapes (N, 6, 6).
 61    density, cp, k, alpha_th : torch.Tensor
 62        Optional material properties (per element).
 63
 64    Notes
 65    -----
 66    - Voigt ordering is assumed to be `[xx, yy, zz, xy, xz, yz]` with
 67      **tensorial shear** convention (no engineering factors).
 68    """
 69	def __init__(self, n_elems: int):
 70		self.n_elems = n_elems
 71		self.elems_ne = []
 72		self.elems_th = []
 73		self.elems_e = []
 74
 75		self.C_inv = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
 76		self.C = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
 77
 78		self.C_tilde_inv = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
 79		self.C_tilde = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
 80
 81	def set_density(self, density: to.Tensor) -> None:
 82		"""
 83        Set mass density per element.
 84
 85        Parameters
 86        ----------
 87        density : torch.Tensor
 88            1D tensor of shape (N,) with densities.
 89        """
 90		self.density = density
 91
 92	def set_specific_heat_capacity(self, cp: to.Tensor) -> None:
 93		"""
 94        Set specific heat capacity per element.
 95
 96        Parameters
 97        ----------
 98        cp : torch.Tensor
 99            1D tensor of shape (N,) with specific heat capacities.
100        """
101		self.cp = cp
102
103	def set_thermal_conductivity(self, k: to.Tensor) -> None:
104		"""
105        Set thermal conductivity per element.
106
107        Parameters
108        ----------
109        k : torch.Tensor
110            1D tensor of shape (N,) with conductivities.
111        """
112		self.k = k
113
114	def set_thermal_expansion(self, alpha_th: to.Tensor) -> None:
115		"""
116        Set coefficient of thermal expansion per element.
117
118        Parameters
119        ----------
120        alpha_th : torch.Tensor
121            1D tensor of shape (N,) with linear thermal expansion coefficients.
122        """
123		self.alpha_th = alpha_th
124
125
126	def add_to_elastic(self, elem: Spring):
127		"""
128        Add an elastic (linear isotropic) contributor and accumulate stiffness.
129
130        Parameters
131        ----------
132        elem : Spring
133            Elastic element. Its `initialize()` is called inside.
134
135        Side Effects
136        ------------
137        - Updates `C`, `C_inv`, `C_tilde`, `C_tilde_inv` by addition.
138        - Stores `K`, `E`, and shear modulus estimate `ShearMod`.
139        - Appends `elem` to `elems_e`.
140        """
141		elem.initialize()
142		self.C_inv += elem.C_inv
143		self.C += elem.C
144		self.C_tilde_inv += elem.C_tilde_inv
145		self.C_tilde += elem.C_tilde
146		self.elems_e.append(elem)
147		self.K = elem.K
148		self.E = elem.E
149		self.ShearMod = 3*self.K*self.E/(9*self.K - self.E)
150
151	def add_to_non_elastic(self, elem: NonElasticElement) -> None:
152		"""
153        Add a non-elastic element contributor.
154
155        Parameters
156        ----------
157        elem : NonElasticElement
158            Inelastic mechanism (e.g., creep, viscoplasticity).
159        """
160		self.elems_ne.append(elem)
161
162	def add_to_thermoelastic(self, elem: Thermoelastic) -> None:
163		"""
164        Add a thermoelastic contributor.
165
166        Parameters
167        ----------
168        elem : Thermoelastic
169            Provides thermal strain contributions.
170        """
171		self.elems_th.append(elem)
172
173	def compute_G_B(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, T: to.Tensor) -> None:
174		"""
175        Assemble non-elastic operators G and B over all inelastic elements.
176
177        Parameters
178        ----------
179        stress : torch.Tensor
180            Current Cauchy stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
181        dt : float
182            Time step size.
183        theta : float
184            Time integration parameter: 0 for fully implicit, 0.5 for Crank-Nicolson, 1 for explicit.
185        T : torch.Tensor
186            Temperature per element (shape (N,) or compatible).
187
188        Returns
189        -------
190        None
191
192        Side Effects
193        ------------
194        Sets `self.G` (N,6,6) and `self.B` (N,3,3) as sums of element contributions.
195        """
196		self.G = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
197		self.B = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
198		for elem_ne in self.elems_ne:
199			elem_ne.compute_G_B(stress, dt, theta, T)
200			self.G += elem_ne.G
201			self.B += elem_ne.B
202
203	def compute_T_IT(self) -> None:
204		"""
205        Assemble volumetric coupling tensors T and IT from inelastic elements.
206
207        Returns
208        -------
209        None
210
211        Side Effects
212        ------------
213        Sets `self.T` (N,3,3) and `self.IT` (N,6,6) as sums of element contributions.
214        """
215		self.IT = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
216		self.T = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
217		for elem_ne in self.elems_ne:
218			elem_ne.compute_T_IT()
219			self.IT += elem_ne.IT
220			self.T += elem_ne.T
221
222	def compute_Bvol_Tvol(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
223		"""
224        Compute volumetric parts of B and T.
225
226        Parameters
227        ----------
228        stress : torch.Tensor
229            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3). (Not used directly here.)
230        dt : float
231            Time step size. (Not used directly here.)
232
233        Returns
234        -------
235        None
236
237        Side Effects
238        ------------
239        Sets `self.B_vol` and `self.T_vol` (shape (N,)) from element contributions.
240        """
241		self.B_vol = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
242		self.T_vol = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
243		for elem_ne in self.elems_ne:
244			elem_ne.compute_Bvol_Tvol()
245			self.B_vol += elem_ne.B_vol
246			self.T_vol += elem_ne.T_vol
247
248	def compute_Gtilde_Btilde(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> None:
249		"""
250        Compute deviatoric parts of G and B.
251
252        Parameters
253        ----------
254        stress : torch.Tensor
255            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3). (Not used directly here.)
256        dt : float
257            Time step size. (Not used directly here.)
258
259        Returns
260        -------
261        None
262
263        Side Effects
264        ------------
265        Sets `self.G_tilde` and `self.B_tilde` (N,6,6) and (N,3,3).
266        """
267		self.G_tilde = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
268		self.B_tilde = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
269		for elem_ne in self.elems_ne:
270			elem_ne.compute_Gtilde_Btilde()
271			self.G_tilde += elem_ne.G_tilde
272			self.B_tilde += elem_ne.B_tilde
273
274	def compute_CT(self, dt: float, theta: float) -> None:
275		"""
276        Compute consistent tangent `CT = (C_inv + dt*(1-theta)*G)^{-1}`.
277
278        Parameters
279        ----------
280        dt : float
281            Time step size.
282        theta : float
283            Time integration parameter: 0 for fully implicit, 0.5 for Crank-Nicolson, 1 for explicit.
284
285        Returns
286        -------
287        None
288
289        Side Effects
290        ------------
291        Sets `self.CT` (N, 6, 6).
292        """
293		self.CT = to.linalg.inv(self.C_inv + dt*(1-theta)*self.G)
294
295	def compute_CT_tilde(self, dt: float, theta: float) -> None:
296		"""
297        Compute deviatoric consistent tangent `CT_tilde`.
298
299        Parameters
300        ----------
301        dt : float
302            Time step size.
303        theta : float
304            Time integration parameter in [0, 1].
305
306        Returns
307        -------
308        None
309
310        Side Effects
311        ------------
312        Sets `self.CT_tilde` (N, 6, 6).
313        """
314		self.CT_tilde = to.linalg.inv(self.C_tilde_inv + dt*(1-theta)*self.G_tilde)

Composite material model that aggregates elastic, thermoelastic, and non-elastic (e.g., viscoelastic/viscoplastic) elements.

The class stores element-wise stiffness operators in Voigt form and assembles effective operators used during constitutive updates.

Parameters
  • n_elems (int): Number of finite elements (batch size).
Attributes
  • n_elems (int): Number of elements.
  • elems_ne (list[NonElasticElement]): Collection of non-elastic elements contributing to non-elastic response.
  • elems_th (list[Thermoelastic]): Collection of thermoelastic contributors (thermal strain).
  • elems_e (list[Spring]): Collection of elastic contributors (linear isotropic springs).
  • C_inv, C (torch.Tensor): Element-wise stiffness (and inverse) in tensorial Voigt form, shape (N, 6, 6).
  • C_tilde_inv, C_tilde (torch.Tensor): Element-wise deviatoric stiffness (and inverse), shape (N, 6, 6).
  • G, B (torch.Tensor): Assembled non-elastic tangent-like (G) and state variable (B) operators, shapes (N, 6, 6) and (N, 3, 3).
  • IT, T (torch.Tensor): Volumetric coupling tensors assembled from non-elastic elements.
  • B_vol, T_vol (torch.Tensor): Element-wise volumetric parts (scalars), shape (N,).
  • G_tilde, B_tilde (torch.Tensor): Deviatoric parts of G and B, shapes (N, 6, 6) and (N, 3, 3).
  • CT, CT_tilde (torch.Tensor): Effective consistent tangents after time integration, shapes (N, 6, 6).
  • density, cp, k, alpha_th (torch.Tensor): Optional material properties (per element).
Notes
  • Voigt ordering is assumed to be [xx, yy, zz, xy, xz, yz] with tensorial shear convention (no engineering factors).
Material(n_elems: int) 
69	def __init__(self, n_elems: int):
70		self.n_elems = n_elems
71		self.elems_ne = []
72		self.elems_th = []
73		self.elems_e = []
74
75		self.C_inv = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
76		self.C = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
77
78		self.C_tilde_inv = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
79		self.C_tilde = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
n_elems

elems_th
elems_e

C
C_tilde_inv
C_tilde

def compute_G_B( self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, T: torch.Tensor) -> None: 
173	def compute_G_B(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, T: to.Tensor) -> None:
174		"""
175        Assemble non-elastic operators G and B over all inelastic elements.
176
177        Parameters
178        ----------
179        stress : torch.Tensor
180            Current Cauchy stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
181        dt : float
182            Time step size.
183        theta : float
184            Time integration parameter: 0 for fully implicit, 0.5 for Crank-Nicolson, 1 for explicit.
185        T : torch.Tensor
186            Temperature per element (shape (N,) or compatible).
187
188        Returns
189        -------
190        None
191
192        Side Effects
193        ------------
194        Sets `self.G` (N,6,6) and `self.B` (N,3,3) as sums of element contributions.
195        """
196		self.G = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
197		self.B = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
198		for elem_ne in self.elems_ne:
199			elem_ne.compute_G_B(stress, dt, theta, T)
200			self.G += elem_ne.G
201			self.B += elem_ne.B

  • dt (float): Time step size.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter: 0 for fully implicit, 0.5 for Crank-Nicolson, 1 for explicit.
  • T (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (shape (N,) or compatible).
Returns

Side Effects

def compute_CT(self, dt: float, theta: float) -> None:

class NonElasticElement(abc.ABC): 
527class NonElasticElement(ABC):
528    """
529    Abstract base for inelastic mechanisms (e.g., viscoelasticity,
530    dislocation creep, viscoplasticity). Provides common storage
531    and utility updates for internal variables.
532
533    Parameters
534    ----------
535    n_elems : int
536        Number of elements.
537
538    Attributes
539    ----------
540    n_elems : int
541        Number of elements.
542    eps_ne_rate, eps_ne_rate_old : torch.Tensor
543        Current and previous non-elastic strain rate, shape (N, 3, 3).
544    eps_ne_old, eps_ne_k : torch.Tensor
545        Non-elastic strain at old and current time, shape (N, 3, 3).
546    B : torch.Tensor
547        State variable term (N, 3, 3) assembled in `compute_G_B`.
548    G : torch.Tensor
549        Tangent-like operator (N, 6, 6) assembled in `compute_G_B`.
550    """
551    def __init__(self, n_elems):
552    	self.n_elems = n_elems
553    	self.eps_ne_rate = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
554    	self.eps_ne_rate_old = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
555    	self.eps_ne_old = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
556    	self.eps_ne_k = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
557    	self.B = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
558    	self.G = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
559
560    @abstractmethod
561    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False) -> None:
562    	pass
563
564    def increment_internal_variables(self, *args) -> None:
565    	pass
566
567    def update_internal_variables(self, *args) -> None:
568    	pass
569
570    def compute_eps_ne_k(self, phi1: float, phi2: float) -> None:
571        """
572        Predictor for non-elastic strain at the previous iteration k.
573
574        Parameters
575        ----------
576        phi1 : float
577            Typically `phi1=dt*theta`.
578        phi2 : float
579            Typically `phi2=dt*(1-theta)`.
580
581        Returns
582        -------
583        None
584
585        Side Effects
586        ------------
587        Sets `self.eps_ne_k`.
588        """
589        self.eps_ne_k = self.eps_ne_old + phi1*self.eps_ne_rate_old + phi2*self.eps_ne_rate
590
591    def update_eps_ne_old(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, phi2: float) -> None:
592        """
593        Update non-elastic strain from previous time step.
594
595        Parameters
596        ----------
597        stress : torch.Tensor
598            Stress at current iteration k+1, shape (N, 3, 3).
599        stress_k : torch.Tensor
600            Stress at previous iteration k, shape (N, 3, 3).
601        phi2 : float
602            Typically `phi2=dt*(1-theta)`.
603
604        Returns
605        -------
606        None
607
608        Side Effects
609        ------------
610        Updates `self.eps_ne_old`.
611        """
612        self.eps_ne_old = self.eps_ne_k + phi2*dotdot_torch(self.G, stress - stress_k) - phi2*self.B
613
614    def update_eps_ne_rate_old(self) -> None:
615        """
616        Update the current non-nelastic strain rate to the previous time step.
617
618        Returns
619        -------
620        None
621        """
622        self.eps_ne_rate_old = self.eps_ne_rate.clone()
623
624    def compute_E(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> None:
625        """
626        Finite-difference approximation of the 6×6 operator E = d(eps_ne)/d(stress).
627
628        Parameters
629        ----------
630        stress : torch.Tensor
631            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
632        dt : float
633            Time step.
634        theta : float
635            Time integration parameter.
636        Temp : torch.Tensor
637            Temperature per element.
638
639        Returns
640        -------
641        torch.Tensor
642            Operator `E` with shape (N, 6, 6).
643        """
644        phi1 = dt*theta
645        EPSILON = 1e-2
646        E = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
647        stress_eps = stress.clone()
648        c1 = 1.0
649        c2 = 2.0
650        magic_indexes = [(0,0,0,c1), (1,1,1,c1), (2,2,2,c1), (0,1,3,c2), (0,2,4,c2), (1,2,5,c2)]
651        for i, j, k, phi in magic_indexes:
652        	stress_eps[:,i,j] += EPSILON
653        	eps_A = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_eps, phi1, Temp, return_eps_ne=True)
654        	stress_eps[:,i,j] -= EPSILON
655        	stress_eps[:,i,j] -= EPSILON
656        	eps_B = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_eps, phi1, Temp, return_eps_ne=True)
657        	stress_eps[:,i,j] += EPSILON
658        	E[:,:,k] = phi*(eps_A[:,[0,1,2,0,0,1],[0,1,2,1,2,2]] - eps_B[:,[0,1,2,0,0,1],[0,1,2,1,2,2]]) / (2*EPSILON)
659        return E
660
661    def compute_B_and_H_over_h(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> None:
662        """
663        Compute state variable term `B` and linearization term `H/h`.
664
665        Parameters
666        ----------
667        stress : torch.Tensor
668            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
669        dt : float
670            Time step.
671        theta : float
672            Time integration parameter.
673        Temp : torch.Tensor
674            Temperature per element.
675
676        Returns
677        -------
678        B : torch.Tensor
679            Driving term, shape (N, 3, 3).
680        H_over_h : torch.Tensor
681            Linearization ratio, shape (N, 6, 6).
682
683        Notes
684        -----
685        Default implementation returns zeros; subclasses override.
686        """
687        B = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
688        H_over_h = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
689        return B, H_over_h
690
691    def compute_G_B(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> None:
692        """
693        Assemble `G` and `B` for the element based on `E` and `H/h`.
694
695        Parameters
696        ----------
697        stress : torch.Tensor
698        dt : float
699        theta : float
700        Temp : torch.Tensor
701
702        Returns
703        -------
704        None
705
706        Side Effects
707        ------------
708        Sets `self.B` and `self.G`.
709        """
710        self.B, H_over_h = self.compute_B_and_H_over_h(stress, dt, theta, Temp)
711        E = self.compute_E(stress, dt, theta, Temp)
712        self.G = E.clone() - H_over_h.clone()
713
714    def compute_T_IT(self) -> None:
715        """
716        Build volumetric coupling tensors `T` (3×3) and `IT` (6×6) from `G`.
717
718        Returns
719        -------
720        None
721
722        Side Effects
723        ------------
724        Sets `self.T` and `self.IT`.
725        """
726        self.T = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3))
727        self.T[:,0,0] = self.G[:,0,0] + self.G[:,1,0] + self.G[:,2,0]
728        self.T[:,1,1] = self.G[:,0,1] + self.G[:,1,1] + self.G[:,2,1]
729        self.T[:,2,2] = self.G[:,0,2] + self.G[:,1,2] + self.G[:,2,2]
730        self.T[:,1,0] = self.T[:,0,1] = (self.G[:,0,3] + self.G[:,1,3] + self.G[:,2,3])/2
731        self.T[:,2,0] = self.T[:,0,2] = (self.G[:,0,4] + self.G[:,1,4] + self.G[:,2,4])/2
732        self.T[:,2,1] = self.T[:,1,2] = (self.G[:,0,5] + self.G[:,1,5] + self.G[:,2,5])/2
733
734        self.IT = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6))
735        self.IT[:,0,0] = self.T[:,0,0]
736        self.IT[:,0,1] = self.T[:,1,1]
737        self.IT[:,0,2] = self.T[:,2,2]
738        self.IT[:,0,3] = self.T[:,0,1] + self.T[:,1,0]
739        self.IT[:,0,4] = self.T[:,0,2] + self.T[:,2,0]
740        self.IT[:,0,5] = self.T[:,1,2] + self.T[:,2,1]
741        self.IT[:,1,:] = self.IT[:,0,:]
742        self.IT[:,2,:] = self.IT[:,0,:]
743
744    def compute_Bvol_Tvol(self) -> None:
745        """
746        Compute volumetric parts of `B` and `T`.
747
748        Returns
749        -------
750        None
751
752        Side Effects
753        ------------
754        Sets `self.B_vol` and `self.T_vol` as traces of `B` and `T`.
755        """
756        self.T_vol = to.einsum("bii->b", self.T)
757        self.B_vol = to.einsum("bii->b", self.B)
758
759    def compute_Gtilde_Btilde(self) -> None:
760        """
761        Compute deviatoric parts `G_tilde` and `B_tilde`.
762
763        Returns
764        -------
765        None
766
767        Side Effects
768        ------------
769        Sets `self.G_tilde` and `self.B_tilde`.
770        """
771        I = to.eye(3).expand(self.n_elems, -1, -1)
772        self.G_tilde = self.G - self.IT/3
773        self.B_tilde = self.B - self.B_vol[:,None,None]*I/3

Abstract base for inelastic mechanisms (e.g., viscoelasticity, dislocation creep, viscoplasticity). Provides common storage and utility updates for internal variables.

Parameters
  • n_elems (int): Number of elements.
Attributes
  • n_elems (int): Number of elements.
  • eps_ne_rate, eps_ne_rate_old (torch.Tensor): Current and previous non-elastic strain rate, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • eps_ne_old, eps_ne_k (torch.Tensor): Non-elastic strain at old and current time, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • B (torch.Tensor): State variable term (N, 3, 3) assembled in compute_G_B.
  • G (torch.Tensor): Tangent-like operator (N, 6, 6) assembled in compute_G_B.
n_elems
eps_ne_rate
eps_ne_rate_old
eps_ne_old
eps_ne_k
B
G
@abstractmethod
def compute_eps_ne_rate( self, stress_vec: torch.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: torch.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool = False) -> None: 
560    @abstractmethod
561    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False) -> None:
562    	pass
def increment_internal_variables(self, *args) -> None: 
564    def increment_internal_variables(self, *args) -> None:
565    	pass
def update_internal_variables(self, *args) -> None: 
567    def update_internal_variables(self, *args) -> None:
568    	pass
def compute_eps_ne_k(self, phi1: float, phi2: float) -> None: 
570    def compute_eps_ne_k(self, phi1: float, phi2: float) -> None:
571        """
572        Predictor for non-elastic strain at the previous iteration k.
573
574        Parameters
575        ----------
576        phi1 : float
577            Typically `phi1=dt*theta`.
578        phi2 : float
579            Typically `phi2=dt*(1-theta)`.
580
581        Returns
582        -------
583        None
584
585        Side Effects
586        ------------
587        Sets `self.eps_ne_k`.
588        """
589        self.eps_ne_k = self.eps_ne_old + phi1*self.eps_ne_rate_old + phi2*self.eps_ne_rate

Predictor for non-elastic strain at the previous iteration k.

Parameters
  • phi1 (float): Typically phi1=dt*theta.
  • phi2 (float): Typically phi2=dt*(1-theta).
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.eps_ne_k.

def update_eps_ne_old(self, stress: torch.Tensor, stress_k: torch.Tensor, phi2: float) -> None: 
591    def update_eps_ne_old(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, phi2: float) -> None:
592        """
593        Update non-elastic strain from previous time step.
594
595        Parameters
596        ----------
597        stress : torch.Tensor
598            Stress at current iteration k+1, shape (N, 3, 3).
599        stress_k : torch.Tensor
600            Stress at previous iteration k, shape (N, 3, 3).
601        phi2 : float
602            Typically `phi2=dt*(1-theta)`.
603
604        Returns
605        -------
606        None
607
608        Side Effects
609        ------------
610        Updates `self.eps_ne_old`.
611        """
612        self.eps_ne_old = self.eps_ne_k + phi2*dotdot_torch(self.G, stress - stress_k) - phi2*self.B

Update non-elastic strain from previous time step.

  • stress_k (torch.Tensor): Stress at previous iteration k, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • phi2 (float): Typically phi2=dt*(1-theta).

def update_eps_ne_rate_old(self) -> None: 
614    def update_eps_ne_rate_old(self) -> None:
615        """
616        Update the current non-nelastic strain rate to the previous time step.
617
618        Returns
619        -------
620        None
621        """
622        self.eps_ne_rate_old = self.eps_ne_rate.clone()

Update the current non-nelastic strain rate to the previous time step.

Returns
  • None
def compute_E( self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: torch.Tensor) -> None: 
624    def compute_E(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> None:
625        """
626        Finite-difference approximation of the 6×6 operator E = d(eps_ne)/d(stress).
627
628        Parameters
629        ----------
630        stress : torch.Tensor
631            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
632        dt : float
633            Time step.
634        theta : float
635            Time integration parameter.
636        Temp : torch.Tensor
637            Temperature per element.
638
639        Returns
640        -------
641        torch.Tensor
642            Operator `E` with shape (N, 6, 6).
643        """
644        phi1 = dt*theta
645        EPSILON = 1e-2
646        E = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
647        stress_eps = stress.clone()
648        c1 = 1.0
649        c2 = 2.0
650        magic_indexes = [(0,0,0,c1), (1,1,1,c1), (2,2,2,c1), (0,1,3,c2), (0,2,4,c2), (1,2,5,c2)]
651        for i, j, k, phi in magic_indexes:
652        	stress_eps[:,i,j] += EPSILON
653        	eps_A = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_eps, phi1, Temp, return_eps_ne=True)
654        	stress_eps[:,i,j] -= EPSILON
655        	stress_eps[:,i,j] -= EPSILON
656        	eps_B = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_eps, phi1, Temp, return_eps_ne=True)
657        	stress_eps[:,i,j] += EPSILON
658        	E[:,:,k] = phi*(eps_A[:,[0,1,2,0,0,1],[0,1,2,1,2,2]] - eps_B[:,[0,1,2,0,0,1],[0,1,2,1,2,2]]) / (2*EPSILON)
659        return E

Finite-difference approximation of the 6×6 operator E = d(eps_ne)/d(stress).

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • dt (float): Time step.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter.
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element.
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Operator E with shape (N, 6, 6).
def compute_B_and_H_over_h( self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: torch.Tensor) -> None: 
661    def compute_B_and_H_over_h(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> None:
662        """
663        Compute state variable term `B` and linearization term `H/h`.
664
665        Parameters
666        ----------
667        stress : torch.Tensor
668            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
669        dt : float
670            Time step.
671        theta : float
672            Time integration parameter.
673        Temp : torch.Tensor
674            Temperature per element.
675
676        Returns
677        -------
678        B : torch.Tensor
679            Driving term, shape (N, 3, 3).
680        H_over_h : torch.Tensor
681            Linearization ratio, shape (N, 6, 6).
682
683        Notes
684        -----
685        Default implementation returns zeros; subclasses override.
686        """
687        B = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
688        H_over_h = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
689        return B, H_over_h

Compute state variable term B and linearization term H/h.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • dt (float): Time step.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter.
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element.
Returns
  • B (torch.Tensor): Driving term, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • H_over_h (torch.Tensor): Linearization ratio, shape (N, 6, 6).
Notes

Default implementation returns zeros; subclasses override.

def compute_G_B( self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: torch.Tensor) -> None: 
691    def compute_G_B(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> None:
692        """
693        Assemble `G` and `B` for the element based on `E` and `H/h`.
694
695        Parameters
696        ----------
697        stress : torch.Tensor
698        dt : float
699        theta : float
700        Temp : torch.Tensor
701
702        Returns
703        -------
704        None
705
706        Side Effects
707        ------------
708        Sets `self.B` and `self.G`.
709        """
710        self.B, H_over_h = self.compute_B_and_H_over_h(stress, dt, theta, Temp)
711        E = self.compute_E(stress, dt, theta, Temp)
712        self.G = E.clone() - H_over_h.clone()

Assemble G and B for the element based on E and H/h.

Parameters

  • stress (torch.Tensor):

  • dt (float):

  • theta (float):

  • Temp (torch.Tensor):

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.B and self.G.

def compute_T_IT(self) -> None: 
714    def compute_T_IT(self) -> None:
715        """
716        Build volumetric coupling tensors `T` (3×3) and `IT` (6×6) from `G`.
717
718        Returns
719        -------
720        None
721
722        Side Effects
723        ------------
724        Sets `self.T` and `self.IT`.
725        """
726        self.T = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3))
727        self.T[:,0,0] = self.G[:,0,0] + self.G[:,1,0] + self.G[:,2,0]
728        self.T[:,1,1] = self.G[:,0,1] + self.G[:,1,1] + self.G[:,2,1]
729        self.T[:,2,2] = self.G[:,0,2] + self.G[:,1,2] + self.G[:,2,2]
730        self.T[:,1,0] = self.T[:,0,1] = (self.G[:,0,3] + self.G[:,1,3] + self.G[:,2,3])/2
731        self.T[:,2,0] = self.T[:,0,2] = (self.G[:,0,4] + self.G[:,1,4] + self.G[:,2,4])/2
732        self.T[:,2,1] = self.T[:,1,2] = (self.G[:,0,5] + self.G[:,1,5] + self.G[:,2,5])/2
733
734        self.IT = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6))
735        self.IT[:,0,0] = self.T[:,0,0]
736        self.IT[:,0,1] = self.T[:,1,1]
737        self.IT[:,0,2] = self.T[:,2,2]
738        self.IT[:,0,3] = self.T[:,0,1] + self.T[:,1,0]
739        self.IT[:,0,4] = self.T[:,0,2] + self.T[:,2,0]
740        self.IT[:,0,5] = self.T[:,1,2] + self.T[:,2,1]
741        self.IT[:,1,:] = self.IT[:,0,:]
742        self.IT[:,2,:] = self.IT[:,0,:]

Build volumetric coupling tensors T (3×3) and IT (6×6) from G.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.T and self.IT.

def compute_Bvol_Tvol(self) -> None: 
744    def compute_Bvol_Tvol(self) -> None:
745        """
746        Compute volumetric parts of `B` and `T`.
747
748        Returns
749        -------
750        None
751
752        Side Effects
753        ------------
754        Sets `self.B_vol` and `self.T_vol` as traces of `B` and `T`.
755        """
756        self.T_vol = to.einsum("bii->b", self.T)
757        self.B_vol = to.einsum("bii->b", self.B)

Compute volumetric parts of B and T.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.B_vol and self.T_vol as traces of B and T.

def compute_Gtilde_Btilde(self) -> None: 
759    def compute_Gtilde_Btilde(self) -> None:
760        """
761        Compute deviatoric parts `G_tilde` and `B_tilde`.
762
763        Returns
764        -------
765        None
766
767        Side Effects
768        ------------
769        Sets `self.G_tilde` and `self.B_tilde`.
770        """
771        I = to.eye(3).expand(self.n_elems, -1, -1)
772        self.G_tilde = self.G - self.IT/3
773        self.B_tilde = self.B - self.B_vol[:,None,None]*I/3

Compute deviatoric parts G_tilde and B_tilde.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.G_tilde and self.B_tilde.

class Spring: 
369class Spring():
370	"""
371    Linear isotropic elastic element in Voigt notation.
372
373    Parameters
374    ----------
375    E : torch.Tensor
376        Young's modulus per element, shape (N,).
377    nu : torch.Tensor
378        Poisson's ratio per element, shape (N,).
379    name : str, optional
380        Element name, by default "spring".
381
382    Attributes
383    ----------
384    E, nu : torch.Tensor
385        Material parameters, shape (N,).
386    n_elems : int
387        Number of elements.
388    C, C_inv : torch.Tensor
389        Stiffness and its inverse in tensorial Voigt form, shape (N, 6, 6).
390    C_tilde, C_tilde_inv : torch.Tensor
391        Deviatoric stiffness and inverse, shape (N, 6, 6).
392    K : torch.Tensor
393        Bulk modulus per element, shape (N,).
394    eps_e : torch.Tensor
395        Elastic strain tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
396    name : str
397        Element name.
398    """
399	def __init__(self, E, nu, name="spring"):
400		self.E = E
401		self.nu = nu
402		self.name = name
403		self.n_elems = self.E.shape[0]
404		self.eps_e = to.tensor((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
405
406	def initialize(self):
407		"""
408        Build stiffness operators and bulk modulus.
409
410        Returns
411        -------
412        None
413
414        Side Effects
415        ------------
416        Sets `C`, `C_inv`, `C_tilde`, `C_tilde_inv`, and `K`.
417        """
418		self.C = self.__compute_C(self.n_elems, self.nu, self.E)
419		self.C_inv = self.__compute_C_inv(self.C)
420		self.C_tilde = self.__compute_C_tilde(self.n_elems, self.nu, self.E)
421		self.C_tilde_inv = self.__compute_C_tilde_inv(self.n_elems, self.nu, self.E)
422		self.K = self.E/(3*(1 - 2*self.nu))
423
424	def compute_eps_e(self, stress):
425		"""
426        Compute elastic strain from stress using `C_inv`.
427
428        Parameters
429        ----------
430        stress : torch.Tensor
431            Cauchy stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
432
433        Returns
434        -------
435        None
436
437        Side Effects
438        ------------
439        Sets `self.eps_e` (N, 3, 3).
440        """
441		self.eps_e = dotdot_torch(self.C_inv, stress)
442
443	def __compute_C(self, n_elems, nu, E):
444		"""
445        Construct isotropic stiffness in tensorial Voigt form.
446
447        Parameters
448        ----------
449        n_elems : int
450            Number of elements.
451        nu : torch.Tensor
452            Poisson's ratio, shape (N,).
453        E : torch.Tensor
454            Young's modulus, shape (N,).
455
456        Returns
457        -------
458        torch.Tensor
459            Stiffness matrix `(N, 6, 6)` with shear terms `2G` on the diagonal
460            of the shear block (tensorial, not engineering).
461        """
462		C = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
463		a0 = E/((1 + nu)*(1 - 2*nu))
464		C[:,0,0] = a0*(1 - nu)
465		C[:,1,1] = a0*(1 - nu)
466		C[:,2,2] = a0*(1 - nu)
467		C[:,3,3] = a0*(1 - 2*nu)
468		C[:,4,4] = a0*(1 - 2*nu)
469		C[:,5,5] = a0*(1 - 2*nu)
470		C[:,0,1] = C[:,1,0] = C[:,0,2] = C[:,2,0] = C[:,2,1] = C[:,1,2] = a0*nu
471		return C
472
473	def __compute_C_inv(self, C):
474		"""
475        Invert the stiffness matrix per element.
476
477        Parameters
478        ----------
479        C : torch.Tensor
480            Stiffness matrix, shape (N, 6, 6).
481
482        Returns
483        -------
484        torch.Tensor
485            Element-wise inverse, shape (N, 6, 6).
486        """
487		return to.linalg.inv(self.C)
488
489	def __compute_C_tilde(self, n_elems, nu, E):
490		"""
491        Construct deviatoric stiffness (2G on all six Voigt diagonals).
492
493        Parameters
494        ----------
495        n_elems : int
496        nu : torch.Tensor
497        E : torch.Tensor
498
499        Returns
500        -------
501        torch.Tensor
502            `(N, 6, 6)` with diagonal entries `2G`, zeros elsewhere.
503        """
504		G = E/(2*(1 + nu))
505		C_tilde = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
506		C_tilde[:,0,0] = 2*G
507		C_tilde[:,1,1] = 2*G
508		C_tilde[:,2,2] = 2*G
509		C_tilde[:,3,3] = 2*G
510		C_tilde[:,4,4] = 2*G
511		C_tilde[:,5,5] = 2*G
512		return C_tilde
513
514	def __compute_C_tilde_inv(self, n_elems, nu, E):
515		G = E/(2*(1 + nu))
516		C_tilde_inv = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
517		C_tilde_inv[:,0,0] = 1/(2*G)
518		C_tilde_inv[:,1,1] = 1/(2*G)
519		C_tilde_inv[:,2,2] = 1/(2*G)
520		C_tilde_inv[:,3,3] = 1/(2*G)
521		C_tilde_inv[:,4,4] = 1/(2*G)
522		C_tilde_inv[:,5,5] = 1/(2*G)
523		return C_tilde_inv

Linear isotropic elastic element in Voigt notation.

Parameters
  • E (torch.Tensor): Young's modulus per element, shape (N,).
  • nu (torch.Tensor): Poisson's ratio per element, shape (N,).
  • name (str, optional): Element name, by default "spring".
Attributes
  • E, nu (torch.Tensor): Material parameters, shape (N,).
  • n_elems (int): Number of elements.
  • C, C_inv (torch.Tensor): Stiffness and its inverse in tensorial Voigt form, shape (N, 6, 6).
  • C_tilde, C_tilde_inv (torch.Tensor): Deviatoric stiffness and inverse, shape (N, 6, 6).
  • K (torch.Tensor): Bulk modulus per element, shape (N,).
  • eps_e (torch.Tensor): Elastic strain tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • name (str): Element name.
Spring(E, nu, name='spring') 
399	def __init__(self, E, nu, name="spring"):
400		self.E = E
401		self.nu = nu
402		self.name = name
403		self.n_elems = self.E.shape[0]
404		self.eps_e = to.tensor((self.n_elems, 3, 3), dtype=to.float64)
E
nu
name
n_elems
eps_e
def initialize(self): 
406	def initialize(self):
407		"""
408        Build stiffness operators and bulk modulus.
409
410        Returns
411        -------
412        None
413
414        Side Effects
415        ------------
416        Sets `C`, `C_inv`, `C_tilde`, `C_tilde_inv`, and `K`.
417        """
418		self.C = self.__compute_C(self.n_elems, self.nu, self.E)
419		self.C_inv = self.__compute_C_inv(self.C)
420		self.C_tilde = self.__compute_C_tilde(self.n_elems, self.nu, self.E)
421		self.C_tilde_inv = self.__compute_C_tilde_inv(self.n_elems, self.nu, self.E)
422		self.K = self.E/(3*(1 - 2*self.nu))

Build stiffness operators and bulk modulus.

Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets C, C_inv, C_tilde, C_tilde_inv, and K.

def compute_eps_e(self, stress): 
424	def compute_eps_e(self, stress):
425		"""
426        Compute elastic strain from stress using `C_inv`.
427
428        Parameters
429        ----------
430        stress : torch.Tensor
431            Cauchy stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
432
433        Returns
434        -------
435        None
436
437        Side Effects
438        ------------
439        Sets `self.eps_e` (N, 3, 3).
440        """
441		self.eps_e = dotdot_torch(self.C_inv, stress)

Compute elastic strain from stress using C_inv.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Cauchy stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.eps_e (N, 3, 3).

class Thermoelastic: 
317class Thermoelastic():
318	"""
319    Thermoelastic contribution producing thermal strain :math:`\\varepsilon_{th}
320    = \\alpha\\,\\Delta T\\,I`.
321
322    Parameters
323    ----------
324    alpha : torch.Tensor
325        Linear coefficient of thermal expansion per element, shape (N,).
326    name : str, optional
327        Identifier for the element, by default "thermoelastic".
328
329    Attributes
330    ----------
331    alpha : torch.Tensor
332        Thermal expansion coefficients, shape (N,).
333    n_elems : int
334        Number of elements.
335    eps_th : torch.Tensor
336        Thermal strain tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
337    I : torch.Tensor
338        Identity tensor (broadcasted to N), shape (N, 3, 3).
339    name : str
340        Element name.
341    """
342	def __init__(self, alpha, name="thermoelastic"):
343		self.alpha = alpha
344		self.name = name
345		self.n_elems = self.alpha.shape[0]
346		self.eps_th = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3))
347		self.I = to.eye(3, dtype=to.float64).unsqueeze(0).repeat(self.n_elems, 1, 1)
348
349	def compute_eps_th(self, dT_DG_vec):
350		"""
351        Compute thermal strain from a temperature increment.
352
353        Parameters
354        ----------
355        dT_DG_vec : torch.Tensor
356            Temperature increment per element (N,) or broadcastable to (N,).
357
358        Returns
359        -------
360        None
361
362        Side Effects
363        ------------
364        Sets `self.eps_th = alpha * dT * I`.
365        """
366		self.eps_th = self.alpha[:,None,None]*dT_DG_vec[:,None,None]*self.I

Parameters
  • alpha (torch.Tensor): Linear coefficient of thermal expansion per element, shape (N,).
  • name (str, optional): Identifier for the element, by default "thermoelastic".
Attributes

  • n_elems (int): Number of elements.
  • eps_th (torch.Tensor): Thermal strain tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • I (torch.Tensor): Identity tensor (broadcasted to N), shape (N, 3, 3).
  • name (str): Element name.
Thermoelastic(alpha, name='thermoelastic')

344		self.name = name
345		self.n_elems = self.alpha.shape[0]
346		self.eps_th = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 3, 3))
