class Viscoelastic(safeincave.NonElasticElement): 
779class Viscoelastic(NonElasticElement):
780    """
781    Kelvin–Voigt-type viscoelastic element.
782
783    Parameters
784    ----------
785    eta : torch.Tensor
786        Viscosity parameter per element, shape (N,).
787    E : torch.Tensor
788        Young's modulus per element, shape (N,).
789    nu : torch.Tensor
790        Poisson's ratio per element, shape (N,).
791    name : str, optional
792        Element name, by default "kelvin_voigt".
793
794    Attributes
795    ----------
796    C1 : torch.Tensor
797        Elastic stiffness in Voigt form, shape (N, 6, 6).
798    eta, E, nu : torch.Tensor
799        Material parameters, shape (N,).
800    """
801    def __init__(self, eta: to.Tensor, E: to.Tensor, nu: to.Tensor, name: bool="kelvin_voigt"):
802        super().__init__(E.shape[0])
803        self.eta = eta
804        self.E = E
805        self.nu = nu
806        self.name = name
807
808        # Assemble C1 tensor (n_elems, 6, 6)
809        self.C1 = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
810        a0 = self.E/((1 + self.nu)*(1 - 2*self.nu))
811        self.C1[:,0,0] = a0*(1 - self.nu)
812        self.C1[:,1,1] = a0*(1 - self.nu)
813        self.C1[:,2,2] = a0*(1 - self.nu)
814        self.C1[:,3,3] = a0*(1 - 2*self.nu)
815        self.C1[:,4,4] = a0*(1 - 2*self.nu)
816        self.C1[:,5,5] = a0*(1 - 2*self.nu)
817        self.C1[:,0,1] = self.C1[:,1,0] = self.C1[:,0,2] = self.C1[:,2,0] = self.C1[:,2,1] = self.C1[:,1,2] = a0*self.nu
818
819    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False):
820        """
821        Compute viscoelastic strain rate (Kelvin–Voigt form).
822
823        Parameters
824        ----------
825        stress_vec : torch.Tensor
826            Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
827        phi1 : float
828            Time integration factor (dt*theta).
829        Temp : torch.Tensor
830            Temperature per element (unused here).
831        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
832            If True, return the rate; else store it.
833
834        Returns
835        -------
836        None or torch.Tensor
837            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
838        """
839        eps_ne_rate = dotdot_torch(self.G, stress_vec - dotdot_torch(self.C1, self.eps_ne_old + phi1*self.eps_ne_rate_old))
840        if return_eps_ne:
841        	return eps_ne_rate.clone()
842        else:
843        	self.eps_ne_rate = eps_ne_rate.clone()
844
845    def compute_E(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
846        """
847        Closed-form 6×6 operator for viscoelasticity:
848        `E = (eta*I + phi2*C1)^{-1}`.
849
850        Parameters
851        ----------
852        stress : torch.Tensor
853            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3). (Unused here.)
854        dt : float
855            Time step.
856        theta : float
857            Time integration parameter.
858        Temp : torch.Tensor
859            Temperature per element (unused).
860
861        Returns
862        -------
863        torch.Tensor
864            `E` with shape (N, 6, 6).
865        """
866        phi2 = dt*(1 - theta)
867        I = to.eye(6, dtype=to.float64).unsqueeze(0).repeat(self.n_elems, 1, 1)
868        E = to.linalg.inv(self.eta[:,None,None]*I + phi2*self.C1)
869        return E

Kelvin–Voigt-type viscoelastic element.

Parameters
  • eta (torch.Tensor): Viscosity parameter per element, shape (N,).
  • E (torch.Tensor): Young's modulus per element, shape (N,).
  • nu (torch.Tensor): Poisson's ratio per element, shape (N,).
  • name (str, optional): Element name, by default "kelvin_voigt".
Attributes
  • C1 (torch.Tensor): Elastic stiffness in Voigt form, shape (N, 6, 6).
  • eta, E, nu (torch.Tensor): Material parameters, shape (N,).
Viscoelastic( eta: torch.Tensor, E: torch.Tensor, nu: torch.Tensor, name: bool = 'kelvin_voigt') 
801    def __init__(self, eta: to.Tensor, E: to.Tensor, nu: to.Tensor, name: bool="kelvin_voigt"):
802        super().__init__(E.shape[0])
803        self.eta = eta
804        self.E = E
805        self.nu = nu
806        self.name = name
807
808        # Assemble C1 tensor (n_elems, 6, 6)
809        self.C1 = to.zeros((self.n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
810        a0 = self.E/((1 + self.nu)*(1 - 2*self.nu))
811        self.C1[:,0,0] = a0*(1 - self.nu)
812        self.C1[:,1,1] = a0*(1 - self.nu)
813        self.C1[:,2,2] = a0*(1 - self.nu)
814        self.C1[:,3,3] = a0*(1 - 2*self.nu)
815        self.C1[:,4,4] = a0*(1 - 2*self.nu)
816        self.C1[:,5,5] = a0*(1 - 2*self.nu)
817        self.C1[:,0,1] = self.C1[:,1,0] = self.C1[:,0,2] = self.C1[:,2,0] = self.C1[:,2,1] = self.C1[:,1,2] = a0*self.nu
eta
E
nu
name
C1
def compute_eps_ne_rate( self, stress_vec: torch.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: torch.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool = False): 
819    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False):
820        """
821        Compute viscoelastic strain rate (Kelvin–Voigt form).
822
823        Parameters
824        ----------
825        stress_vec : torch.Tensor
826            Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
827        phi1 : float
828            Time integration factor (dt*theta).
829        Temp : torch.Tensor
830            Temperature per element (unused here).
831        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
832            If True, return the rate; else store it.
833
834        Returns
835        -------
836        None or torch.Tensor
837            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
838        """
839        eps_ne_rate = dotdot_torch(self.G, stress_vec - dotdot_torch(self.C1, self.eps_ne_old + phi1*self.eps_ne_rate_old))
840        if return_eps_ne:
841        	return eps_ne_rate.clone()
842        else:
843        	self.eps_ne_rate = eps_ne_rate.clone()

Compute viscoelastic strain rate (Kelvin–Voigt form).

Parameters
  • stress_vec (torch.Tensor): Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • phi1 (float): Time integration factor (dt*theta).
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (unused here).
  • return_eps_ne (bool, default=False): If True, return the rate; else store it.
Returns
  • None or torch.Tensor: (N, 3, 3) if return_eps_ne=True, else None.
def compute_E( self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor: 
845    def compute_E(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
846        """
847        Closed-form 6×6 operator for viscoelasticity:
848        `E = (eta*I + phi2*C1)^{-1}`.
849
850        Parameters
851        ----------
852        stress : torch.Tensor
853            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3). (Unused here.)
854        dt : float
855            Time step.
856        theta : float
857            Time integration parameter.
858        Temp : torch.Tensor
859            Temperature per element (unused).
860
861        Returns
862        -------
863        torch.Tensor
864            `E` with shape (N, 6, 6).
865        """
866        phi2 = dt*(1 - theta)
867        I = to.eye(6, dtype=to.float64).unsqueeze(0).repeat(self.n_elems, 1, 1)
868        E = to.linalg.inv(self.eta[:,None,None]*I + phi2*self.C1)
869        return E

Closed-form 6×6 operator for viscoelasticity: E = (eta*I + phi2*C1)^{-1}.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3). (Unused here.)
  • dt (float): Time step.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter.
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (unused).
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: E with shape (N, 6, 6).
class DislocationCreep(safeincave.NonElasticElement): 
874class DislocationCreep(NonElasticElement):
875    """
876    Power-law dislocation creep: :math:`\\dot\\varepsilon_{ne}
877    = A\\,\\exp(-Q/(RT))\\,\\q^{n-1}\\,\\mathbf{s}`.
878
879    Parameters
880    ----------
881    A : torch.Tensor
882        Pre-exponential factor per element, shape (N,).
883    Q : torch.Tensor
884        Activation energy per element, shape (N,).
885    n : torch.Tensor
886        Stress exponent per element, shape (N,).
887    name : str, optional
888        Element name, by default "creep".
889
890    Attributes
891    ----------
892    R : float
893        Gas constant used (8.32).
894    A, Q, n : torch.Tensor
895        Material parameters, shape (N,).
896    """
897    def __init__(self, A: to.Tensor, Q: to.Tensor, n: to.Tensor, name: bool="creep"):
898        super().__init__(A.shape[0])
899        self.R = 8.32
900        self.Q = Q
901        self.A = A
902        self.n = n
903        self.name = name
904
905    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False):
906        """
907        Compute creep strain rate from current stress.
908
909        Parameters
910        ----------
911        stress_vec : torch.Tensor
912            Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
913        phi1 : float
914            Time integration factor (unused here).
915        Temp : torch.Tensor
916            Temperature per element (N,) or broadcastable.
917        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
918            If True, return the rate; else store it.
919
920        Returns
921        -------
922        None or torch.Tensor
923            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
924        """
925        s_xx = stress_vec[:,0,0]
926        s_yy = stress_vec[:,1,1]
927        s_zz = stress_vec[:,2,2]
928        s_xy = stress_vec[:,0,1]
929        s_xz = stress_vec[:,0,2]
930        s_yz = stress_vec[:,1,2]
931
932        sigma_mean = (s_xx + s_yy + s_zz) / 3
933        dev = stress_vec.clone()
934        dev[:,0,0] = s_xx - sigma_mean
935        dev[:,1,1] = s_yy - sigma_mean
936        dev[:,2,2] = s_zz - sigma_mean
937
938        q_vm = to.sqrt( 0.5*( (s_xx - s_yy)**2 + (s_xx - s_zz)**2 + (s_yy - s_zz)**2 + 6*(s_xy**2 + s_xz**2 + s_yz**2) ) )
939
940        A_bar = self.A*to.exp(-self.Q/self.R/Temp)*q_vm**(self.n - 1)
941        eps_rate = A_bar[:,None,None]*dev
942        if return_eps_ne:
943        	return eps_rate
944        else:
945        	self.eps_ne_rate = eps_rate

Power-law dislocation creep: :math:\dot\varepsilon_{ne} = A\,\exp(-Q/(RT))\,\q^{n-1}\,\mathbf{s}.

Parameters
  • A (torch.Tensor): Pre-exponential factor per element, shape (N,).
  • Q (torch.Tensor): Activation energy per element, shape (N,).
  • n (torch.Tensor): Stress exponent per element, shape (N,).
  • name (str, optional): Element name, by default "creep".
Attributes
  • R (float): Gas constant used (8.32).
  • A, Q, n (torch.Tensor): Material parameters, shape (N,).
DislocationCreep( A: torch.Tensor, Q: torch.Tensor, n: torch.Tensor, name: bool = 'creep') 
897    def __init__(self, A: to.Tensor, Q: to.Tensor, n: to.Tensor, name: bool="creep"):
898        super().__init__(A.shape[0])
899        self.R = 8.32
900        self.Q = Q
901        self.A = A
902        self.n = n
903        self.name = name
R
Q
A
n
name
def compute_eps_ne_rate( self, stress_vec: torch.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: torch.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool = False): 
905    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False):
906        """
907        Compute creep strain rate from current stress.
908
909        Parameters
910        ----------
911        stress_vec : torch.Tensor
912            Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
913        phi1 : float
914            Time integration factor (unused here).
915        Temp : torch.Tensor
916            Temperature per element (N,) or broadcastable.
917        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
918            If True, return the rate; else store it.
919
920        Returns
921        -------
922        None or torch.Tensor
923            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
924        """
925        s_xx = stress_vec[:,0,0]
926        s_yy = stress_vec[:,1,1]
927        s_zz = stress_vec[:,2,2]
928        s_xy = stress_vec[:,0,1]
929        s_xz = stress_vec[:,0,2]
930        s_yz = stress_vec[:,1,2]
931
932        sigma_mean = (s_xx + s_yy + s_zz) / 3
933        dev = stress_vec.clone()
934        dev[:,0,0] = s_xx - sigma_mean
935        dev[:,1,1] = s_yy - sigma_mean
936        dev[:,2,2] = s_zz - sigma_mean
937
938        q_vm = to.sqrt( 0.5*( (s_xx - s_yy)**2 + (s_xx - s_zz)**2 + (s_yy - s_zz)**2 + 6*(s_xy**2 + s_xz**2 + s_yz**2) ) )
939
940        A_bar = self.A*to.exp(-self.Q/self.R/Temp)*q_vm**(self.n - 1)
941        eps_rate = A_bar[:,None,None]*dev
942        if return_eps_ne:
943        	return eps_rate
944        else:
945        	self.eps_ne_rate = eps_rate

Compute creep strain rate from current stress.

Parameters
  • stress_vec (torch.Tensor): Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • phi1 (float): Time integration factor (unused here).
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (N,) or broadcastable.
  • return_eps_ne (bool, default=False): If True, return the rate; else store it.
Returns
  • None or torch.Tensor: (N, 3, 3) if return_eps_ne=True, else None.
class PressureSolutionCreep(safeincave.NonElasticElement): 
 948class PressureSolutionCreep(NonElasticElement):
 949    """
 950    Pressure solution creep: :math:`\\dot\\varepsilon_{ne}
 951    = A/(Td^3)\\,\\exp(-Q/(RT))\\,\\mathbf{s}`.
 952
 953    Parameters
 954    ----------
 955    A : torch.Tensor
 956        Pre-exponential factor per element, shape (N,).
 957    d : torch.Tensor
 958        Grain size (diameter), shape (N,).
 959    Q : torch.Tensor
 960        Activation energy per element, shape (N,).
 961    name : str, optional
 962        Element name, by default "creep".
 963
 964    Attributes
 965    ----------
 966    R : float
 967        Gas constant used (8.32).
 968    A, Q, d : torch.Tensor
 969        Material parameters, shape (N,).
 970    """
 971    def __init__(self, A: to.Tensor, d: to.Tensor, Q: to.Tensor, name: bool="creep"):
 972        super().__init__(A.shape[0])
 973        self.R = 8.32
 974        self.Q = Q
 975        self.A = A
 976        self.d = d
 977        self.name = name
 978
 979    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False):
 980        """
 981        Compute creep strain rate from current stress.
 982
 983        Parameters
 984        ----------
 985        stress_vec : torch.Tensor
 986            Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
 987        phi1 : float
 988            Time integration factor (unused here).
 989        Temp : torch.Tensor
 990            Temperature per element (N,) or broadcastable.
 991        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
 992            If True, return the rate; else store it.
 993
 994        Returns
 995        -------
 996        None or torch.Tensor
 997            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
 998        """
 999        s_xx = stress_vec[:,0,0]
1000        s_yy = stress_vec[:,1,1]
1001        s_zz = stress_vec[:,2,2]
1002        s_xy = stress_vec[:,0,1]
1003        s_xz = stress_vec[:,0,2]
1004        s_yz = stress_vec[:,1,2]
1005
1006        sigma_mean = (s_xx + s_yy + s_zz) / 3
1007        dev = stress_vec.clone()
1008        dev[:,0,0] = s_xx - sigma_mean
1009        dev[:,1,1] = s_yy - sigma_mean
1010        dev[:,2,2] = s_zz - sigma_mean
1011
1012
1013        A_bar = (self.A/self.d**3/Temp)*to.exp(-self.Q/self.R/Temp)
1014        eps_rate = A_bar[:,None,None]*dev
1015        if return_eps_ne:
1016            return eps_rate
1017        else:
1018            self.eps_ne_rate = eps_rate

Pressure solution creep: :math:\dot\varepsilon_{ne} = A/(Td^3)\,\exp(-Q/(RT))\,\mathbf{s}.

Parameters
  • A (torch.Tensor): Pre-exponential factor per element, shape (N,).
  • d (torch.Tensor): Grain size (diameter), shape (N,).
  • Q (torch.Tensor): Activation energy per element, shape (N,).
  • name (str, optional): Element name, by default "creep".
Attributes
  • R (float): Gas constant used (8.32).
  • A, Q, d (torch.Tensor): Material parameters, shape (N,).
PressureSolutionCreep( A: torch.Tensor, d: torch.Tensor, Q: torch.Tensor, name: bool = 'creep') 
971    def __init__(self, A: to.Tensor, d: to.Tensor, Q: to.Tensor, name: bool="creep"):
972        super().__init__(A.shape[0])
973        self.R = 8.32
974        self.Q = Q
975        self.A = A
976        self.d = d
977        self.name = name
R
Q
A
d
name
def compute_eps_ne_rate( self, stress_vec: torch.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: torch.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool = False): 
 979    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress_vec: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, return_eps_ne: bool=False):
 980        """
 981        Compute creep strain rate from current stress.
 982
 983        Parameters
 984        ----------
 985        stress_vec : torch.Tensor
 986            Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
 987        phi1 : float
 988            Time integration factor (unused here).
 989        Temp : torch.Tensor
 990            Temperature per element (N,) or broadcastable.
 991        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
 992            If True, return the rate; else store it.
 993
 994        Returns
 995        -------
 996        None or torch.Tensor
 997            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
 998        """
 999        s_xx = stress_vec[:,0,0]
1000        s_yy = stress_vec[:,1,1]
1001        s_zz = stress_vec[:,2,2]
1002        s_xy = stress_vec[:,0,1]
1003        s_xz = stress_vec[:,0,2]
1004        s_yz = stress_vec[:,1,2]
1005
1006        sigma_mean = (s_xx + s_yy + s_zz) / 3
1007        dev = stress_vec.clone()
1008        dev[:,0,0] = s_xx - sigma_mean
1009        dev[:,1,1] = s_yy - sigma_mean
1010        dev[:,2,2] = s_zz - sigma_mean
1011
1012
1013        A_bar = (self.A/self.d**3/Temp)*to.exp(-self.Q/self.R/Temp)
1014        eps_rate = A_bar[:,None,None]*dev
1015        if return_eps_ne:
1016            return eps_rate
1017        else:
1018            self.eps_ne_rate = eps_rate

Compute creep strain rate from current stress.

Parameters
  • stress_vec (torch.Tensor): Stress tensor per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • phi1 (float): Time integration factor (unused here).
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (N,) or broadcastable.
  • return_eps_ne (bool, default=False): If True, return the rate; else store it.
Returns
  • None or torch.Tensor: (N, 3, 3) if return_eps_ne=True, else None.
class ViscoplasticDesai(safeincave.NonElasticElement): 
1021class ViscoplasticDesai(NonElasticElement):
1022    """
1023    Viscoplastic model of Desai-type with hardening (state) variable `alpha`.
1024
1025    Parameters
1026    ----------
1027    mu_1, N_1, a_1, eta, n, beta_1, beta, m, gamma, sigma_t, alpha_0 : torch.Tensor
1028        Model parameters per element, shape (N,).
1029    name : str, optional
1030        Element name, by default "desai".
1031
1032    Attributes
1033    ----------
1034    alpha : torch.Tensor
1035        Current hardening variable per element, shape (N,).
1036    Fvp : torch.Tensor
1037        Current value of the yield function per element, shape (N,).
1038    qsi, qsi_old : torch.Tensor
1039        Accumulated viscoplastic strain measure and its previous value, shape (N,).
1040    P : torch.Tensor
1041        Sensitivity of the residue to stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1042    r, h : torch.Tensor
1043        Residue and its derivative w.r.t. `alpha`, shapes (N,) and (N,).
1044    """
1045    def __init__(self,
1046						mu_1: to.Tensor,
1047						N_1: to.Tensor,
1048						a_1: to.Tensor,
1049						eta: to.Tensor,
1050						n: to.Tensor,
1051						beta_1: to.Tensor,
1052						beta: to.Tensor,
1053						m: to.Tensor,
1054						gamma: to.Tensor,
1055						sigma_t: to.Tensor,
1056						alpha_0: to.Tensor,
1057						name: bool="desai"):
1058        super().__init__(mu_1.shape[0])
1059        self.name = name
1060        self.mu_1 = mu_1
1061        self.N_1 = N_1
1062        self.a_1 = a_1
1063        self.eta = eta
1064        self.n = n
1065        self.beta_1 = beta_1
1066        self.beta = beta
1067        self.m = m
1068        self.gamma = gamma
1069        self.sigma_t = sigma_t
1070        self.alpha_0 = alpha_0
1071        self.F_0 = 1.0
1072        self.n_elems = self.alpha_0.shape[0]
1073        self.alpha = self.alpha_0.clone()
1074        self.Fvp = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1075        self.qsi = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1076        self.qsi_old = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1077
1078    def compute_residue(self, eps_rate: to.Tensor, alpha: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> to.Tensor:
1079        """
1080        Residue of the implicit hardening equation.
1081
1082        Parameters
1083        ----------
1084        eps_rate : torch.Tensor
1085            Current inelastic strain rate, shape (N, 3, 3).
1086        alpha : torch.Tensor
1087            Hardening variable, shape (N,).
1088        dt : float
1089            Time step.
1090
1091        Returns
1092        -------
1093        torch.Tensor
1094            Residue per element, shape (N,).
1095
1096        Notes
1097        -----
1098        Updates `self.qsi` internally based on `eps_rate`.
1099        """
1100        self.qsi = self.qsi_old + to.sum(eps_rate**2, axis=(-2, -1))**0.5*dt
1101        return alpha - self.a_1 / (((self.a_1/self.alpha_0)**(1/self.eta) + self.qsi)**self.eta)
1102
1103    def update_internal_variables(self) -> None:
1104        """
1105        Commit accumulated measure `qsi`.
1106
1107        Returns
1108        -------
1109        None
1110        """
1111        self.qsi_old = self.qsi.clone()
1112
1113    def increment_internal_variables(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt:float) -> None:
1114        """
1115        Increment hardening variable `alpha` using linearization.
1116
1117        Parameters
1118        ----------
1119        stress : torch.Tensor
1120            End-of-step stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1121        stress_k : torch.Tensor
1122            Intermediate stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1123        dt : float
1124            Time step.
1125
1126        Returns
1127        -------
1128        None
1129
1130        Side Effects
1131        ------------
1132        Updates `self.alpha`.
1133        """
1134        delta_alpha = -(self.r + to.einsum('bij,bij->b', self.P, stress - stress_k))/self.h
1135        self.alpha += delta_alpha
1136
1137    def compute_stress_invariants(self, s_xx: to.Tensor,
1138										s_yy: to.Tensor,
1139										s_zz: to.Tensor,
1140										s_xy: to.Tensor,
1141										s_xz: to.Tensor,
1142										s_yz: to.Tensor) -> tuple[to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor]:
1143        """
1144        Compute invariants (I1, I2, I3, J2, J3) and auxiliary quantities.
1145
1146        Parameters
1147        ----------
1148        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz : torch.Tensor
1149            Normal and shear components (MPa-scaled as provided), each shape (N,).
1150
1151        Returns
1152        -------
1153        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 : tuple of torch.Tensor
1154            Invariants and helper arrays; `ind_J2_leq_0` are indices where `J2 <= 0`.
1155        """
1156        I1 = s_xx + s_yy + s_zz
1157        I2 = s_xx*s_yy + s_yy*s_zz + s_xx*s_zz - s_xy**2 - s_yz**2 - s_xz**2
1158        I3 = s_xx*s_yy*s_zz + 2*s_xy*s_yz*s_xz - s_zz*s_xy**2 - s_xx*s_yz**2 - s_yy*s_xz**2
1159        J2 = (1/3)*I1**2 - I2
1160        J3 = (2/27)*I1**3 - (1/3)*I1*I2 + I3
1161        Sr = -(J3*np.sqrt(27))/(2*J2**1.5)
1162
1163        # Check where J2 <= 0.0
1164        ind_J2_leq_0 = to.where(J2 <= 0.0)[0]
1165
1166        # Sr will be nan if, J2=0.0. So, replace it by 0.0
1167        Sr[ind_J2_leq_0] = 0.0
1168
1169        I1_star = I1 + self.sigma_t
1170        return I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0
1171
1172    def extract_stress_components(self, stress: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
1173        """
1174        Extract and scale stress components from a 3×3 tensor.
1175
1176        Parameters
1177        ----------
1178        stress : torch.Tensor
1179            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1180
1181        Returns
1182        -------
1183        tuple[torch.Tensor, ...]
1184            `(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)`, each shape (N,).
1185        """
1186        stress_vec = -stress
1187        s_xx = stress_vec[:,0,0]/MPa
1188        s_yy = stress_vec[:,1,1]/MPa
1189        s_zz = stress_vec[:,2,2]/MPa
1190        s_xy = stress_vec[:,0,1]/MPa
1191        s_xz = stress_vec[:,0,2]/MPa
1192        s_yz = stress_vec[:,1,2]/MPa
1193        return s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz
1194
1195    def compute_Fvp(self, alpha, I1, J2, Sr):
1196        """
1197        Compute the Desai viscoplastic yield function value `Fvp`.
1198
1199        Parameters
1200        ----------
1201        alpha : torch.Tensor
1202            Hardening variable per element, shape (N,).
1203        I1 : torch.Tensor
1204            First invariant, shape (N,).
1205        J2 : torch.Tensor
1206            Second deviatoric invariant, shape (N,).
1207        Sr : torch.Tensor
1208            Lode-related parameter, shape (N,).
1209
1210        Returns
1211        -------
1212        torch.Tensor
1213            `Fvp` per element, shape (N,).
1214        """
1215        F1 = (alpha*I1**self.n - self.gamma*I1**2)
1216        F2 = (to.exp(self.beta_1*I1) - self.beta*Sr)
1217        Fvp = J2 + F1*F2**self.m
1218        return Fvp
1219
1220    def compute_initial_hardening(self, stress: to.Tensor, Fvp_0=0.0) -> None:
1221        """
1222        Initialize `alpha` from a target `Fvp_0` and the current stress state.
1223
1224        Parameters
1225        ----------
1226        stress : torch.Tensor
1227            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1228        Fvp_0 : float, default=0.0
1229            Target initial value for `Fvp`.
1230
1231        Returns
1232        -------
1233        None
1234
1235        Side Effects
1236        ------------
1237        Sets `self.alpha_0`, `self.alpha`, and `self.Fvp`.
1238        """
1239        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz = self.extract_stress_components(stress)
1240        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, _ = self.compute_stress_invariants(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)
1241        self.alpha_0 =  self.gamma*I1_star**(2-self.n) + (Fvp_0 - J2)*I1_star**(-self.n)*(to.exp(self.beta_1*I1_star) - self.beta*Sr)**(-self.m)
1242        self.alpha = self.alpha_0.clone()
1243
1244        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz = self.extract_stress_components(stress)
1245        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 = self.compute_stress_invariants(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)
1246        self.Fvp = self.compute_Fvp(self.alpha, I1_star, J2, Sr)
1247
1248
1249    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, alpha=None, return_eps_ne=False):
1250        """
1251        Compute viscoplastic strain rate and optionally return it.
1252
1253        Parameters
1254        ----------
1255        stress : torch.Tensor
1256            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1257        phi1 : float
1258            Time integration factor (dt*theta).
1259        Temp : torch.Tensor
1260            Temperature per element (unused).
1261        alpha : torch.Tensor or None, optional
1262            Hardening variable override; if `None`, use `self.alpha`.
1263        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
1264            If True, return rate; else store it.
1265
1266        Returns
1267        -------
1268        None or torch.Tensor
1269            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
1270
1271        Notes
1272        -----
1273        Also updates `self.Fvp` when `return_eps_ne=False`.
1274        """
1275        if alpha == None:
1276        	alpha = self.alpha
1277
1278        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz = self.extract_stress_components(stress)
1279        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 = self.compute_stress_invariants(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)
1280
1281        # Compute yield function
1282        Fvp = self.compute_Fvp(alpha, I1_star, J2, Sr)
1283        if not return_eps_ne:
1284        	self.Fvp = Fvp.clone()
1285
1286
1287        # Compute flow direction, i.e. d(Fvp)/d(stress)
1288        F1 = (-alpha*I1**self.n + self.gamma*I1**2)
1289        F2 = (to.exp(self.beta_1*I1) - self.beta*Sr)
1290        dF1_dI1 = 2*self.gamma*I1 - self.n*alpha*I1**(self.n-1)
1291        dF2m_dI1 = self.beta_1*self.m*to.exp(self.beta_1*I1)*F2**(self.m-1)
1292        dF_dI1 = -(dF1_dI1*F2**self.m + F1*dF2m_dI1)
1293
1294        dF2_dJ2 = -(3*self.beta*J3*27**0.5)/(4*J2**(5/2))
1295        dF_dJ2 = 1 - F1*self.m*F2**(self.m-1)*dF2_dJ2
1296        dF_dJ3 = -self.m*F1*self.beta*np.sqrt(27)*F2**(self.m-1)/(2*J2**1.5)
1297
1298
1299        dI1_dSxx = 1.0
1300        dI1_dSyy = 1.0
1301        dI1_dSzz = 1.0
1302        dI1_dSxy = 0.0
1303        dI1_dSxz = 0.0
1304        dI1_dSyz = 0.0
1305
1306        dI2_dSxx = s_yy + s_zz
1307        dI2_dSyy = s_xx + s_zz
1308        dI2_dSzz = s_xx + s_yy
1309        dI2_dSxy = -2*s_xy
1310        dI2_dSxz = -2*s_xz
1311        dI2_dSyz = -2*s_yz
1312
1313        dI3_dSxx = s_yy*s_zz - s_yz**2
1314        dI3_dSyy = s_xx*s_zz - s_xz**2
1315        dI3_dSzz = s_xx*s_yy - s_xy**2
1316        dI3_dSxy = 2*(s_xz*s_yz - s_zz*s_xy)
1317        dI3_dSxz = 2*(s_xy*s_yz - s_yy*s_xz)
1318        dI3_dSyz = 2*(s_xz*s_xy - s_xx*s_yz)
1319
1320        dJ2_dI1 = (2/3)*I1
1321        dJ2_dI2 = -1.0
1322
1323        dJ2_dSxx = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSxx + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSxx
1324        dJ2_dSyy = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSyy + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSyy
1325        dJ2_dSzz = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSzz + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSzz
1326        dJ2_dSxy = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSxy + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSxy
1327        dJ2_dSxz = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSxz + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSxz
1328        dJ2_dSyz = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSyz + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSyz
1329
1330        dJ3_dI1 = (2/9)*I1**2 - (1/3)*I2
1331        dJ3_dI2 = -(1/3)*I1
1332        dJ3_dI3 = 1.0
1333
1334        dJ3_dSxx = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSxx + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSxx + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSxx
1335        dJ3_dSyy = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSyy + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSyy + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSyy
1336        dJ3_dSzz = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSzz + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSzz + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSzz
1337        dJ3_dSxy = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSxy + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSxy + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSxy
1338        dJ3_dSxz = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSxz + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSxz + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSxz
1339        dJ3_dSyz = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSyz + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSyz + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSyz
1340
1341        dQdS_00 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSxx + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSxx + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSxx
1342        dQdS_11 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSyy + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSyy + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSyy
1343        dQdS_22 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSzz + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSzz + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSzz
1344        dQdS_01 = dQdS_10 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSxy + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSxy + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSxy
1345        dQdS_02 = dQdS_20 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSxz + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSxz + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSxz
1346        dQdS_12 = dQdS_21 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSyz + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSyz + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSyz
1347
1348        # Initialize viscoplastic direction
1349        dQdS = to.zeros_like(stress, dtype=to.float64)
1350        dQdS[:,0,0] = dQdS_00
1351        dQdS[:,1,1] = dQdS_11
1352        dQdS[:,2,2] = dQdS_22
1353        dQdS[:,1,0] = dQdS[:,0,1] = dQdS_01
1354        dQdS[:,2,0] = dQdS[:,0,2] = dQdS_02
1355        dQdS[:,2,1] = dQdS[:,1,2] = dQdS_12
1356
1357        # Wherever J2=0, make viscoplasticity to be zero
1358        dQdS[ind_J2_leq_0,:,:] = 0.0
1359
1360        # Calculate strain rate
1361        ramp_idx = to.where(Fvp > 0)[0]
1362        lmbda = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1363        if len(ramp_idx) != 0:
1364        	lmbda[ramp_idx] = self.mu_1[ramp_idx]*(Fvp[ramp_idx]/self.F_0)**self.N_1[ramp_idx]
1365        eps_vp_rate = -dQdS*lmbda[:, None, None]
1366
1367        if return_eps_ne:
1368        	return eps_vp_rate
1369        else:
1370            self.eps_ne_rate = eps_vp_rate
1371
1372
1373    def compute_B_and_H_over_h(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> tuple[to.Tensor, to.Tensor]:
1374        """
1375        Compute `B` and `H/h` via perturbations of `alpha` and stress.
1376
1377        Parameters
1378        ----------
1379        stress : torch.Tensor
1380            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1381        dt : float
1382            Time step.
1383        theta : float
1384            Time integration parameter.
1385        Temp : torch.Tensor
1386            Temperature per element (unused).
1387
1388        Returns
1389        -------
1390        B : torch.Tensor
1391            Driving term, shape (N, 3, 3).
1392        H_over_h : torch.Tensor
1393            Linearization ratio, shape (N, 6, 6).
1394
1395        Notes
1396        -----
1397        Uses finite differences to approximate sensitivities.
1398        """
1399        # EPSILON_ALPHA = 1e-7
1400        EPSILON_ALPHA = 0.0001*self.alpha
1401        EPSILON_STRESS = 1e-1
1402
1403        alpha_eps = self.alpha + EPSILON_ALPHA
1404        eps_ne_rate_eps = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress, dt*theta, Temp, alpha=alpha_eps, return_eps_ne=True)
1405
1406        self.r = self.compute_residue(self.eps_ne_rate, self.alpha, dt)
1407        r_eps = self.compute_residue(eps_ne_rate_eps, alpha_eps, dt)
1408        self.h = (r_eps - self.r) / EPSILON_ALPHA
1409        Q = (eps_ne_rate_eps - self.eps_ne_rate) / EPSILON_ALPHA[:,None,None]
1410        B = (self.r / self.h)[:,None,None] * Q
1411
1412        self.P = to.zeros_like(stress)
1413        stress_eps = stress.clone()
1414        for i, j in [(0,0), (1,1), (2,2), (0,1), (0,2), (1,2)]:
1415        	stress_eps[:,i,j] += EPSILON_STRESS
1416        	eps_ne_rate_eps = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_eps, dt*theta, Temp, return_eps_ne=True)
1417        	r_eps = self.compute_residue(eps_ne_rate_eps, self.alpha, dt)
1418        	self.P[:,i,j] = (r_eps - self.r) / EPSILON_STRESS
1419        	self.P[:,j,i] = self.P[:,i,j]
1420        	stress_eps[:,i,j] -= EPSILON_STRESS
1421
1422        H = self.compute_H(Q, self.P)
1423        H_over_h = H/self.h[:,None,None]
1424
1425        return B, H_over_h
1426
1427
1428    def compute_H(self, Q: to.Tensor, P: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
1429        """
1430        Build the 6×6 matrix `H` from tensors `Q` and `P`.
1431
1432        Parameters
1433        ----------
1434        Q : torch.Tensor
1435            Sensitivity of rate to `alpha`, shape (N, 3, 3).
1436        P : torch.Tensor
1437            Sensitivity of residue to stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1438
1439        Returns
1440        -------
1441        torch.Tensor
1442            `H` with shape (N, 6, 6) in tensorial Voigt ordering.
1443        """
1444        n_elems, _, _ = P.shape
1445        H = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
1446        H[:,0,0] = Q[:,0,0]*P[:,0,0]
1447        H[:,0,1] = Q[:,0,0]*P[:,1,1]
1448        H[:,0,2] = Q[:,0,0]*P[:,2,2]
1449        H[:,0,3] = 2*Q[:,0,0]*P[:,0,1]
1450        H[:,0,4] = 2*Q[:,0,0]*P[:,0,2]
1451        H[:,0,5] = 2*Q[:,0,0]*P[:,1,2]
1452
1453        H[:,1,0] = Q[:,1,1]*P[:,0,0]
1454        H[:,1,1] = Q[:,1,1]*P[:,1,1]
1455        H[:,1,2] = Q[:,1,1]*P[:,2,2]
1456        H[:,1,3] = 2*Q[:,1,1]*P[:,0,1]
1457        H[:,1,4] = 2*Q[:,1,1]*P[:,0,2]
1458        H[:,1,5] = 2*Q[:,1,1]*P[:,1,2]
1459
1460        H[:,2,0] = Q[:,2,2]*P[:,0,0]
1461        H[:,2,1] = Q[:,2,2]*P[:,1,1]
1462        H[:,2,2] = Q[:,2,2]*P[:,2,2]
1463        H[:,2,3] = 2*Q[:,2,2]*P[:,0,1]
1464        H[:,2,4] = 2*Q[:,2,2]*P[:,0,2]
1465        H[:,2,5] = 2*Q[:,2,2]*P[:,1,2]
1466
1467        H[:,3,0] = Q[:,0,1]*P[:,0,0]
1468        H[:,3,1] = Q[:,0,1]*P[:,1,1]
1469        H[:,3,2] = Q[:,0,1]*P[:,2,2]
1470        H[:,3,3] = 2*Q[:,0,1]*P[:,0,1]
1471        H[:,3,4] = 2*Q[:,0,1]*P[:,0,2]
1472        H[:,3,5] = 2*Q[:,0,1]*P[:,1,2]
1473
1474        H[:,4,0] = Q[:,0,2]*P[:,0,0]
1475        H[:,4,1] = Q[:,0,2]*P[:,1,1]
1476        H[:,4,2] = Q[:,0,2]*P[:,2,2]
1477        H[:,4,3] = 2*Q[:,0,2]*P[:,0,1]
1478        H[:,4,4] = 2*Q[:,0,2]*P[:,0,2]
1479        H[:,4,5] = 2*Q[:,0,2]*P[:,1,2]
1480
1481        H[:,5,0] = Q[:,1,2]*P[:,0,0]
1482        H[:,5,1] = Q[:,1,2]*P[:,1,1]
1483        H[:,5,2] = Q[:,1,2]*P[:,2,2]
1484        H[:,5,3] = 2*Q[:,1,2]*P[:,0,1]
1485        H[:,5,4] = 2*Q[:,1,2]*P[:,0,2]
1486        H[:,5,5] = 2*Q[:,1,2]*P[:,1,2]
1487        return H

Viscoplastic model of Desai-type with hardening (state) variable alpha.

Parameters
  • mu_1, N_1, a_1, eta, n, beta_1, beta, m, gamma, sigma_t, alpha_0 (torch.Tensor): Model parameters per element, shape (N,).
  • name (str, optional): Element name, by default "desai".
Attributes
  • alpha (torch.Tensor): Current hardening variable per element, shape (N,).
  • Fvp (torch.Tensor): Current value of the yield function per element, shape (N,).
  • qsi, qsi_old (torch.Tensor): Accumulated viscoplastic strain measure and its previous value, shape (N,).
  • P (torch.Tensor): Sensitivity of the residue to stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • r, h (torch.Tensor): Residue and its derivative w.r.t. alpha, shapes (N,) and (N,).
ViscoplasticDesai( mu_1: torch.Tensor, N_1: torch.Tensor, a_1: torch.Tensor, eta: torch.Tensor, n: torch.Tensor, beta_1: torch.Tensor, beta: torch.Tensor, m: torch.Tensor, gamma: torch.Tensor, sigma_t: torch.Tensor, alpha_0: torch.Tensor, name: bool = 'desai') 
1045    def __init__(self,
1046						mu_1: to.Tensor,
1047						N_1: to.Tensor,
1048						a_1: to.Tensor,
1049						eta: to.Tensor,
1050						n: to.Tensor,
1051						beta_1: to.Tensor,
1052						beta: to.Tensor,
1053						m: to.Tensor,
1054						gamma: to.Tensor,
1055						sigma_t: to.Tensor,
1056						alpha_0: to.Tensor,
1057						name: bool="desai"):
1058        super().__init__(mu_1.shape[0])
1059        self.name = name
1060        self.mu_1 = mu_1
1061        self.N_1 = N_1
1062        self.a_1 = a_1
1063        self.eta = eta
1064        self.n = n
1065        self.beta_1 = beta_1
1066        self.beta = beta
1067        self.m = m
1068        self.gamma = gamma
1069        self.sigma_t = sigma_t
1070        self.alpha_0 = alpha_0
1071        self.F_0 = 1.0
1072        self.n_elems = self.alpha_0.shape[0]
1073        self.alpha = self.alpha_0.clone()
1074        self.Fvp = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1075        self.qsi = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1076        self.qsi_old = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)

def compute_residue( self, eps_rate: torch.Tensor, alpha: torch.Tensor, dt: float) -> torch.Tensor: 
1078    def compute_residue(self, eps_rate: to.Tensor, alpha: to.Tensor, dt: float) -> to.Tensor:
1079        """
1080        Residue of the implicit hardening equation.
1081
1082        Parameters
1083        ----------
1084        eps_rate : torch.Tensor
1085            Current inelastic strain rate, shape (N, 3, 3).
1086        alpha : torch.Tensor
1087            Hardening variable, shape (N,).
1088        dt : float
1089            Time step.
1090
1091        Returns
1092        -------
1093        torch.Tensor
1094            Residue per element, shape (N,).
1095
1096        Notes
1097        -----
1098        Updates `self.qsi` internally based on `eps_rate`.
1099        """
1100        self.qsi = self.qsi_old + to.sum(eps_rate**2, axis=(-2, -1))**0.5*dt
1101        return alpha - self.a_1 / (((self.a_1/self.alpha_0)**(1/self.eta) + self.qsi)**self.eta)

Residue of the implicit hardening equation.

Parameters
  • eps_rate (torch.Tensor): Current inelastic strain rate, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • alpha (torch.Tensor): Hardening variable, shape (N,).
  • dt (float): Time step.
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Residue per element, shape (N,).
Notes

Updates self.qsi internally based on eps_rate.

def update_internal_variables(self) -> None: 
1103    def update_internal_variables(self) -> None:
1104        """
1105        Commit accumulated measure `qsi`.
1106
1107        Returns
1108        -------
1109        None
1110        """
1111        self.qsi_old = self.qsi.clone()

Commit accumulated measure qsi.

Returns
  • None
def increment_internal_variables(self, stress: torch.Tensor, stress_k: torch.Tensor, dt: float) -> None: 
1113    def increment_internal_variables(self, stress: to.Tensor, stress_k: to.Tensor, dt:float) -> None:
1114        """
1115        Increment hardening variable `alpha` using linearization.
1116
1117        Parameters
1118        ----------
1119        stress : torch.Tensor
1120            End-of-step stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1121        stress_k : torch.Tensor
1122            Intermediate stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1123        dt : float
1124            Time step.
1125
1126        Returns
1127        -------
1128        None
1129
1130        Side Effects
1131        ------------
1132        Updates `self.alpha`.
1133        """
1134        delta_alpha = -(self.r + to.einsum('bij,bij->b', self.P, stress - stress_k))/self.h
1135        self.alpha += delta_alpha

Increment hardening variable alpha using linearization.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): End-of-step stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • stress_k (torch.Tensor): Intermediate stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • dt (float): Time step.
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Updates self.alpha.

def compute_stress_invariants( self, s_xx: torch.Tensor, s_yy: torch.Tensor, s_zz: torch.Tensor, s_xy: torch.Tensor, s_xz: torch.Tensor, s_yz: torch.Tensor) -> tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]: 
1137    def compute_stress_invariants(self, s_xx: to.Tensor,
1138										s_yy: to.Tensor,
1139										s_zz: to.Tensor,
1140										s_xy: to.Tensor,
1141										s_xz: to.Tensor,
1142										s_yz: to.Tensor) -> tuple[to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor, to.Tensor]:
1143        """
1144        Compute invariants (I1, I2, I3, J2, J3) and auxiliary quantities.
1145
1146        Parameters
1147        ----------
1148        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz : torch.Tensor
1149            Normal and shear components (MPa-scaled as provided), each shape (N,).
1150
1151        Returns
1152        -------
1153        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 : tuple of torch.Tensor
1154            Invariants and helper arrays; `ind_J2_leq_0` are indices where `J2 <= 0`.
1155        """
1156        I1 = s_xx + s_yy + s_zz
1157        I2 = s_xx*s_yy + s_yy*s_zz + s_xx*s_zz - s_xy**2 - s_yz**2 - s_xz**2
1158        I3 = s_xx*s_yy*s_zz + 2*s_xy*s_yz*s_xz - s_zz*s_xy**2 - s_xx*s_yz**2 - s_yy*s_xz**2
1159        J2 = (1/3)*I1**2 - I2
1160        J3 = (2/27)*I1**3 - (1/3)*I1*I2 + I3
1161        Sr = -(J3*np.sqrt(27))/(2*J2**1.5)
1162
1163        # Check where J2 <= 0.0
1164        ind_J2_leq_0 = to.where(J2 <= 0.0)[0]
1165
1166        # Sr will be nan if, J2=0.0. So, replace it by 0.0
1167        Sr[ind_J2_leq_0] = 0.0
1168
1169        I1_star = I1 + self.sigma_t
1170        return I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0

Compute invariants (I1, I2, I3, J2, J3) and auxiliary quantities.

Parameters
  • s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz (torch.Tensor): Normal and shear components (MPa-scaled as provided), each shape (N,).
Returns
  • I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 (tuple of torch.Tensor): Invariants and helper arrays; ind_J2_leq_0 are indices where J2 <= 0.
def extract_stress_components(self, stress: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor: 
1172    def extract_stress_components(self, stress: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
1173        """
1174        Extract and scale stress components from a 3×3 tensor.
1175
1176        Parameters
1177        ----------
1178        stress : torch.Tensor
1179            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1180
1181        Returns
1182        -------
1183        tuple[torch.Tensor, ...]
1184            `(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)`, each shape (N,).
1185        """
1186        stress_vec = -stress
1187        s_xx = stress_vec[:,0,0]/MPa
1188        s_yy = stress_vec[:,1,1]/MPa
1189        s_zz = stress_vec[:,2,2]/MPa
1190        s_xy = stress_vec[:,0,1]/MPa
1191        s_xz = stress_vec[:,0,2]/MPa
1192        s_yz = stress_vec[:,1,2]/MPa
1193        return s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz

Extract and scale stress components from a 3×3 tensor.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
Returns
  • tuple[torch.Tensor, ...]: (s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz), each shape (N,).
def compute_Fvp(self, alpha, I1, J2, Sr): 
1195    def compute_Fvp(self, alpha, I1, J2, Sr):
1196        """
1197        Compute the Desai viscoplastic yield function value `Fvp`.
1198
1199        Parameters
1200        ----------
1201        alpha : torch.Tensor
1202            Hardening variable per element, shape (N,).
1203        I1 : torch.Tensor
1204            First invariant, shape (N,).
1205        J2 : torch.Tensor
1206            Second deviatoric invariant, shape (N,).
1207        Sr : torch.Tensor
1208            Lode-related parameter, shape (N,).
1209
1210        Returns
1211        -------
1212        torch.Tensor
1213            `Fvp` per element, shape (N,).
1214        """
1215        F1 = (alpha*I1**self.n - self.gamma*I1**2)
1216        F2 = (to.exp(self.beta_1*I1) - self.beta*Sr)
1217        Fvp = J2 + F1*F2**self.m
1218        return Fvp

Compute the Desai viscoplastic yield function value Fvp.

Parameters
  • alpha (torch.Tensor): Hardening variable per element, shape (N,).
  • I1 (torch.Tensor): First invariant, shape (N,).
  • J2 (torch.Tensor): Second deviatoric invariant, shape (N,).
  • Sr (torch.Tensor): Lode-related parameter, shape (N,).
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: Fvp per element, shape (N,).
def compute_initial_hardening(self, stress: torch.Tensor, Fvp_0=0.0) -> None: 
1220    def compute_initial_hardening(self, stress: to.Tensor, Fvp_0=0.0) -> None:
1221        """
1222        Initialize `alpha` from a target `Fvp_0` and the current stress state.
1223
1224        Parameters
1225        ----------
1226        stress : torch.Tensor
1227            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1228        Fvp_0 : float, default=0.0
1229            Target initial value for `Fvp`.
1230
1231        Returns
1232        -------
1233        None
1234
1235        Side Effects
1236        ------------
1237        Sets `self.alpha_0`, `self.alpha`, and `self.Fvp`.
1238        """
1239        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz = self.extract_stress_components(stress)
1240        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, _ = self.compute_stress_invariants(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)
1241        self.alpha_0 =  self.gamma*I1_star**(2-self.n) + (Fvp_0 - J2)*I1_star**(-self.n)*(to.exp(self.beta_1*I1_star) - self.beta*Sr)**(-self.m)
1242        self.alpha = self.alpha_0.clone()
1243
1244        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz = self.extract_stress_components(stress)
1245        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 = self.compute_stress_invariants(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)
1246        self.Fvp = self.compute_Fvp(self.alpha, I1_star, J2, Sr)

Initialize alpha from a target Fvp_0 and the current stress state.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • Fvp_0 (float, default=0.0): Target initial value for Fvp.
Returns
  • None
Side Effects

Sets self.alpha_0, self.alpha, and self.Fvp.

def compute_eps_ne_rate( self, stress: torch.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: torch.Tensor, alpha=None, return_eps_ne=False): 
1249    def compute_eps_ne_rate(self, stress: to.Tensor, phi1: float, Temp: to.Tensor, alpha=None, return_eps_ne=False):
1250        """
1251        Compute viscoplastic strain rate and optionally return it.
1252
1253        Parameters
1254        ----------
1255        stress : torch.Tensor
1256            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1257        phi1 : float
1258            Time integration factor (dt*theta).
1259        Temp : torch.Tensor
1260            Temperature per element (unused).
1261        alpha : torch.Tensor or None, optional
1262            Hardening variable override; if `None`, use `self.alpha`.
1263        return_eps_ne : bool, default=False
1264            If True, return rate; else store it.
1265
1266        Returns
1267        -------
1268        None or torch.Tensor
1269            (N, 3, 3) if `return_eps_ne=True`, else `None`.
1270
1271        Notes
1272        -----
1273        Also updates `self.Fvp` when `return_eps_ne=False`.
1274        """
1275        if alpha == None:
1276        	alpha = self.alpha
1277
1278        s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz = self.extract_stress_components(stress)
1279        I1, I2, I3, J2, J3, Sr, I1_star, ind_J2_leq_0 = self.compute_stress_invariants(s_xx, s_yy, s_zz, s_xy, s_xz, s_yz)
1280
1281        # Compute yield function
1282        Fvp = self.compute_Fvp(alpha, I1_star, J2, Sr)
1283        if not return_eps_ne:
1284        	self.Fvp = Fvp.clone()
1285
1286
1287        # Compute flow direction, i.e. d(Fvp)/d(stress)
1288        F1 = (-alpha*I1**self.n + self.gamma*I1**2)
1289        F2 = (to.exp(self.beta_1*I1) - self.beta*Sr)
1290        dF1_dI1 = 2*self.gamma*I1 - self.n*alpha*I1**(self.n-1)
1291        dF2m_dI1 = self.beta_1*self.m*to.exp(self.beta_1*I1)*F2**(self.m-1)
1292        dF_dI1 = -(dF1_dI1*F2**self.m + F1*dF2m_dI1)
1293
1294        dF2_dJ2 = -(3*self.beta*J3*27**0.5)/(4*J2**(5/2))
1295        dF_dJ2 = 1 - F1*self.m*F2**(self.m-1)*dF2_dJ2
1296        dF_dJ3 = -self.m*F1*self.beta*np.sqrt(27)*F2**(self.m-1)/(2*J2**1.5)
1297
1298
1299        dI1_dSxx = 1.0
1300        dI1_dSyy = 1.0
1301        dI1_dSzz = 1.0
1302        dI1_dSxy = 0.0
1303        dI1_dSxz = 0.0
1304        dI1_dSyz = 0.0
1305
1306        dI2_dSxx = s_yy + s_zz
1307        dI2_dSyy = s_xx + s_zz
1308        dI2_dSzz = s_xx + s_yy
1309        dI2_dSxy = -2*s_xy
1310        dI2_dSxz = -2*s_xz
1311        dI2_dSyz = -2*s_yz
1312
1313        dI3_dSxx = s_yy*s_zz - s_yz**2
1314        dI3_dSyy = s_xx*s_zz - s_xz**2
1315        dI3_dSzz = s_xx*s_yy - s_xy**2
1316        dI3_dSxy = 2*(s_xz*s_yz - s_zz*s_xy)
1317        dI3_dSxz = 2*(s_xy*s_yz - s_yy*s_xz)
1318        dI3_dSyz = 2*(s_xz*s_xy - s_xx*s_yz)
1319
1320        dJ2_dI1 = (2/3)*I1
1321        dJ2_dI2 = -1.0
1322
1323        dJ2_dSxx = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSxx + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSxx
1324        dJ2_dSyy = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSyy + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSyy
1325        dJ2_dSzz = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSzz + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSzz
1326        dJ2_dSxy = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSxy + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSxy
1327        dJ2_dSxz = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSxz + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSxz
1328        dJ2_dSyz = dJ2_dI1*dI1_dSyz + dJ2_dI2*dI2_dSyz
1329
1330        dJ3_dI1 = (2/9)*I1**2 - (1/3)*I2
1331        dJ3_dI2 = -(1/3)*I1
1332        dJ3_dI3 = 1.0
1333
1334        dJ3_dSxx = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSxx + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSxx + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSxx
1335        dJ3_dSyy = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSyy + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSyy + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSyy
1336        dJ3_dSzz = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSzz + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSzz + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSzz
1337        dJ3_dSxy = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSxy + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSxy + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSxy
1338        dJ3_dSxz = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSxz + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSxz + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSxz
1339        dJ3_dSyz = dJ3_dI1*dI1_dSyz + dJ3_dI2*dI2_dSyz + dJ3_dI3*dI3_dSyz
1340
1341        dQdS_00 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSxx + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSxx + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSxx
1342        dQdS_11 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSyy + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSyy + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSyy
1343        dQdS_22 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSzz + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSzz + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSzz
1344        dQdS_01 = dQdS_10 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSxy + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSxy + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSxy
1345        dQdS_02 = dQdS_20 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSxz + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSxz + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSxz
1346        dQdS_12 = dQdS_21 = dF_dI1*dI1_dSyz + dF_dJ2*dJ2_dSyz + dF_dJ3*dJ3_dSyz
1347
1348        # Initialize viscoplastic direction
1349        dQdS = to.zeros_like(stress, dtype=to.float64)
1350        dQdS[:,0,0] = dQdS_00
1351        dQdS[:,1,1] = dQdS_11
1352        dQdS[:,2,2] = dQdS_22
1353        dQdS[:,1,0] = dQdS[:,0,1] = dQdS_01
1354        dQdS[:,2,0] = dQdS[:,0,2] = dQdS_02
1355        dQdS[:,2,1] = dQdS[:,1,2] = dQdS_12
1356
1357        # Wherever J2=0, make viscoplasticity to be zero
1358        dQdS[ind_J2_leq_0,:,:] = 0.0
1359
1360        # Calculate strain rate
1361        ramp_idx = to.where(Fvp > 0)[0]
1362        lmbda = to.zeros(self.n_elems, dtype=to.float64)
1363        if len(ramp_idx) != 0:
1364        	lmbda[ramp_idx] = self.mu_1[ramp_idx]*(Fvp[ramp_idx]/self.F_0)**self.N_1[ramp_idx]
1365        eps_vp_rate = -dQdS*lmbda[:, None, None]
1366
1367        if return_eps_ne:
1368        	return eps_vp_rate
1369        else:
1370            self.eps_ne_rate = eps_vp_rate

Compute viscoplastic strain rate and optionally return it.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • phi1 (float): Time integration factor (dt*theta).
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (unused).
  • alpha (torch.Tensor or None, optional): Hardening variable override; if None, use self.alpha.
  • return_eps_ne (bool, default=False): If True, return rate; else store it.
Returns
  • None or torch.Tensor: (N, 3, 3) if return_eps_ne=True, else None.
Notes

Also updates self.Fvp when return_eps_ne=False.

def compute_B_and_H_over_h( self, stress: torch.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: torch.Tensor) -> tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]: 
1373    def compute_B_and_H_over_h(self, stress: to.Tensor, dt: float, theta: float, Temp: to.Tensor) -> tuple[to.Tensor, to.Tensor]:
1374        """
1375        Compute `B` and `H/h` via perturbations of `alpha` and stress.
1376
1377        Parameters
1378        ----------
1379        stress : torch.Tensor
1380            Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
1381        dt : float
1382            Time step.
1383        theta : float
1384            Time integration parameter.
1385        Temp : torch.Tensor
1386            Temperature per element (unused).
1387
1388        Returns
1389        -------
1390        B : torch.Tensor
1391            Driving term, shape (N, 3, 3).
1392        H_over_h : torch.Tensor
1393            Linearization ratio, shape (N, 6, 6).
1394
1395        Notes
1396        -----
1397        Uses finite differences to approximate sensitivities.
1398        """
1399        # EPSILON_ALPHA = 1e-7
1400        EPSILON_ALPHA = 0.0001*self.alpha
1401        EPSILON_STRESS = 1e-1
1402
1403        alpha_eps = self.alpha + EPSILON_ALPHA
1404        eps_ne_rate_eps = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress, dt*theta, Temp, alpha=alpha_eps, return_eps_ne=True)
1405
1406        self.r = self.compute_residue(self.eps_ne_rate, self.alpha, dt)
1407        r_eps = self.compute_residue(eps_ne_rate_eps, alpha_eps, dt)
1408        self.h = (r_eps - self.r) / EPSILON_ALPHA
1409        Q = (eps_ne_rate_eps - self.eps_ne_rate) / EPSILON_ALPHA[:,None,None]
1410        B = (self.r / self.h)[:,None,None] * Q
1411
1412        self.P = to.zeros_like(stress)
1413        stress_eps = stress.clone()
1414        for i, j in [(0,0), (1,1), (2,2), (0,1), (0,2), (1,2)]:
1415        	stress_eps[:,i,j] += EPSILON_STRESS
1416        	eps_ne_rate_eps = self.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_eps, dt*theta, Temp, return_eps_ne=True)
1417        	r_eps = self.compute_residue(eps_ne_rate_eps, self.alpha, dt)
1418        	self.P[:,i,j] = (r_eps - self.r) / EPSILON_STRESS
1419        	self.P[:,j,i] = self.P[:,i,j]
1420        	stress_eps[:,i,j] -= EPSILON_STRESS
1421
1422        H = self.compute_H(Q, self.P)
1423        H_over_h = H/self.h[:,None,None]
1424
1425        return B, H_over_h

Compute B and H/h via perturbations of alpha and stress.

Parameters
  • stress (torch.Tensor): Stress per element, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • dt (float): Time step.
  • theta (float): Time integration parameter.
  • Temp (torch.Tensor): Temperature per element (unused).
Returns
  • B (torch.Tensor): Driving term, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • H_over_h (torch.Tensor): Linearization ratio, shape (N, 6, 6).
Notes

Uses finite differences to approximate sensitivities.

def compute_H(self, Q: torch.Tensor, P: torch.Tensor) -> torch.Tensor: 
1428    def compute_H(self, Q: to.Tensor, P: to.Tensor) -> to.Tensor:
1429        """
1430        Build the 6×6 matrix `H` from tensors `Q` and `P`.
1431
1432        Parameters
1433        ----------
1434        Q : torch.Tensor
1435            Sensitivity of rate to `alpha`, shape (N, 3, 3).
1436        P : torch.Tensor
1437            Sensitivity of residue to stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
1438
1439        Returns
1440        -------
1441        torch.Tensor
1442            `H` with shape (N, 6, 6) in tensorial Voigt ordering.
1443        """
1444        n_elems, _, _ = P.shape
1445        H = to.zeros((n_elems, 6, 6), dtype=to.float64)
1446        H[:,0,0] = Q[:,0,0]*P[:,0,0]
1447        H[:,0,1] = Q[:,0,0]*P[:,1,1]
1448        H[:,0,2] = Q[:,0,0]*P[:,2,2]
1449        H[:,0,3] = 2*Q[:,0,0]*P[:,0,1]
1450        H[:,0,4] = 2*Q[:,0,0]*P[:,0,2]
1451        H[:,0,5] = 2*Q[:,0,0]*P[:,1,2]
1452
1453        H[:,1,0] = Q[:,1,1]*P[:,0,0]
1454        H[:,1,1] = Q[:,1,1]*P[:,1,1]
1455        H[:,1,2] = Q[:,1,1]*P[:,2,2]
1456        H[:,1,3] = 2*Q[:,1,1]*P[:,0,1]
1457        H[:,1,4] = 2*Q[:,1,1]*P[:,0,2]
1458        H[:,1,5] = 2*Q[:,1,1]*P[:,1,2]
1459
1460        H[:,2,0] = Q[:,2,2]*P[:,0,0]
1461        H[:,2,1] = Q[:,2,2]*P[:,1,1]
1462        H[:,2,2] = Q[:,2,2]*P[:,2,2]
1463        H[:,2,3] = 2*Q[:,2,2]*P[:,0,1]
1464        H[:,2,4] = 2*Q[:,2,2]*P[:,0,2]
1465        H[:,2,5] = 2*Q[:,2,2]*P[:,1,2]
1466
1467        H[:,3,0] = Q[:,0,1]*P[:,0,0]
1468        H[:,3,1] = Q[:,0,1]*P[:,1,1]
1469        H[:,3,2] = Q[:,0,1]*P[:,2,2]
1470        H[:,3,3] = 2*Q[:,0,1]*P[:,0,1]
1471        H[:,3,4] = 2*Q[:,0,1]*P[:,0,2]
1472        H[:,3,5] = 2*Q[:,0,1]*P[:,1,2]
1473
1474        H[:,4,0] = Q[:,0,2]*P[:,0,0]
1475        H[:,4,1] = Q[:,0,2]*P[:,1,1]
1476        H[:,4,2] = Q[:,0,2]*P[:,2,2]
1477        H[:,4,3] = 2*Q[:,0,2]*P[:,0,1]
1478        H[:,4,4] = 2*Q[:,0,2]*P[:,0,2]
1479        H[:,4,5] = 2*Q[:,0,2]*P[:,1,2]
1480
1481        H[:,5,0] = Q[:,1,2]*P[:,0,0]
1482        H[:,5,1] = Q[:,1,2]*P[:,1,1]
1483        H[:,5,2] = Q[:,1,2]*P[:,2,2]
1484        H[:,5,3] = 2*Q[:,1,2]*P[:,0,1]
1485        H[:,5,4] = 2*Q[:,1,2]*P[:,0,2]
1486        H[:,5,5] = 2*Q[:,1,2]*P[:,1,2]
1487        return H

Build the 6×6 matrix H from tensors Q and P.

Parameters
  • Q (torch.Tensor): Sensitivity of rate to alpha, shape (N, 3, 3).
  • P (torch.Tensor): Sensitivity of residue to stress, shape (N, 3, 3).
Returns
  • torch.Tensor: H with shape (N, 6, 6) in tensorial Voigt ordering.
class SaveFields: 
 32class SaveFields():
 33	"""
 34	Manage writing FEniCSx fields to XDMF over time.
 35
 36	This helper collects references to fields stored on an equation object
 37	(either :class:`LinearMomentum` or :class:`HeatDiffusion`), opens one
 38	XDMF writer per field, and writes time-stamped data during a simulation.
 39	It can also copy the original Gmsh mesh file into the output directory
 40	for provenance.
 41
 42	Parameters
 43	----------
 44	eq : EqType
 45	    Equation/model object. Must expose:
 46	    - ``eq.grid.mesh`` (a DOLFINx mesh with communicator),
 47	    - ``eq.grid.grid_folder`` (path where the original ``.msh`` lives),
 48	    - ``eq.grid.geometry_name`` (base filename of the ``.msh``),
 49	    - attributes for each field you register via :meth:`add_output_field`.
 50
 51	Attributes
 52	----------
 53	eq : EqType
 54	    Stored equation/model handle.
 55	fields_data : list of dict
 56	    Registered field descriptors, each with keys
 57	    ``{"field_name": str, "label_name": str}``.
 58	output_fields : list of dolfinx.io.XDMFFile
 59	    Open writers, in the same order as ``fields_data``.
 60	output_folder : str
 61	    Base directory for outputs (set via :meth:`set_output_folder`).
 62
 63	Notes
 64	-----
 65	- Voigt/tensor conventions, function ranks, and meshtags are not managed
 66	  here; this class only writes whatever :mod:`dolfinx` ``Function`` you
 67	  provide in ``eq``.
 68	  created by :meth:`initialize`. Ensure they exist beforehand.
 69	"""
 70	def __init__(self, eq: EqType):
 71		self.eq = eq
 72		self.fields_data = []
 73		self.output_fields = []
 74
 75	def set_output_folder(self, output_folder: str) -> None:
 76		"""
 77        Set the base directory for all outputs.
 78
 79        Parameters
 80        ----------
 81        output_folder : str
 82            Path to the directory where subfolders and XDMF files will be placed.
 83
 84        Returns
 85        -------
 86        None
 87        """
 88		self.output_folder = output_folder
 89
 90	def add_output_field(self, field_name : str, label_name : str) -> None:
 91		"""
 92        Register a field to be written, with a display label.
 93
 94        Parameters
 95        ----------
 96        field_name : str
 97            Attribute name on ``self.eq`` that refers to a
 98            :class:`dolfinx.fem.Function` (e.g., ``"u"``, ``"T"``, ``"sigma"``).
 99        label_name : str
100            Human-readable name assigned to ``field.name`` when writing
101            (appears in XDMF/ParaView).
102
103        Returns
104        -------
105        None
106
107        Notes
108        -----
109        You may call this multiple times before :meth:`initialize`.
110        """
111		data = {
112			"field_name": field_name,
113			"label_name": label_name,
114		}
115		self.fields_data.append(data)
116
117	def initialize(self) -> None:
118		"""
119        Open one XDMF writer per registered field and write the mesh.
120
121        For each entry in :attr:`fields_data`, opens an XDMF at
122        ``{output_folder}/{field_name}/{field_name}.xdmf`` and writes
123        ``self.eq.grid.mesh`` once.
124
125        Parameters
126        ----------
127        None
128
129        Returns
130        -------
131        None
132
133        Raises
134        ------
135        OSError
136            If the per-field output directory does not exist.
137
138        Notes
139        -----
140        - Files are opened in ``"w"`` mode (overwrite).
141        """
142		for field_data in self.fields_data:
143			field_name = field_data["field_name"]
144			output_field = do.io.XDMFFile(self.eq.grid.mesh.comm, os.path.join(self.output_folder, field_name, f"{field_name}.xdmf"), "w")
145			output_field.write_mesh(self.eq.grid.mesh)
146			self.output_fields.append(output_field)
147
148	def save_fields(self, t : float) -> None:
149		"""
150		Write all registered fields at simulation time ``t``.
151
152		Parameters
153		----------
154		t : float
155		    Time value to associate with this write.
156
157		Returns
158		-------
159		None
160
161		Notes
162		-----
163		For each descriptor in :attr:`fields_data`:
164		1. Fetches the field via ``getattr(self.eq, field_name)``.
165		2. Sets ``field.name = label_name``.
166		3. Calls ``XDMFFile.write_function(field, t)`` on the corresponding writer.
167		"""
168		for i, field_data in enumerate(self.fields_data):
169			field = getattr(self.eq, field_data["field_name"])
170			field.name = field_data["label_name"]
171			self.output_fields[i].write_function(field, t)
172
173	def save_mesh(self) -> None:
174		"""
175		Copy the original Gmsh mesh file into ``{output_folder}/mesh/``.
176
177		Parameters
178		----------
179		None
180
181		Returns
182		-------
183		None
184
185		Side Effects
186		------------
187		- Creates ``{output_folder}/mesh`` if it does not exist.
188		- Copies
189		  ``{eq.grid.grid_folder}/{eq.grid.geometry_name}.msh``
190		  to that directory.
191
192		Raises
193		------
194		FileNotFoundError
195		    If the source ``.msh`` file does not exist.
196		OSError
197		    If the copy fails for other I/O reasons.
198		"""
199		mesh_origin_file = os.path.join(self.eq.grid.grid_folder, f"{self.eq.grid.geometry_name}.msh")
200		mesh_destination_folder = os.path.join(self.output_folder, "mesh")
201		if not os.path.exists(mesh_destination_folder):
202			os.makedirs(mesh_destination_folder, exist_ok=True)
203		shutil.copy(mesh_origin_file, mesh_destination_folder)

Manage writing FEniCSx fields to XDMF over time.

This helper collects references to fields stored on an equation object (either LinearMomentum or HeatDiffusion), opens one XDMF writer per field, and writes time-stamped data during a simulation. It can also copy the original Gmsh mesh file into the output directory for provenance.

Parameters
  • eq (EqType): Equation/model object. Must expose:
    • eq.grid.mesh (a DOLFINx mesh with communicator),
    • eq.grid.grid_folder (path where the original .msh lives),
    • eq.grid.geometry_name (base filename of the .msh),
    • attributes for each field you register via add_output_field().
Attributes
  • eq (EqType): Stored equation/model handle.
  • fields_data (list of dict): Registered field descriptors, each with keys {"field_name": str, "label_name": str}.
  • output_fields (list of dolfinx.io.XDMFFile): Open writers, in the same order as fields_data.
  • output_folder (str): Base directory for outputs (set via set_output_folder()).
Notes
  • Voigt/tensor conventions, function ranks, and meshtags are not managed here; this class only writes whatever dolfinx Function you provide in eq. created by initialize(). Ensure they exist beforehand.
SaveFields(eq: Any)

71		self.eq = eq
72		self.fields_data = []
73		self.output_fields = []
eq
fields_data
output_fields
def set_output_folder(self, output_folder: str) -> None:

78
79        Parameters
80        ----------

82            Path to the directory where subfolders and XDMF files will be placed.
83
84        Returns
85        -------
86        None
87        """
88		self.output_folder = output_folder

 98            :class:`dolfinx.fem.Function` (e.g., ``"u"``, ``"T"``, ``"sigma"``).
 99        label_name : str

101            (appears in XDMF/ParaView).
102
103        Returns

105        None
106
107        Notes
108        -----
109        You may call this multiple times before :meth:`initialize`.
110        """

112			"field_name": field_name,
113			"label_name": label_name,
114		}
115		self.fields_data.append(data)

  • label_name (str): Human-readable name assigned to field.name when writing (appears in XDMF/ParaView).
Returns
  • None

def initialize(self) -> None: 
117	def initialize(self) -> None:
118		"""
119        Open one XDMF writer per registered field and write the mesh.
120
121        For each entry in :attr:`fields_data`, opens an XDMF at
122        ``{output_folder}/{field_name}/{field_name}.xdmf`` and writes
123        ``self.eq.grid.mesh`` once.
124
125        Parameters
126        ----------
127        None
128
129        Returns
130        -------
131        None
132
133        Raises
134        ------
135        OSError
136            If the per-field output directory does not exist.
137
138        Notes
139        -----
140        - Files are opened in ``"w"`` mode (overwrite).
141        """
142		for field_data in self.fields_data:
143			field_name = field_data["field_name"]
144			output_field = do.io.XDMFFile(self.eq.grid.mesh.comm, os.path.join(self.output_folder, field_name, f"{field_name}.xdmf"), "w")
145			output_field.write_mesh(self.eq.grid.mesh)
146			self.output_fields.append(output_field)

  • OSError: If the per-field output directory does not exist.

173	def save_mesh(self) -> None:
174		"""
175		Copy the original Gmsh mesh file into ``{output_folder}/mesh/``.
176
177		Parameters

179		None
180
181		Returns
182		-------

184

188		- Copies

190		  to that directory.

195		    If the source ``.msh`` file does not exist.
196		OSError

200		mesh_destination_folder = os.path.join(self.output_folder, "mesh")
201		if not os.path.exists(mesh_destination_folder):
202			os.makedirs(mesh_destination_folder, exist_ok=True)

  • Copies {eq.grid.grid_folder}/{eq.grid.geometry_name}.msh to that directory.
Raises
  • FileNotFoundError: If the source .msh file does not exist.
  • OSError: If the copy fails for other I/O reasons.
class Simulator_TM(safeincave.Simulators.Simulator): 
 58class Simulator_TM(Simulator):
 59	"""
 60	Run the coupled thermo–mechanical simulation.
 61
 62	Workflow
 63	--------
 64	1. Initialize outputs.
 65	2. Initialize momentum temperature from the heat solution and update BCs.
 66	3. Optionally solve a purely elastic response.
 67	4. Initialize non-elastic rates.
 68	5. For each time step:
 69
 70	   - Advance time and update boundary conditions for both equations.
 71	   - Solve the heat equation for ``(t, dt)`` and set temperatures in momentum.
 72	   - Iterate the momentum step (assemble/solve, update internal variables and rates).
 73	   - Save requested fields.
 74
 75	Returns
 76	-------
 77	None
 78	"""
 79	def __init__(self, eq_mom: LinearMomentum, 
 80					   eq_heat: HeatDiffusion, 
 81					   t_control: TimeControllerBase, 
 82					   outputs: list[SaveFields],
 83					   compute_elastic_response: bool=True):
 84		self.eq_mom = eq_mom
 85		self.eq_heat = eq_heat
 86		self.t_control = t_control
 87		self.outputs = outputs
 88		self.compute_elastic_response = compute_elastic_response
 89		
 90		ScreenPrinter.reset_instance()
 91		self.screen = ScreenPrinter(self.eq_mom.grid, self.eq_mom.solver, self.eq_mom.mat, self.outputs, t_control.time_unit)
 92
 93	def run(self) -> None:
 94		"""
 95		Run the coupled thermo–mechanical simulation.
 96
 97		Workflow
 98		--------
 99		1. Initialize outputs.
100		2. Initialize momentum temperature history from the heat solution.
101		3. Update BCs and optionally solve a purely elastic step.
102		4. Initialize non-elastic rates.
103		5. Time loop:
104
105		   - Advance time, update BCs, solve heat step.
106		   - Fixed-point (or single-pass) iterate the momentum step with the
107		     current temperature, updating internal variables and rates.
108		   - Save requested fields.
109
110		Convergence
111		-----------
112		Uses a relative change in total strain between iterations as error.
113		If ``theta == 1.0`` (backward Euler) or there are no non-elastic
114		elements, iteration terminates immediately.
115
116		Returns
117		-------
118		None
119
120		Notes
121		-----
122		- Calls ``SaveFields.initialize()`` once and ``save_fields(t)`` at each
123		  saved time, followed by ``save_mesh()`` after the loop.
124		- Printing of progress occurs on rank 0 only.
125		- The first ``output.save_fields(0)`` call targets the last ``output``
126		  from the preceding loop variable; ensure all outputs are saved by
127		  iterating over ``self.outputs``.
128		"""
129		# Output field
130		for output in self.outputs:
131			output.initialize()
132
133		# Set initial temperature
134		T_elems = self.eq_heat.get_T_elems()
135		self.eq_mom.set_T0(T_elems)
136
137		# Update boundary conditions
138		self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(self.t_control.t)
139		self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(self.t_control.t)
140
141		if self.compute_elastic_response:
142			# Solve elasticity
143			self.eq_mom.solve_elastic_response()
144
145			# Calculate total (elastic) strain
146			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
147
148			# Compute stress
149			stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_elastic_stress(eps_tot_to)
150
151		else:
152			# Calculate total strain
153			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
154
155			# Retrieve stress
156			stress_to = numpy2torch(self.eq_mom.sig.x.array.reshape((self.eq_mom.n_elems, 3, 3)))
157
158		# Set new temperature to momentum equation
159		T_elems = self.eq_heat.get_T_elems()
160		self.eq_mom.set_T(T_elems)
161		self.eq_mom.set_T0(T_elems)
162
163		# Calculate and eps_ie_rate_old
164		self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, self.t_control.t)
165		self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
166
167
168		# self.eq_heat.solve(0, self.t_control.dt)
169
170		# Save fields
171		self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
172		self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
173		self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
174		self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
175		output.save_fields(0)
176
177		# Time loop
178		while self.t_control.keep_looping():
179
180			# Advance time
181			self.t_control.advance_time()
182			t = self.t_control.t
183			dt = self.t_control.dt
184
185			# Update boundary conditions
186			self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
187			self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(t)
188			self.eq_heat.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
189			self.eq_heat.bc.update_neumann(t)
190
191			# Solve heat
192			self.eq_heat.solve(t, dt)
193
194			# Set new temperature to momentum equation
195			T_elems = self.eq_heat.get_T_elems()
196			self.eq_mom.set_T(T_elems)
197
198			# Iterative loop settings
199			tol = 1e-6
200			error = 2*tol
201			ite = 0
202			maxiter = 20
203
204			while error > tol and ite < maxiter:
205
206				# Update total strain of previous iteration (eps_tot_k <-- eps_tot)
207				eps_tot_k_to = eps_tot_to.clone()
208
209				# Update stress
210				stress_k_to = stress_to.clone()
211
212				# Build bi-linear form
213				self.eq_mom.solve(stress_k_to, t, dt)
214
215				# Compute total strain
216				eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
217
218				# Compute stress
219				stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_stress(eps_tot_to)
220
221				# Increment internal variables
222				self.eq_mom.increment_internal_variables(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
223
224				# Compute inelastic strain rates
225				self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, dt)
226
227				# Compute error
228				if self.eq_mom.theta == 1.0:
229					error = 0.0
230				elif len(self.eq_mom.mat.elems_ne) == 0:
231					error = 0.0
232				else:
233					eps_tot_k_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_k_to)
234					eps_tot_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_to)
235					local_error =  np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_k_flat - eps_tot_flat) / np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_flat)
236					error = self.eq_mom.grid.mesh.comm.allreduce(local_error, op=MPI.SUM)
237
238				ite += 1
239
240			# Update internal variables
241			self.eq_mom.update_internal_variables()
242
243			# Update strain rates
244			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
245
246			# Update strain
247			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_old(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
248
249			# Save fields
250			self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
251			self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
252			self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
253			self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
254			for output in self.outputs:
255				output.save_fields(t)
256
257			# Print stuff
258			current_time = "%.3f"%(t/self.t_control.time_conversion)
259			screen_output_row = [
260									self.t_control.step_counter, 
261									self.t_control.dt/self.t_control.time_conversion,
262									f"{current_time} / {self.t_control.t_final/self.t_control.time_conversion}",
263									ite,
264									error,
265			]
266			self.screen.print_row(screen_output_row)
267
268		self.screen.close()
269
270		for output in self.outputs:
271			output.save_mesh()

Run the coupled thermo–mechanical simulation.

Workflow
  1. Initialize outputs.
  2. Initialize momentum temperature from the heat solution and update BCs.
  3. Optionally solve a purely elastic response.
  4. Initialize non-elastic rates.

  5. For each time step:

    • Advance time and update boundary conditions for both equations.
    • Solve the heat equation for (t, dt) and set temperatures in momentum.
    • Iterate the momentum step (assemble/solve, update internal variables and rates).
    • Save requested fields.
Returns
  • None
Simulator_TM( eq_mom: LinearMomentum, eq_heat: HeatDiffusion, t_control: TimeControllerBase, outputs: list[SaveFields], compute_elastic_response: bool = True) 
79	def __init__(self, eq_mom: LinearMomentum, 
80					   eq_heat: HeatDiffusion, 
81					   t_control: TimeControllerBase, 
82					   outputs: list[SaveFields],
83					   compute_elastic_response: bool=True):
84		self.eq_mom = eq_mom
85		self.eq_heat = eq_heat
86		self.t_control = t_control
87		self.outputs = outputs
88		self.compute_elastic_response = compute_elastic_response
89		
90		ScreenPrinter.reset_instance()
91		self.screen = ScreenPrinter(self.eq_mom.grid, self.eq_mom.solver, self.eq_mom.mat, self.outputs, t_control.time_unit)
eq_mom
eq_heat
t_control
outputs
compute_elastic_response
screen
def run(self) -> None: 
 93	def run(self) -> None:
 94		"""
 95		Run the coupled thermo–mechanical simulation.
 96
 97		Workflow
 98		--------
 99		1. Initialize outputs.
100		2. Initialize momentum temperature history from the heat solution.
101		3. Update BCs and optionally solve a purely elastic step.
102		4. Initialize non-elastic rates.
103		5. Time loop:
104
105		   - Advance time, update BCs, solve heat step.
106		   - Fixed-point (or single-pass) iterate the momentum step with the
107		     current temperature, updating internal variables and rates.
108		   - Save requested fields.
109
110		Convergence
111		-----------
112		Uses a relative change in total strain between iterations as error.
113		If ``theta == 1.0`` (backward Euler) or there are no non-elastic
114		elements, iteration terminates immediately.
115
116		Returns
117		-------
118		None
119
120		Notes
121		-----
122		- Calls ``SaveFields.initialize()`` once and ``save_fields(t)`` at each
123		  saved time, followed by ``save_mesh()`` after the loop.
124		- Printing of progress occurs on rank 0 only.
125		- The first ``output.save_fields(0)`` call targets the last ``output``
126		  from the preceding loop variable; ensure all outputs are saved by
127		  iterating over ``self.outputs``.
128		"""
129		# Output field
130		for output in self.outputs:
131			output.initialize()
132
133		# Set initial temperature
134		T_elems = self.eq_heat.get_T_elems()
135		self.eq_mom.set_T0(T_elems)
136
137		# Update boundary conditions
138		self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(self.t_control.t)
139		self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(self.t_control.t)
140
141		if self.compute_elastic_response:
142			# Solve elasticity
143			self.eq_mom.solve_elastic_response()
144
145			# Calculate total (elastic) strain
146			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
147
148			# Compute stress
149			stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_elastic_stress(eps_tot_to)
150
151		else:
152			# Calculate total strain
153			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
154
155			# Retrieve stress
156			stress_to = numpy2torch(self.eq_mom.sig.x.array.reshape((self.eq_mom.n_elems, 3, 3)))
157
158		# Set new temperature to momentum equation
159		T_elems = self.eq_heat.get_T_elems()
160		self.eq_mom.set_T(T_elems)
161		self.eq_mom.set_T0(T_elems)
162
163		# Calculate and eps_ie_rate_old
164		self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, self.t_control.t)
165		self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
166
167
168		# self.eq_heat.solve(0, self.t_control.dt)
169
170		# Save fields
171		self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
172		self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
173		self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
174		self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
175		output.save_fields(0)
176
177		# Time loop
178		while self.t_control.keep_looping():
179
180			# Advance time
181			self.t_control.advance_time()
182			t = self.t_control.t
183			dt = self.t_control.dt
184
185			# Update boundary conditions
186			self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
187			self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(t)
188			self.eq_heat.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
189			self.eq_heat.bc.update_neumann(t)
190
191			# Solve heat
192			self.eq_heat.solve(t, dt)
193
194			# Set new temperature to momentum equation
195			T_elems = self.eq_heat.get_T_elems()
196			self.eq_mom.set_T(T_elems)
197
198			# Iterative loop settings
199			tol = 1e-6
200			error = 2*tol
201			ite = 0
202			maxiter = 20
203
204			while error > tol and ite < maxiter:
205
206				# Update total strain of previous iteration (eps_tot_k <-- eps_tot)
207				eps_tot_k_to = eps_tot_to.clone()
208
209				# Update stress
210				stress_k_to = stress_to.clone()
211
212				# Build bi-linear form
213				self.eq_mom.solve(stress_k_to, t, dt)
214
215				# Compute total strain
216				eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
217
218				# Compute stress
219				stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_stress(eps_tot_to)
220
