221				# Increment internal variables
222				self.eq_mom.increment_internal_variables(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
223
224				# Compute inelastic strain rates
225				self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, dt)
226
227				# Compute error
228				if self.eq_mom.theta == 1.0:
229					error = 0.0
230				elif len(self.eq_mom.mat.elems_ne) == 0:
231					error = 0.0
232				else:
233					eps_tot_k_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_k_to)
234					eps_tot_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_to)
235					local_error =  np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_k_flat - eps_tot_flat) / np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_flat)
236					error = self.eq_mom.grid.mesh.comm.allreduce(local_error, op=MPI.SUM)
237
238				ite += 1
239
240			# Update internal variables
241			self.eq_mom.update_internal_variables()
242
243			# Update strain rates
244			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
245
246			# Update strain
247			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_old(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
248
249			# Save fields
250			self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
251			self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
252			self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
253			self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
254			for output in self.outputs:
255				output.save_fields(t)
256
257			# Print stuff
258			current_time = "%.3f"%(t/self.t_control.time_conversion)
259			screen_output_row = [
260									self.t_control.step_counter, 
261									self.t_control.dt/self.t_control.time_conversion,
262									f"{current_time} / {self.t_control.t_final/self.t_control.time_conversion}",
263									ite,
264									error,
265			]
266			self.screen.print_row(screen_output_row)
267
268		self.screen.close()
269
270		for output in self.outputs:
271			output.save_mesh()

Run the coupled thermo–mechanical simulation.

Workflow
  1. Initialize outputs.
  2. Initialize momentum temperature history from the heat solution.
  3. Update BCs and optionally solve a purely elastic step.
  4. Initialize non-elastic rates.

  5. Time loop:

    • Advance time, update BCs, solve heat step.
    • Fixed-point (or single-pass) iterate the momentum step with the current temperature, updating internal variables and rates.
    • Save requested fields.
Convergence

Uses a relative change in total strain between iterations as error. If theta == 1.0 (backward Euler) or there are no non-elastic elements, iteration terminates immediately.

Returns
  • None
Notes
  • Calls SaveFields.initialize() once and save_fields(t) at each saved time, followed by save_mesh() after the loop.
  • Printing of progress occurs on rank 0 only.
  • The first output.save_fields(0) call targets the last output from the preceding loop variable; ensure all outputs are saved by iterating over self.outputs.
class Simulator_T(safeincave.Simulators.Simulator): 
463class Simulator_T(Simulator):
464	"""
465    Thermal-only simulator (heat diffusion).
466
467    Advances the heat equation with fully-implicit time loop and writes fields.
468
469    Parameters
470    ----------
471    eq_heat : HeatDiffusion
472        Configured heat equation (materials, BCs, solver set).
473    t_control : TimeControllerBase
474        Time controller providing `t`, `dt`, and loop control.
475    outputs : list of SaveFields
476        Output writers to initialize and use at each saved time.
477    compute_elastic_response : bool, default=True
478        Unused placeholder kept for interface parity.
479
480    Attributes
481    ----------
482    eq_heat : HeatDiffusion
483    t_control : TimeControllerBase
484    outputs : list[SaveFields]
485    """
486	def __init__(self, eq_heat: HeatDiffusion,
487					   t_control: TimeControllerBase,
488					   outputs: list[SaveFields],
489					   compute_elastic_response: bool=True):
490		self.eq_heat = eq_heat
491		self.t_control = t_control
492		self.outputs = outputs
493
494		ScreenPrinter.reset_instance()
495		self.screen = ScreenPrinter(self.eq_heat.grid, self.eq_heat.solver, self.eq_heat.mat, self.outputs, t_control.time_unit)
496
497	def run(self) -> None:
498		"""
499        Run the thermal simulation.
500
501        Workflow
502        --------
503        1. Initialize outputs.
504        2. (Optionally) solve an initial step.
505        3. Time loop: update BCs, solve heat equation for `(t, dt)`, and save.
506
507        Returns
508        -------
509        None
510
511        Notes
512        -----
513        Printing of progress occurs on rank 0 only.
514        """
515		# Output field
516		for output in self.outputs:
517			output.initialize()
518
519		# # Solve initial T field
520		# self.eq_heat.solve(0, self.t_control.dt)
521
522		# Save fields
523		output.save_fields(0)
524
525		# Time loop
526		while self.t_control.keep_looping():
527
528			# Advance time
529			self.t_control.advance_time()
530			t = self.t_control.t
531			dt = self.t_control.dt
532
533			# Update boundary conditions
534			self.eq_heat.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
535			self.eq_heat.bc.update_neumann(t)
536
537			# Solve heat
538			self.eq_heat.solve(t, dt)
539
540			# Save fields
541			for output in self.outputs:
542				output.save_fields(t)
543
544			# Print stuff
545			current_time = "%.3f"%(t/self.t_control.time_conversion)
546			screen_output_row = [
547									self.t_control.step_counter, 
548									self.t_control.dt/self.t_control.time_conversion,
549									f"{current_time} / {self.t_control.t_final/self.t_control.time_conversion}",
550									0,
551									0,
552			]
553			self.screen.print_row(screen_output_row)
554
555		self.screen.close()
556
557		for output in self.outputs:
558			output.save_mesh()

Thermal-only simulator (heat diffusion).

Advances the heat equation with fully-implicit time loop and writes fields.

Parameters
  • eq_heat (HeatDiffusion): Configured heat equation (materials, BCs, solver set).
  • t_control (TimeControllerBase): Time controller providing t, dt, and loop control.
  • outputs (list of SaveFields): Output writers to initialize and use at each saved time.
  • compute_elastic_response (bool, default=True): Unused placeholder kept for interface parity.
Attributes

  • eq_heat (HeatDiffusion):

  • t_control (TimeControllerBase):

  • outputs (list[SaveFields]):

Simulator_T( eq_heat: HeatDiffusion, t_control: TimeControllerBase, outputs: list[SaveFields], compute_elastic_response: bool = True) 
486	def __init__(self, eq_heat: HeatDiffusion,
487					   t_control: TimeControllerBase,
488					   outputs: list[SaveFields],
489					   compute_elastic_response: bool=True):
490		self.eq_heat = eq_heat
491		self.t_control = t_control
492		self.outputs = outputs
493
494		ScreenPrinter.reset_instance()
495		self.screen = ScreenPrinter(self.eq_heat.grid, self.eq_heat.solver, self.eq_heat.mat, self.outputs, t_control.time_unit)
eq_heat
t_control
outputs
screen
def run(self) -> None: 
497	def run(self) -> None:
498		"""
499        Run the thermal simulation.
500
501        Workflow
502        --------
503        1. Initialize outputs.
504        2. (Optionally) solve an initial step.
505        3. Time loop: update BCs, solve heat equation for `(t, dt)`, and save.
506
507        Returns
508        -------
509        None
510
511        Notes
512        -----
513        Printing of progress occurs on rank 0 only.
514        """
515		# Output field
516		for output in self.outputs:
517			output.initialize()
518
519		# # Solve initial T field
520		# self.eq_heat.solve(0, self.t_control.dt)
521
522		# Save fields
523		output.save_fields(0)
524
525		# Time loop
526		while self.t_control.keep_looping():
527
528			# Advance time
529			self.t_control.advance_time()
530			t = self.t_control.t
531			dt = self.t_control.dt
532
533			# Update boundary conditions
534			self.eq_heat.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
535			self.eq_heat.bc.update_neumann(t)
536
537			# Solve heat
538			self.eq_heat.solve(t, dt)
539
540			# Save fields
541			for output in self.outputs:
542				output.save_fields(t)
543
544			# Print stuff
545			current_time = "%.3f"%(t/self.t_control.time_conversion)
546			screen_output_row = [
547									self.t_control.step_counter, 
548									self.t_control.dt/self.t_control.time_conversion,
549									f"{current_time} / {self.t_control.t_final/self.t_control.time_conversion}",
550									0,
551									0,
552			]
553			self.screen.print_row(screen_output_row)
554
555		self.screen.close()
556
557		for output in self.outputs:
558			output.save_mesh()

Run the thermal simulation.

Workflow
  1. Initialize outputs.
  2. (Optionally) solve an initial step.
  3. Time loop: update BCs, solve heat equation for (t, dt), and save.
Returns
  • None
Notes

Printing of progress occurs on rank 0 only.

class Simulator_M(safeincave.Simulators.Simulator): 
274class Simulator_M(Simulator):
275	"""
276    Mechanical-only simulator (linear momentum).
277
278    Solves the momentum equation with possible non-elastic behavior using a
279    θ-method loop and fixed-point iterations per step. No thermal coupling.
280
281    Parameters
282    ----------
283    eq_mom : LinearMomentum
284        Configured momentum equation (materials, BCs, solver set).
285    t_control : TimeControllerBase
286        Time controller providing `t`, `dt`, and loop control.
287    outputs : list of SaveFields
288        Output writers to initialize and use at each saved time.
289    compute_elastic_response : bool, default=True
290        If True, starts with a purely elastic solve to initialize fields.
291
292    Attributes
293    ----------
294    eq_mom : LinearMomentum
295    t_control : TimeControllerBase
296    outputs : list[SaveFields]
297    compute_elastic_response : bool
298    """
299	def __init__(self, eq_mom: LinearMomentum, 
300					   t_control: TimeControllerBase,
301					   outputs: list[SaveFields],
302					   compute_elastic_response: bool=True):
303		self.eq_mom = eq_mom
304		self.t_control = t_control
305		self.outputs = outputs
306		self.compute_elastic_response = compute_elastic_response
307		
308		ScreenPrinter.reset_instance()
309		self.screen = ScreenPrinter(self.eq_mom.grid, self.eq_mom.solver, self.eq_mom.mat, self.outputs, t_control.time_unit)
310
311	def run(self) -> None:
312		"""
313        Run the mechanical simulation.
314
315        Workflow
316        --------
317        1. Initialize outputs and boundary conditions.
318        2. Optionally solve a purely elastic step.
319        3. Initialize non-elastic rates.
320        4. For each time step: assemble/solve, update internal variables and
321           rates, compute relevant quantities, and save fields.
322
323        Convergence
324        -----------
325        Uses a relative change in total strain between iterations as error.
326        If `theta == 1.0` or no non-elastic elements exist, iteration ends
327        immediately.
328
329        Returns
330        -------
331        None
332
333        Notes
334        -----
335        - Printing occurs on rank 0 only.
336        - The first `output.save_fields(0)` call uses the last `output`
337          from the preceding loop variable.
338        """
339		# Output field
340		for output in self.outputs:
341			output.initialize()
342
343		# Update boundary conditions
344		self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(self.t_control.t)
345		self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(self.t_control.t)
346
347		if self.compute_elastic_response:
348			# Solve elasticity
349			self.eq_mom.solve_elastic_response()
350
351			# Calculate total (elastic) strain
352			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
353
354			# Compute stress
355			stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_elastic_stress(eps_tot_to)
356
357		else:
358			# Calculate total strain
359			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
360
361			# Retrieve stress
362			stress_to = numpy2torch(self.eq_mom.sig.x.array.reshape((self.eq_mom.n_elems, 3, 3)))
363
364		# Calculate and eps_ie_rate_old
365		self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, self.t_control.t)
366		self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
367
368		# Save fields
369		self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
370		self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
371		self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
372		self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
373		output.save_fields(0)
374
375		# Time loop
376		while self.t_control.keep_looping():
377
378			# Advance time
379			self.t_control.advance_time()
380			t = self.t_control.t
381			dt = self.t_control.dt
382
383			# Update boundary conditions
384			self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
385			self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(t)
386
387			# Iterative loop settings
388			tol = 1e-8
389			error = 2*tol
390			ite = 0
391			maxiter = 40
392
393			while error > tol and ite < maxiter:
394
395				# Update total strain of previous iteration (eps_tot_k <-- eps_tot)
396				eps_tot_k_to = eps_tot_to.clone()
397
398				# Update stress
399				stress_k_to = stress_to.clone()
400
401				# Build bi-linear form
402				self.eq_mom.solve(stress_k_to, t, dt)
403
404				# Compute total strain
405				eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
406
407				# Compute stress
408				stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_stress(eps_tot_to)
409
410				# Increment internal variables
411				self.eq_mom.increment_internal_variables(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
412
413				# Compute inelastic strain rates
414				self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, dt)
415
416				# Compute error
417				if self.eq_mom.theta == 1.0:
418					error = 0.0
419				elif len(self.eq_mom.mat.elems_ne) == 0:
420					error = 0.0
421				else:
422					eps_tot_k_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_k_to)
423					eps_tot_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_to)
424					local_error =  np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_k_flat - eps_tot_flat) / np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_flat)
425					error = self.eq_mom.grid.mesh.comm.allreduce(local_error, op=MPI.SUM)
426
427				ite += 1
428
429			# Update internal variables
430			self.eq_mom.update_internal_variables()
431
432			# Update strain rates
433			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
434
435			# Update strain
436			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_old(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
437
438			# Save fields
439			self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
440			self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
441			self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
442			self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
443			for output in self.outputs:
444				output.save_fields(t)
445
446			# Print stuff
447			current_time = "%.3f"%(t/self.t_control.time_conversion)
448			screen_output_row = [
449									self.t_control.step_counter, 
450									self.t_control.dt/self.t_control.time_conversion,
451									f"{current_time} / {self.t_control.t_final/self.t_control.time_conversion}",
452									ite,
453									error,
454			]
455			self.screen.print_row(screen_output_row)
456
457		self.screen.close()
458
459		for output in self.outputs:
460			output.save_mesh()

Mechanical-only simulator (linear momentum).

Solves the momentum equation with possible non-elastic behavior using a θ-method loop and fixed-point iterations per step. No thermal coupling.

Parameters
  • eq_mom (LinearMomentum): Configured momentum equation (materials, BCs, solver set).
  • t_control (TimeControllerBase): Time controller providing t, dt, and loop control.
  • outputs (list of SaveFields): Output writers to initialize and use at each saved time.
  • compute_elastic_response (bool, default=True): If True, starts with a purely elastic solve to initialize fields.
Attributes

  • eq_mom (LinearMomentum):

  • t_control (TimeControllerBase):

  • outputs (list[SaveFields]):

  • compute_elastic_response (bool):

Simulator_M( eq_mom: LinearMomentum, t_control: TimeControllerBase, outputs: list[SaveFields], compute_elastic_response: bool = True) 
299	def __init__(self, eq_mom: LinearMomentum, 
300					   t_control: TimeControllerBase,
301					   outputs: list[SaveFields],
302					   compute_elastic_response: bool=True):
303		self.eq_mom = eq_mom
304		self.t_control = t_control
305		self.outputs = outputs
306		self.compute_elastic_response = compute_elastic_response
307		
308		ScreenPrinter.reset_instance()
309		self.screen = ScreenPrinter(self.eq_mom.grid, self.eq_mom.solver, self.eq_mom.mat, self.outputs, t_control.time_unit)
eq_mom
t_control
outputs
compute_elastic_response
screen
def run(self) -> None: 
311	def run(self) -> None:
312		"""
313        Run the mechanical simulation.
314
315        Workflow
316        --------
317        1. Initialize outputs and boundary conditions.
318        2. Optionally solve a purely elastic step.
319        3. Initialize non-elastic rates.
320        4. For each time step: assemble/solve, update internal variables and
321           rates, compute relevant quantities, and save fields.
322
323        Convergence
324        -----------
325        Uses a relative change in total strain between iterations as error.
326        If `theta == 1.0` or no non-elastic elements exist, iteration ends
327        immediately.
328
329        Returns
330        -------
331        None
332
333        Notes
334        -----
335        - Printing occurs on rank 0 only.
336        - The first `output.save_fields(0)` call uses the last `output`
337          from the preceding loop variable.
338        """
339		# Output field
340		for output in self.outputs:
341			output.initialize()
342
343		# Update boundary conditions
344		self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(self.t_control.t)
345		self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(self.t_control.t)
346
347		if self.compute_elastic_response:
348			# Solve elasticity
349			self.eq_mom.solve_elastic_response()
350
351			# Calculate total (elastic) strain
352			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
353
354			# Compute stress
355			stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_elastic_stress(eps_tot_to)
356
357		else:
358			# Calculate total strain
359			eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
360
361			# Retrieve stress
362			stress_to = numpy2torch(self.eq_mom.sig.x.array.reshape((self.eq_mom.n_elems, 3, 3)))
363
364		# Calculate and eps_ie_rate_old
365		self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, self.t_control.t)
366		self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
367
368		# Save fields
369		self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
370		self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
371		self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
372		self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
373		output.save_fields(0)
374
375		# Time loop
376		while self.t_control.keep_looping():
377
378			# Advance time
379			self.t_control.advance_time()
380			t = self.t_control.t
381			dt = self.t_control.dt
382
383			# Update boundary conditions
384			self.eq_mom.bc.update_dirichlet(t)
385			self.eq_mom.bc.update_neumann(t)
386
387			# Iterative loop settings
388			tol = 1e-8
389			error = 2*tol
390			ite = 0
391			maxiter = 40
392
393			while error > tol and ite < maxiter:
394
395				# Update total strain of previous iteration (eps_tot_k <-- eps_tot)
396				eps_tot_k_to = eps_tot_to.clone()
397
398				# Update stress
399				stress_k_to = stress_to.clone()
400
401				# Build bi-linear form
402				self.eq_mom.solve(stress_k_to, t, dt)
403
404				# Compute total strain
405				eps_tot_to = self.eq_mom.compute_total_strain()
406
407				# Compute stress
408				stress_to = self.eq_mom.compute_stress(eps_tot_to)
409
410				# Increment internal variables
411				self.eq_mom.increment_internal_variables(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
412
413				# Compute inelastic strain rates
414				self.eq_mom.compute_eps_ne_rate(stress_to, dt)
415
416				# Compute error
417				if self.eq_mom.theta == 1.0:
418					error = 0.0
419				elif len(self.eq_mom.mat.elems_ne) == 0:
420					error = 0.0
421				else:
422					eps_tot_k_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_k_to)
423					eps_tot_flat = to.flatten(eps_tot_to)
424					local_error =  np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_k_flat - eps_tot_flat) / np.linalg.norm(eps_tot_flat)
425					error = self.eq_mom.grid.mesh.comm.allreduce(local_error, op=MPI.SUM)
426
427				ite += 1
428
429			# Update internal variables
430			self.eq_mom.update_internal_variables()
431
432			# Update strain rates
433			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_rate_old()
434
435			# Update strain
436			self.eq_mom.update_eps_ne_old(stress_to, stress_k_to, dt)
437
438			# Save fields
439			self.eq_mom.compute_p_elems()
440			self.eq_mom.compute_q_elems()
441			self.eq_mom.compute_p_nodes()
442			self.eq_mom.compute_q_nodes()
443			for output in self.outputs:
444				output.save_fields(t)
445
446			# Print stuff
447			current_time = "%.3f"%(t/self.t_control.time_conversion)
448			screen_output_row = [
449									self.t_control.step_counter, 
450									self.t_control.dt/self.t_control.time_conversion,
451									f"{current_time} / {self.t_control.t_final/self.t_control.time_conversion}",
452									ite,
453									error,
454			]
455			self.screen.print_row(screen_output_row)
456
457		self.screen.close()
458
459		for output in self.outputs:
460			output.save_mesh()

Run the mechanical simulation.

Workflow
  1. Initialize outputs and boundary conditions.
  2. Optionally solve a purely elastic step.
  3. Initialize non-elastic rates.
  4. For each time step: assemble/solve, update internal variables and rates, compute relevant quantities, and save fields.
Convergence

Uses a relative change in total strain between iterations as error. If theta == 1.0 or no non-elastic elements exist, iteration ends immediately.

Returns
  • None
Notes
  • Printing occurs on rank 0 only.
  • The first output.save_fields(0) call uses the last output from the preceding loop variable.
class Simulator_GUI(safeincave.Simulators.Simulator): 
 764class Simulator_GUI(Simulator):
 765	"""
 766	High-level driver to set up and run mechanical simulations from a
 767	dictionary-based input specification.
 768
 769	This GUI-friendly wrapper builds the grid, initializes the linear
 770	momentum equation, sets up PETSc solvers, configures material models
 771	(elastic and nonelastic), applies gravity and boundary conditions,
 772	and runs equilibrium and operation stages.
 773
 774	Parameters
 775	----------
 776	input_file : dict
 777	    Nested configuration dictionary. The following keys are expected:
 778
 779	    - ``output.path`` : str
 780	        Root folder where results will be written.
 781	    - ``grid.path`` : str
 782	        Directory containing the mesh.
 783	    - ``grid.name`` : str
 784	        Mesh base name (without extension) understood by ``GridHandlerGMSH``.
 785	    - ``time_settings.theta`` : float
 786	        Generalized-α/θ method parameter for time integration in momentum.
 787	    - ``time_settings.time_list`` : array_like of float
 788	        Monotone time stamps (seconds) for the operation stage.
 789	    - ``body_force.direction`` : int
 790	        Index of gravity direction (0, 1, or 2).
 791	    - ``body_force.gravity`` : float
 792	        Gravity magnitude (consistent units with the model).
 793	    - ``body_force.density`` : Any
 794	        Identifier resolvable by ``grid.get_parameter`` to element-wise density.
 795	    - ``constitutive_model.elastic`` : dict
 796	        Mapping from element-set names to parameters:
 797	        ``{"<set>": {"parameters": {"E": <Any>, "nu": <Any>}}}``.
 798	    - ``constitutive_model.nonelastic`` : dict
 799	        Mapping from element-set names to nonelastic models. Each entry must
 800	        define ``"type"`` (``"KelvinVoigt"``, ``"DislocationCreep"``,
 801	        or ``"ViscoplasticDesai"``), an ``"active"`` flag, optional
 802	        ``"equilibrium"`` flag, and a ``"parameters"`` block whose keys
 803	        depend on the chosen model.
 804	    - ``solver_settings.type`` : {"LU", "KrylovSolver"}
 805	        Solver family. ``"LU"`` uses a preonly KSP with LU PC.
 806	    - ``solver_settings.method`` : str, optional
 807	        PETSc KSP type (e.g., ``"cg"``, ``"gmres"``, ``"bicg"``) if
 808	        ``type="KrylovSolver"``.
 809	    - ``solver_settings.preconditioner`` : str, optional
 810	        PETSc PC type (e.g., ``"asm"``, ``"hypre"``, ``"ilu"``) if
 811	        ``type="KrylovSolver"``.
 812	    - ``solver_settings.relative_tolerance`` : float, optional
 813	        KSP relative tolerance if ``type="KrylovSolver"``.
 814	    - ``simulation_settings.equilibrium.active`` : bool
 815	        Whether to run an initial equilibrium stage.
 816	    - ``simulation_settings.equilibrium.dt_max`` : float
 817	        Time step for the equilibrium pseudo-time march.
 818	    - ``simulation_settings.equilibrium.ite_max`` : int
 819	        Number of pseudo-time iterations for equilibrium.
 820	    - ``simulation_settings.operation.dt_max`` : float
 821	        Maximum time step for the operation stage.
 822	    - ``simulation_settings.operation.hardening`` : bool, optional
 823	        If ``True`` and using Desai, initialize hardening from current stress.
 824	    - ``boundary_conditions`` : dict
 825	        Mapping from boundary names to BC definitions:
 826	        - Neumann: ``{"type": "neumann", "direction": int, "density": float,
 827	          "reference_position": array_like (3,), "values": array_like,
 828	          "component": (ignored), ...}``
 829	        - Dirichlet: ``{"type": "dirichlet", "component": int,
 830	          "values": array_like, ...}``
 831
 832	Attributes
 833	----------
 834	input_file : dict
 835	    Original configuration.
 836	output_folder : str
 837	    Output directory (``output.path``).
 838	grid : GridHandlerGMSH
 839	    Mesh/grid handler.
 840	mom_eq : LinearMomentum
 841	    Linear momentum equation object.
 842	mat : Material
 843	    Material container attached to ``mom_eq``.
 844	g : float
 845	    Gravity magnitude (signed) used to assemble body forces.
 846
 847	Notes
 848	-----
 849	- This class *mutates* the filesystem by writing results inside
 850	  ``output_folder`` via the registered output handlers.
 851	- All parameters referenced with ``grid.get_parameter`` can be scalars,
 852	  arrays, or field identifiers understood by the grid handler.
 853
 854	See Also
 855	--------
 856	GridHandlerGMSH
 857	LinearMomentum
 858	Material
 859	PETSc.KSP
 860	"""
 861	def __init__(self, input_file: dict):
 862		"""
 863		Construct the simulator and perform basic initialization steps.
 864
 865		The initializer stores the input dictionary, sets the output folder,
 866		builds the grid, initializes the equation, configures the solver,
 867		sets material properties, and applies gravity.
 868
 869		Parameters
 870		----------
 871		input_file : dict
 872		    Configuration dictionary. See class docstring for the expected schema.
 873
 874		Raises
 875		------
 876		KeyError
 877		    If any required key is missing from ``input_file``.
 878		"""
 879		self.input_file = input_file
 880
 881		self.output_folder = self.input_file["output"]["path"]
 882
 883		self.build_grid()
 884		self.initialize_equation()
 885		self.build_solver()
 886		self.initialize_material()
 887		self.set_gravity()
 888
 889
 890	def build_grid(self):
 891		"""
 892		Create and attach the grid handler from the input configuration.
 893
 894		Uses ``grid.path`` and ``grid.name`` to instantiate a ``GridHandlerGMSH``
 895		object and assigns it to ``self.grid``.
 896
 897		Raises
 898		------
 899		KeyError
 900		    If ``grid.path`` or ``grid.name`` is missing.
 901		"""
 902		grid_path = self.input_file["grid"]["path"]
 903		grid_name = self.input_file["grid"]["name"]
 904		self.grid = GridHandlerGMSH(grid_name, grid_path)
 905
 906	def initialize_equation(self):
 907		"""
 908		Initialize the linear momentum equation object.
 909
 910		Reads the generalized-θ parameter from ``time_settings.theta`` and
 911		creates ``self.mom_eq = LinearMomentum(self.grid, theta=theta)``.
 912
 913		Raises
 914		------
 915		KeyError
 916		    If ``time_settings.theta`` is missing.
 917		"""
 918		theta = self.input_file["time_settings"]["theta"]
 919		self.mom_eq = LinearMomentum(self.grid, theta=theta)
 920
 921	def set_gravity(self):
 922		"""
 923		Define and assemble body force due to gravity.
 924
 925		Constructs a gravity vector aligned with the axis specified by
 926		``body_force.direction`` and magnitude ``body_force.gravity``.
 927		The vector is passed to ``self.mom_eq.build_body_force``.
 928
 929		Raises
 930		------
 931		KeyError
 932		    If ``body_force.direction`` or ``body_force.gravity`` is missing.
 933		ValueError
 934		    If the gravity direction is not 0, 1, or 2.
 935		"""
 936		g_vec = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
 937		i = self.input_file["body_force"]["direction"]
 938		self.g = self.input_file["body_force"]["gravity"]
 939		g_vec[i] = self.g
 940		self.mom_eq.build_body_force(g_vec)
 941
 942	def initialize_material(self):
 943		"""
 944		Build and attach the elastic material model(s).
 945
 946		- Creates a ``Material`` container sized to the number of elements.
 947		- Sets element-wise density from ``body_force.density`` via
 948		  ``grid.get_parameter``.
 949		- For each entry in ``constitutive_model.elastic``, queries ``E`` and
 950		  ``nu``, creates a ``Spring`` element, and registers it into
 951		  ``self.mat``. Finally, the material is attached to ``self.mom_eq``.
 952
 953		Raises
 954		------
 955		KeyError
 956		    If required keys under ``constitutive_model.elastic`` or
 957		    ``body_force.density`` are missing.
 958		"""
 959		self.mat = Material(self.grid.n_elems)
 960		density = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["body_force"]["density"])
 961		self.mat.set_density(density)
 962
 963		for elem_name in self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["elastic"].keys():
 964			E = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["elastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["E"])
 965			nu = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["elastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["nu"])
 966			spring_0 = Spring(E, nu, elem_name)
 967			self.mat.add_to_elastic(spring_0)
 968
 969		self.mom_eq.set_material(self.mat)
 970
 971	def build_solver(self):
 972		"""
 973		Configure and attach the PETSc linear solver.
 974
 975		Behavior
 976		--------
 977		- If ``solver_settings.type == "LU"``:
 978		  Uses a preonly KSP with LU preconditioner.
 979		- If ``solver_settings.type == "KrylovSolver"``:
 980		  Reads ``method``, ``preconditioner``, and ``relative_tolerance``
 981		  and sets them on the KSP.
 982
 983		Notes
 984		-----
 985		The maximum number of iterations for Krylov solvers is set to 100.
 986
 987		Raises
 988		------
 989		KeyError
 990		    If required ``solver_settings`` keys are missing.
 991		ValueError
 992		    If an unsupported solver type is requested.
 993		"""
 994		solver = PETSc.KSP().create(self.grid.mesh.comm)
 995		if self.input_file["solver_settings"]["type"] == "LU":
 996			solver.setType("preonly")
 997			solver.getPC().setType("lu")
 998		elif self.input_file["solver_settings"]["type"] == "KrylovSolver":
 999			method = self.input_file["solver_settings"]["method"]
1000			prec = self.input_file["solver_settings"]["preconditioner"]
1001			tol = self.input_file["solver_settings"]["relative_tolerance"]
1002			solver.setType(method)
1003			solver.getPC().setType(prec)
1004			solver.setTolerances(rtol=tol, max_it=100)
1005		self.mom_eq.set_solver(solver)
1006
1007
1008	def run_equilibrium(self):
1009		"""
1010		Run the equilibrium (pseudo-time) stage, if enabled.
1011
1012		This stage optionally activates nonelastic models flagged with
1013		``equilibrium: True`` and marches a pseudo-time controller until
1014		``ite_max`` steps, applying time-constant boundary conditions.
1015		Results are written under ``<output_folder>/equilibrium``.
1016
1017		Side Effects
1018		------------
1019		- Modifies ``self.mom_eq.mat`` by adding nonelastic elements
1020		  as specified in the input.
1021		- Writes displacement and stress fields via ``SaveFields``.
1022
1023		Raises
1024		------
1025		Exception
1026		    If an unsupported nonelastic element type or BC type is found.
1027		KeyError
1028		    If required keys under ``simulation_settings.equilibrium`` or
1029		    ``boundary_conditions`` are missing.
1030		"""
1031		# Build material: non-elastic element
1032		for elem_name in self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"].keys():
1033			if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["active"]:
1034				if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["equilibrium"]:
1035					if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "KelvinVoigt":
1036						E = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["E"])
1037						nu = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["nu"])
1038						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1039						kelvin = Viscoelastic(eta, E, nu, elem_name)
1040						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(kelvin)
1041					elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "DislocationCreep":
1042						A = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["A"])
1043						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1044						Q = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["Q"])
1045						creep_0 = DislocationCreep(A, Q, n, elem_name)
1046						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(creep_0)
1047						T = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["T"])
1048						self.mom_eq.set_T0(T)
1049						self.mom_eq.set_T(T)
1050					elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "ViscoplasticDesai":
1051						mu_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["mu_1"])
1052						N_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["N_1"])
1053						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1054						a_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["a_1"])
1055						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1056						beta_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta_1"])
1057						beta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta"])
1058						m = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["m"])
1059						gamma = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["gamma"])
1060						alpha_0 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["alpha_0"])
1061						sigma_t = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["sigma_t"])
1062						desai = ViscoplasticDesai(mu_1, N_1, a_1, eta, n, beta_1, beta, m, gamma, sigma_t, alpha_0, elem_name)
1063						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(desai)
1064					else:
1065						elem_type = self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"]
1066						raise Exception(f"Element type {elem_type} not supported.")
1067
1068
1069		# Time settings for equilibrium stage
1070		dt = self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["dt_max"]
1071		tf = self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["ite_max"]*dt
1072		tc_equilibrium = TimeController(dt=dt, initial_time=0.0, final_time=tf, time_unit="second")
1073
1074		# Loop over boundaries
1075		bc_equilibrium = momBC.BcHandler(self.mom_eq)
1076		t_values = [0.0, tc_equilibrium.t_final]
1077		for b_name in self.input_file["boundary_conditions"].keys():
1078			bc_value = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["values"][0]
1079			bc_values = bc_value*np.ones(len(t_values))
1080			if self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "neumann":
1081				bc = momBC.NeumannBC(boundary_name = b_name,
1082									 direction = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["direction"],
1083									 density = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["density"],
1084									 ref_pos = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["reference_position"],
1085									 values = bc_values,
1086									 time_values = t_values,
1087									 g = self.g)
1088			elif self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "dirichlet":
1089				bc = momBC.DirichletBC(boundary_name = b_name, 
1090								 	   component = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["component"],
1091									   values = bc_values,
1092									   time_values = t_values)
1093			else:
1094				b_type = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"]
1095				raise Exception(f"Boundary condition type {b_type} not supported.")
1096			bc_equilibrium.add_boundary_condition(bc)
1097
1098		# Set boundary conditions
1099		self.mom_eq.set_boundary_conditions(bc_equilibrium)
1100
1101		# Create output handlers
1102		output_mom = SaveFields(self.mom_eq)
1103		output_mom.set_output_folder(os.path.join(self.output_folder, "equilibrium"))
1104		output_mom.add_output_field("u", "Displacement (m)")
1105		output_mom.add_output_field("p_elems", "Mean Stress (MPa)")
1106		outputs = [output_mom]
1107
1108		# Define simulator
1109		sim = Simulator_M(self.mom_eq, tc_equilibrium, outputs, compute_elastic_response=True)
1110		sim.run()
1111
1112	def element_exist(self, elem_name: str):
1113		"""
1114		Check whether a nonelastic element with a given name exists.
1115
1116		Parameters
1117		----------
1118		elem_name : str
1119		    Element set/name to query.
1120
1121		Returns
1122		-------
1123		bool
1124		    ``True`` if an element with ``elem_name`` is present in
1125		    ``self.mom_eq.mat.elems_ne``, ``False`` otherwise.
1126		"""
1127		for elem in self.mom_eq.mat.elems_ne:
1128			if elem.name == elem_name:
1129				return True
1130		return False
1131
1132	def run_operation(self):
1133		"""
1134		Run the operation (transient) stage.
1135
1136		Activates any nonelastic models flagged ``active: True`` (adding only if
1137		not already present), configures the time controller using
1138		``time_settings.time_list`` and ``simulation_settings.operation.dt_max``,
1139		applies time-varying boundary conditions, registers outputs, and runs
1140		the simulator.
1141
1142		Side Effects
1143		------------
1144		- May add nonelastic elements to the material model.
1145		- Writes displacement, mean stress, and von Mises stress fields under
1146		  ``<output_folder>/operation``.
1147
1148		Raises
1149		------
1150		Exception
1151		    If an unsupported nonelastic element type or BC type is found.
1152		KeyError
1153		    If required time, BC, or simulation settings are missing.
1154		"""
1155		# Build material: non-elastic element
1156		for elem_name in self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"].keys():
1157			if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["active"]:
1158				if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "KelvinVoigt":
1159					if not self.element_exist(elem_name):
1160						E = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["E"])
1161						nu = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["nu"])
1162						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1163						kelvin = Viscoelastic(eta, E, nu, elem_name)
1164						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(kelvin)
1165				elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "DislocationCreep":
1166					if not self.element_exist(elem_name):
1167						A = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["A"])
1168						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1169						Q = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["Q"])
1170						creep_0 = DislocationCreep(A, Q, n, elem_name)
1171						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(creep_0)
1172						T = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["T"])
1173						self.mom_eq.set_T0(T)
1174						self.mom_eq.set_T(T)
1175				elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "ViscoplasticDesai":
1176					if not self.element_exist(elem_name):
1177						mu_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["mu_1"])
1178						N_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["N_1"])
1179						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1180						a_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["a_1"])
1181						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1182						beta_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta_1"])
1183						beta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta"])
1184						m = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["m"])
1185						gamma = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["gamma"])
1186						alpha_0 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["alpha_0"])
1187						sigma_t = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["sigma_t"])
1188						desai = ViscoplasticDesai(mu_1, N_1, a_1, eta, n, beta_1, beta, m, gamma, sigma_t, alpha_0, elem_name)
1189
1190						if self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["operation"]["hardening"]:
1191							# Compute initial hardening parameter
1192							stress_to = numpy2torch(self.mom_eq.sig.x.array.reshape((self.mom_eq.n_elems, 3, 3)))
1193							desai.compute_initial_hardening(stress_to, Fvp_0=0.0)
1194
1195						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(desai)
1196				else:
1197					elem_type = self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"]
1198					raise Exception(f"Element type {elem_type} not supported.")
1199
1200
1201		# Time settings for operation stage
1202		t_values = self.input_file["time_settings"]["time_list"]
1203		dt = self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["operation"]["dt_max"]
1204		tf = t_values[-1]
1205		tc_op = TimeController(dt=dt, initial_time=0.0, final_time=tf, time_unit="second")
1206
1207		# Loop over boundaries
1208		bc_op = momBC.BcHandler(self.mom_eq)
1209		for b_name in self.input_file["boundary_conditions"].keys():
1210			bc_values = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["values"]
1211			if self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "neumann":
1212				bc = momBC.NeumannBC(boundary_name = b_name,
1213									 direction = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["direction"],
1214									 density = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["density"],
1215									 ref_pos = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["reference_position"],
1216									 values = bc_values,
1217									 time_values = t_values,
1218									 g = self.g)
1219			elif self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "dirichlet":
1220				bc = momBC.DirichletBC(boundary_name = b_name, 
1221								 	   component = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["component"],
1222									   values = bc_values,
1223									   time_values = t_values)
1224			else:
1225				b_type = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"]
1226				raise Exception(f"Boundary condition type {b_type} not supported.")
1227			bc_op.add_boundary_condition(bc)
1228
1229		# Set boundary conditions
1230		self.mom_eq.set_boundary_conditions(bc_op)
1231
1232		# Create output handlers
1233		output_mom = SaveFields(self.mom_eq)
1234		output_mom.set_output_folder(os.path.join(self.output_folder, "operation"))
1235		output_mom.add_output_field("u", "Displacement (m)")
1236		output_mom.add_output_field("p_elems", "Mean Stress (MPa)")
1237		output_mom.add_output_field("q_elems", "Von Mises Stress (MPa)")
1238		outputs = [output_mom]
1239
1240		# Define simulator
1241		compute_elastic_response = True
1242		if self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["active"] == True:
1243			compute_elastic_response = False
1244		sim = Simulator_M(self.mom_eq, tc_op, outputs, compute_elastic_response=compute_elastic_response)
1245		sim.run()
1246
1247
1248	def run(self):
1249		"""
1250		Execute the full simulation workflow.
1251
1252		If ``simulation_settings.equilibrium.active`` is ``True``, runs the
1253		equilibrium stage first and then the operation stage; otherwise,
1254		runs only the operation stage.
1255
1256		Returns
1257		-------
1258		None
1259		"""
1260		if self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["active"] == True:
1261			self.run_equilibrium()
1262		self.run_operation()

High-level driver to set up and run mechanical simulations from a dictionary-based input specification.

This GUI-friendly wrapper builds the grid, initializes the linear momentum equation, sets up PETSc solvers, configures material models (elastic and nonelastic), applies gravity and boundary conditions, and runs equilibrium and operation stages.

Parameters

  • input_file (dict): Nested configuration dictionary. The following keys are expected:

    • output.path : str Root folder where results will be written.
    • grid.path : str Directory containing the mesh.
    • grid.name : str Mesh base name (without extension) understood by GridHandlerGMSH.
    • time_settings.theta : float Generalized-α/θ method parameter for time integration in momentum.
    • time_settings.time_list : array_like of float Monotone time stamps (seconds) for the operation stage.
    • body_force.direction : int Index of gravity direction (0, 1, or 2).
    • body_force.gravity : float Gravity magnitude (consistent units with the model).
    • body_force.density : Any Identifier resolvable by grid.get_parameter to element-wise density.
    • constitutive_model.elastic : dict Mapping from element-set names to parameters: {"<set>": {"parameters": {"E": <Any>, "nu": <Any>}}}.
    • constitutive_model.nonelastic : dict Mapping from element-set names to nonelastic models. Each entry must define "type" ("KelvinVoigt", "DislocationCreep", or "ViscoplasticDesai"), an "active" flag, optional "equilibrium" flag, and a "parameters" block whose keys depend on the chosen model.
    • solver_settings.type : {"LU", "KrylovSolver"} Solver family. "LU" uses a preonly KSP with LU PC.
    • solver_settings.method : str, optional PETSc KSP type (e.g., "cg", "gmres", "bicg") if type="KrylovSolver".
    • solver_settings.preconditioner : str, optional PETSc PC type (e.g., "asm", "hypre", "ilu") if type="KrylovSolver".
    • solver_settings.relative_tolerance : float, optional KSP relative tolerance if type="KrylovSolver".
    • simulation_settings.equilibrium.active : bool Whether to run an initial equilibrium stage.
    • simulation_settings.equilibrium.dt_max : float Time step for the equilibrium pseudo-time march.
    • simulation_settings.equilibrium.ite_max : int Number of pseudo-time iterations for equilibrium.
    • simulation_settings.operation.dt_max : float Maximum time step for the operation stage.
    • simulation_settings.operation.hardening : bool, optional If True and using Desai, initialize hardening from current stress.
    • boundary_conditions : dict Mapping from boundary names to BC definitions:
      • Neumann: {"type": "neumann", "direction": int, "density": float, "reference_position": array_like (3,), "values": array_like, "component": (ignored), ...}
      • Dirichlet: {"type": "dirichlet", "component": int, "values": array_like, ...}
Attributes
  • input_file (dict): Original configuration.
  • output_folder (str): Output directory (output.path).
  • grid (GridHandlerGMSH): Mesh/grid handler.
  • mom_eq (LinearMomentum): Linear momentum equation object.
  • mat (Material): Material container attached to mom_eq.
  • g (float): Gravity magnitude (signed) used to assemble body forces.
Notes
  • This class mutates the filesystem by writing results inside output_folder via the registered output handlers.
  • All parameters referenced with grid.get_parameter can be scalars, arrays, or field identifiers understood by the grid handler.
See Also

GridHandlerGMSH
LinearMomentum
Material
PETSc.KSP

Simulator_GUI(input_file: dict) 
861	def __init__(self, input_file: dict):
862		"""
863		Construct the simulator and perform basic initialization steps.
864
865		The initializer stores the input dictionary, sets the output folder,
866		builds the grid, initializes the equation, configures the solver,
867		sets material properties, and applies gravity.
868
869		Parameters
870		----------
871		input_file : dict
872		    Configuration dictionary. See class docstring for the expected schema.
873
874		Raises
875		------
876		KeyError
877		    If any required key is missing from ``input_file``.
878		"""
879		self.input_file = input_file
880
881		self.output_folder = self.input_file["output"]["path"]
882
883		self.build_grid()
884		self.initialize_equation()
885		self.build_solver()
886		self.initialize_material()
887		self.set_gravity()

Construct the simulator and perform basic initialization steps.

The initializer stores the input dictionary, sets the output folder, builds the grid, initializes the equation, configures the solver, sets material properties, and applies gravity.

Parameters
  • input_file (dict): Configuration dictionary. See class docstring for the expected schema.
Raises
  • KeyError: If any required key is missing from input_file.
input_file
output_folder
def build_grid(self): 
890	def build_grid(self):
891		"""
892		Create and attach the grid handler from the input configuration.
893
894		Uses ``grid.path`` and ``grid.name`` to instantiate a ``GridHandlerGMSH``
895		object and assigns it to ``self.grid``.
896
897		Raises
898		------
899		KeyError
900		    If ``grid.path`` or ``grid.name`` is missing.
901		"""
902		grid_path = self.input_file["grid"]["path"]
903		grid_name = self.input_file["grid"]["name"]
904		self.grid = GridHandlerGMSH(grid_name, grid_path)

Create and attach the grid handler from the input configuration.

Uses grid.path and grid.name to instantiate a GridHandlerGMSH object and assigns it to self.grid.

Raises
  • KeyError: If grid.path or grid.name is missing.
def initialize_equation(self): 
906	def initialize_equation(self):
907		"""
908		Initialize the linear momentum equation object.
909
910		Reads the generalized-θ parameter from ``time_settings.theta`` and
911		creates ``self.mom_eq = LinearMomentum(self.grid, theta=theta)``.
912
913		Raises
914		------
915		KeyError
916		    If ``time_settings.theta`` is missing.
917		"""
918		theta = self.input_file["time_settings"]["theta"]
919		self.mom_eq = LinearMomentum(self.grid, theta=theta)

Initialize the linear momentum equation object.

Reads the generalized-θ parameter from time_settings.theta and creates self.mom_eq = LinearMomentum(self.grid, theta=theta).

Raises
  • KeyError: If time_settings.theta is missing.
def set_gravity(self): 
921	def set_gravity(self):
922		"""
923		Define and assemble body force due to gravity.
924
925		Constructs a gravity vector aligned with the axis specified by
926		``body_force.direction`` and magnitude ``body_force.gravity``.
927		The vector is passed to ``self.mom_eq.build_body_force``.
928
929		Raises
930		------
931		KeyError
932		    If ``body_force.direction`` or ``body_force.gravity`` is missing.
933		ValueError
934		    If the gravity direction is not 0, 1, or 2.
935		"""
936		g_vec = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
937		i = self.input_file["body_force"]["direction"]
938		self.g = self.input_file["body_force"]["gravity"]
939		g_vec[i] = self.g
940		self.mom_eq.build_body_force(g_vec)

Define and assemble body force due to gravity.

Constructs a gravity vector aligned with the axis specified by body_force.direction and magnitude body_force.gravity. The vector is passed to self.mom_eq.build_body_force.

Raises
  • KeyError: If body_force.direction or body_force.gravity is missing.
  • ValueError: If the gravity direction is not 0, 1, or 2.
def initialize_material(self): 
942	def initialize_material(self):
943		"""
944		Build and attach the elastic material model(s).
945
946		- Creates a ``Material`` container sized to the number of elements.
947		- Sets element-wise density from ``body_force.density`` via
948		  ``grid.get_parameter``.
949		- For each entry in ``constitutive_model.elastic``, queries ``E`` and
950		  ``nu``, creates a ``Spring`` element, and registers it into
951		  ``self.mat``. Finally, the material is attached to ``self.mom_eq``.
952
953		Raises
954		------
955		KeyError
956		    If required keys under ``constitutive_model.elastic`` or
957		    ``body_force.density`` are missing.
958		"""
959		self.mat = Material(self.grid.n_elems)
960		density = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["body_force"]["density"])
961		self.mat.set_density(density)
962
963		for elem_name in self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["elastic"].keys():
964			E = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["elastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["E"])
965			nu = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["elastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["nu"])
966			spring_0 = Spring(E, nu, elem_name)
967			self.mat.add_to_elastic(spring_0)
968
969		self.mom_eq.set_material(self.mat)

Build and attach the elastic material model(s).

  • Creates a Material container sized to the number of elements.
  • Sets element-wise density from body_force.density via grid.get_parameter.
  • For each entry in constitutive_model.elastic, queries E and nu, creates a Spring element, and registers it into self.mat. Finally, the material is attached to self.mom_eq.
Raises
  • KeyError: If required keys under constitutive_model.elastic or body_force.density are missing.
def build_solver(self): 
 971	def build_solver(self):
 972		"""
 973		Configure and attach the PETSc linear solver.
 974
 975		Behavior
 976		--------
 977		- If ``solver_settings.type == "LU"``:
 978		  Uses a preonly KSP with LU preconditioner.
 979		- If ``solver_settings.type == "KrylovSolver"``:
 980		  Reads ``method``, ``preconditioner``, and ``relative_tolerance``
 981		  and sets them on the KSP.
 982
 983		Notes
 984		-----
 985		The maximum number of iterations for Krylov solvers is set to 100.
 986
 987		Raises
 988		------
 989		KeyError
 990		    If required ``solver_settings`` keys are missing.
 991		ValueError
 992		    If an unsupported solver type is requested.
 993		"""
 994		solver = PETSc.KSP().create(self.grid.mesh.comm)
 995		if self.input_file["solver_settings"]["type"] == "LU":
 996			solver.setType("preonly")
 997			solver.getPC().setType("lu")
 998		elif self.input_file["solver_settings"]["type"] == "KrylovSolver":
 999			method = self.input_file["solver_settings"]["method"]
1000			prec = self.input_file["solver_settings"]["preconditioner"]
1001			tol = self.input_file["solver_settings"]["relative_tolerance"]
1002			solver.setType(method)
1003			solver.getPC().setType(prec)
1004			solver.setTolerances(rtol=tol, max_it=100)
1005		self.mom_eq.set_solver(solver)

Configure and attach the PETSc linear solver.

Behavior
  • If solver_settings.type == "LU": Uses a preonly KSP with LU preconditioner.
  • If solver_settings.type == "KrylovSolver": Reads method, preconditioner, and relative_tolerance and sets them on the KSP.
Notes

The maximum number of iterations for Krylov solvers is set to 100.

Raises
  • KeyError: If required solver_settings keys are missing.
  • ValueError: If an unsupported solver type is requested.
def run_equilibrium(self): 
1008	def run_equilibrium(self):
1009		"""
1010		Run the equilibrium (pseudo-time) stage, if enabled.
1011
1012		This stage optionally activates nonelastic models flagged with
1013		``equilibrium: True`` and marches a pseudo-time controller until
1014		``ite_max`` steps, applying time-constant boundary conditions.
1015		Results are written under ``<output_folder>/equilibrium``.
1016
1017		Side Effects
1018		------------
1019		- Modifies ``self.mom_eq.mat`` by adding nonelastic elements
1020		  as specified in the input.
1021		- Writes displacement and stress fields via ``SaveFields``.
1022
1023		Raises
1024		------
1025		Exception
1026		    If an unsupported nonelastic element type or BC type is found.
1027		KeyError
1028		    If required keys under ``simulation_settings.equilibrium`` or
1029		    ``boundary_conditions`` are missing.
1030		"""
1031		# Build material: non-elastic element
1032		for elem_name in self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"].keys():
1033			if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["active"]:
1034				if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["equilibrium"]:
1035					if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "KelvinVoigt":
1036						E = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["E"])
1037						nu = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["nu"])
1038						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1039						kelvin = Viscoelastic(eta, E, nu, elem_name)
1040						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(kelvin)
1041					elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "DislocationCreep":
1042						A = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["A"])
1043						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1044						Q = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["Q"])
1045						creep_0 = DislocationCreep(A, Q, n, elem_name)
1046						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(creep_0)
1047						T = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["T"])
1048						self.mom_eq.set_T0(T)
1049						self.mom_eq.set_T(T)
1050					elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "ViscoplasticDesai":
1051						mu_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["mu_1"])
1052						N_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["N_1"])
1053						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1054						a_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["a_1"])
1055						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1056						beta_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta_1"])
1057						beta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta"])
1058						m = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["m"])
1059						gamma = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["gamma"])
1060						alpha_0 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["alpha_0"])
1061						sigma_t = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["sigma_t"])
1062						desai = ViscoplasticDesai(mu_1, N_1, a_1, eta, n, beta_1, beta, m, gamma, sigma_t, alpha_0, elem_name)
1063						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(desai)
1064					else:
1065						elem_type = self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"]
1066						raise Exception(f"Element type {elem_type} not supported.")
1067
1068
1069		# Time settings for equilibrium stage
1070		dt = self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["dt_max"]
1071		tf = self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["ite_max"]*dt
1072		tc_equilibrium = TimeController(dt=dt, initial_time=0.0, final_time=tf, time_unit="second")
1073
1074		# Loop over boundaries
1075		bc_equilibrium = momBC.BcHandler(self.mom_eq)
1076		t_values = [0.0, tc_equilibrium.t_final]
1077		for b_name in self.input_file["boundary_conditions"].keys():
1078			bc_value = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["values"][0]
1079			bc_values = bc_value*np.ones(len(t_values))
1080			if self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "neumann":
1081				bc = momBC.NeumannBC(boundary_name = b_name,
1082									 direction = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["direction"],
1083									 density = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["density"],
1084									 ref_pos = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["reference_position"],
1085									 values = bc_values,
1086									 time_values = t_values,
1087									 g = self.g)
1088			elif self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "dirichlet":
1089				bc = momBC.DirichletBC(boundary_name = b_name, 
1090								 	   component = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["component"],
1091									   values = bc_values,
1092									   time_values = t_values)
1093			else:
1094				b_type = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"]
1095				raise Exception(f"Boundary condition type {b_type} not supported.")
1096			bc_equilibrium.add_boundary_condition(bc)
1097
1098		# Set boundary conditions
1099		self.mom_eq.set_boundary_conditions(bc_equilibrium)
1100
1101		# Create output handlers
1102		output_mom = SaveFields(self.mom_eq)
1103		output_mom.set_output_folder(os.path.join(self.output_folder, "equilibrium"))
1104		output_mom.add_output_field("u", "Displacement (m)")
1105		output_mom.add_output_field("p_elems", "Mean Stress (MPa)")
1106		outputs = [output_mom]
1107
1108		# Define simulator
1109		sim = Simulator_M(self.mom_eq, tc_equilibrium, outputs, compute_elastic_response=True)
1110		sim.run()

Run the equilibrium (pseudo-time) stage, if enabled.

This stage optionally activates nonelastic models flagged with equilibrium: True and marches a pseudo-time controller until ite_max steps, applying time-constant boundary conditions. Results are written under <output_folder>/equilibrium.

Side Effects
  • Modifies self.mom_eq.mat by adding nonelastic elements as specified in the input.
  • Writes displacement and stress fields via SaveFields.
Raises
  • Exception: If an unsupported nonelastic element type or BC type is found.
  • KeyError: If required keys under simulation_settings.equilibrium or boundary_conditions are missing.
def element_exist(self, elem_name: str): 
1112	def element_exist(self, elem_name: str):
1113		"""
1114		Check whether a nonelastic element with a given name exists.
1115
1116		Parameters
1117		----------
1118		elem_name : str
1119		    Element set/name to query.
1120
1121		Returns
1122		-------
1123		bool
1124		    ``True`` if an element with ``elem_name`` is present in
1125		    ``self.mom_eq.mat.elems_ne``, ``False`` otherwise.
1126		"""
1127		for elem in self.mom_eq.mat.elems_ne:
1128			if elem.name == elem_name:
1129				return True
1130		return False

Check whether a nonelastic element with a given name exists.

Parameters
  • elem_name (str): Element set/name to query.
Returns
  • bool: True if an element with elem_name is present in self.mom_eq.mat.elems_ne, False otherwise.
def run_operation(self): 
1132	def run_operation(self):
1133		"""
1134		Run the operation (transient) stage.
1135
1136		Activates any nonelastic models flagged ``active: True`` (adding only if
1137		not already present), configures the time controller using
1138		``time_settings.time_list`` and ``simulation_settings.operation.dt_max``,
1139		applies time-varying boundary conditions, registers outputs, and runs
1140		the simulator.
1141
1142		Side Effects
1143		------------
1144		- May add nonelastic elements to the material model.
1145		- Writes displacement, mean stress, and von Mises stress fields under
1146		  ``<output_folder>/operation``.
1147
1148		Raises
1149		------
1150		Exception
1151		    If an unsupported nonelastic element type or BC type is found.
1152		KeyError
1153		    If required time, BC, or simulation settings are missing.
1154		"""
1155		# Build material: non-elastic element
1156		for elem_name in self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"].keys():
1157			if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["active"]:
1158				if self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "KelvinVoigt":
1159					if not self.element_exist(elem_name):
1160						E = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["E"])
1161						nu = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["nu"])
1162						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1163						kelvin = Viscoelastic(eta, E, nu, elem_name)
1164						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(kelvin)
1165				elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "DislocationCreep":
1166					if not self.element_exist(elem_name):
1167						A = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["A"])
1168						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1169						Q = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["Q"])
1170						creep_0 = DislocationCreep(A, Q, n, elem_name)
1171						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(creep_0)
1172						T = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["T"])
1173						self.mom_eq.set_T0(T)
1174						self.mom_eq.set_T(T)
1175				elif self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"] == "ViscoplasticDesai":
1176					if not self.element_exist(elem_name):
1177						mu_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["mu_1"])
1178						N_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["N_1"])
1179						n = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["n"])
1180						a_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["a_1"])
1181						eta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["eta"])
1182						beta_1 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta_1"])
1183						beta = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["beta"])
1184						m = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["m"])
1185						gamma = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["gamma"])
1186						alpha_0 = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["alpha_0"])
1187						sigma_t = self.grid.get_parameter(self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["parameters"]["sigma_t"])
1188						desai = ViscoplasticDesai(mu_1, N_1, a_1, eta, n, beta_1, beta, m, gamma, sigma_t, alpha_0, elem_name)
1189
1190						if self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["operation"]["hardening"]:
1191							# Compute initial hardening parameter
1192							stress_to = numpy2torch(self.mom_eq.sig.x.array.reshape((self.mom_eq.n_elems, 3, 3)))
1193							desai.compute_initial_hardening(stress_to, Fvp_0=0.0)
1194
1195						self.mom_eq.mat.add_to_non_elastic(desai)
1196				else:
1197					elem_type = self.input_file["constitutive_model"]["nonelastic"][elem_name]["type"]
1198					raise Exception(f"Element type {elem_type} not supported.")
1199
1200
1201		# Time settings for operation stage
1202		t_values = self.input_file["time_settings"]["time_list"]
1203		dt = self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["operation"]["dt_max"]
1204		tf = t_values[-1]
1205		tc_op = TimeController(dt=dt, initial_time=0.0, final_time=tf, time_unit="second")
1206
1207		# Loop over boundaries
1208		bc_op = momBC.BcHandler(self.mom_eq)
1209		for b_name in self.input_file["boundary_conditions"].keys():
1210			bc_values = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["values"]
1211			if self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "neumann":
1212				bc = momBC.NeumannBC(boundary_name = b_name,
1213									 direction = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["direction"],
1214									 density = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["density"],
1215									 ref_pos = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["reference_position"],
1216									 values = bc_values,
1217									 time_values = t_values,
1218									 g = self.g)
1219			elif self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"] == "dirichlet":
1220				bc = momBC.DirichletBC(boundary_name = b_name, 
1221								 	   component = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["component"],
1222									   values = bc_values,
1223									   time_values = t_values)
1224			else:
1225				b_type = self.input_file["boundary_conditions"][b_name]["type"]
1226				raise Exception(f"Boundary condition type {b_type} not supported.")
1227			bc_op.add_boundary_condition(bc)
1228
1229		# Set boundary conditions
1230		self.mom_eq.set_boundary_conditions(bc_op)
1231
1232		# Create output handlers
1233		output_mom = SaveFields(self.mom_eq)
1234		output_mom.set_output_folder(os.path.join(self.output_folder, "operation"))
1235		output_mom.add_output_field("u", "Displacement (m)")
1236		output_mom.add_output_field("p_elems", "Mean Stress (MPa)")
1237		output_mom.add_output_field("q_elems", "Von Mises Stress (MPa)")
1238		outputs = [output_mom]
1239
1240		# Define simulator
1241		compute_elastic_response = True
1242		if self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["active"] == True:
1243			compute_elastic_response = False
1244		sim = Simulator_M(self.mom_eq, tc_op, outputs, compute_elastic_response=compute_elastic_response)
1245		sim.run()

Run the operation (transient) stage.

Activates any nonelastic models flagged active: True (adding only if not already present), configures the time controller using time_settings.time_list and simulation_settings.operation.dt_max, applies time-varying boundary conditions, registers outputs, and runs the simulator.

Side Effects
  • May add nonelastic elements to the material model.
  • Writes displacement, mean stress, and von Mises stress fields under <output_folder>/operation.
Raises
  • Exception: If an unsupported nonelastic element type or BC type is found.
  • KeyError: If required time, BC, or simulation settings are missing.
def run(self): 
1248	def run(self):
1249		"""
1250		Execute the full simulation workflow.
1251
1252		If ``simulation_settings.equilibrium.active`` is ``True``, runs the
1253		equilibrium stage first and then the operation stage; otherwise,
1254		runs only the operation stage.
1255
1256		Returns
1257		-------
1258		None
1259		"""
1260		if self.input_file["simulation_settings"]["equilibrium"]["active"] == True:
1261			self.run_equilibrium()
1262		self.run_operation()

Execute the full simulation workflow.

If simulation_settings.equilibrium.active is True, runs the equilibrium stage first and then the operation stage; otherwise, runs only the operation stage.

Returns
  • None
def ScreenPrinter(*args, **kwargs): 
29	def get_instance(*args, **kwargs):
30		if cls not in instances:
31			instances[cls] = cls(*args, **kwargs)
32		return instances[cls]
class TimeControllerBase(abc.ABC): 
 25class TimeControllerBase(ABC):
 26    """
 27    Base class for time-stepping controllers.
 28
 29    Converts user-provided time units (e.g., minutes, hours) into **seconds**
 30    for internal bookkeeping, stores the current time, and provides a
 31    loop-termination predicate. Concrete subclasses implement how time
 32    advances each step.
 33
 34    Parameters
 35    ----------
 36    initial_time : float
 37        Start time expressed in the unit given by ``time_unit``.
 38    final_time : float
 39        End time expressed in the unit given by ``time_unit``.
 40    time_unit : {"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}, default="second"
 41        Unit of the input times. Internally, times are stored in seconds.
 42
 43    Attributes
 44    ----------
 45    time_unit : str
 46        The time unit specified by the user.
 47    time_conversion : float
 48        Multiplicative factor to convert the chosen unit into seconds.
 49    t_initial : float
 50        Initial time in seconds.
 51    t_final : float
 52        Final time in seconds.
 53    t : float
 54        Current time in seconds.
 55    step_counter : int
 56        Number of completed steps (starts at 0).
 57    """
 58    def __init__(self, initial_time: float, final_time: float, time_unit: str="second"):
 59        self.time_unit = time_unit
 60        self.__decide_time_unit()
 61        self.t_final = final_time*self.time_conversion
 62        self.t_initial = initial_time*self.time_conversion
 63        self.t = initial_time*self.time_conversion
 64        self.step_counter = 0
 65
 66    def __decide_time_unit(self) -> None:
 67        """
 68        Map a textual time unit to its conversion factor to seconds.
 69
 70        Parameters
 71        ----------
 72        time_unit : {"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}
 73            Name of the time unit.
 74
 75        Returns
 76        -------
 77        None
 78
 79        Raises
 80        ------
 81        Exception
 82            If `time_unit` is not one of the supported values.
 83
 84        Notes
 85        -----
 86        This is an internal helper that sets :attr:`time_unit` to a scalar factor.
 87        """
 88        if self.time_unit == "second":
 89            self.time_conversion = 1
 90        elif self.time_unit == "minute":
 91            self.time_conversion = minute
 92        elif self.time_unit == "hour":
 93            self.time_conversion = hour
 94        elif self.time_unit == "day":
 95            self.time_conversion = day
 96        elif self.time_unit == "year":
 97            self.time_conversion = year
 98        else:
 99            raise Exception(f"Time unit {self.time_unit} not supported.")
100
101    def keep_looping(self) -> None:
102        """
103        Check whether the controller should continue advancing time.
104
105        Returns
106        -------
107        bool
108            ``True`` while the current time `t` is strictly less than `t_final`,
109            otherwise ``False``.
110        """
111        return self.t < self.t_final
112
113    @abstractmethod
114    def advance_time(self) -> None:
115        """
116        Advance the internal time by one step.
117
118        Returns
119        -------
120        None
121
122        Notes
123        -----
124        Subclasses must implement the time-update rule (e.g., add a fixed `dt`
125        or follow a varying schedule).
126        """
127        pass

Base class for time-stepping controllers.

Converts user-provided time units (e.g., minutes, hours) into seconds for internal bookkeeping, stores the current time, and provides a loop-termination predicate. Concrete subclasses implement how time advances each step.

Parameters
  • initial_time (float): Start time expressed in the unit given by time_unit.
  • final_time (float): End time expressed in the unit given by time_unit.
  • time_unit ({"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}, default="second"): Unit of the input times. Internally, times are stored in seconds.
Attributes
  • time_unit (str): The time unit specified by the user.
  • time_conversion (float): Multiplicative factor to convert the chosen unit into seconds.
  • t_initial (float): Initial time in seconds.
  • t_final (float): Final time in seconds.
  • t (float): Current time in seconds.
  • step_counter (int): Number of completed steps (starts at 0).
time_unit
t_final
t_initial
t
step_counter
def keep_looping(self) -> None: 
101    def keep_looping(self) -> None:
102        """
103        Check whether the controller should continue advancing time.
104
105        Returns
106        -------
107        bool
108            ``True`` while the current time `t` is strictly less than `t_final`,
109            otherwise ``False``.
110        """
111        return self.t < self.t_final

Check whether the controller should continue advancing time.

Returns
  • bool: True while the current time t is strictly less than t_final, otherwise False.
@abstractmethod
def advance_time(self) -> None: 
113    @abstractmethod
114    def advance_time(self) -> None:
115        """
116        Advance the internal time by one step.
117
118        Returns
119        -------
120        None
121
122        Notes
123        -----
124        Subclasses must implement the time-update rule (e.g., add a fixed `dt`
125        or follow a varying schedule).
126        """
127        pass

Advance the internal time by one step.

Returns
  • None
Notes

Subclasses must implement the time-update rule (e.g., add a fixed dt or follow a varying schedule).

class TimeController(safeincave.TimeControllerBase): 
131class TimeController(TimeControllerBase):
132        """
133        Fixed-step time controller.
134
135        Advances the current time by a constant step `dt` expressed in the chosen
136        unit.
137
138        Parameters
139        ----------
140        dt : float
141        Time-step size expressed in the units given by `time_unit`.
142        initial_time : float
143        Start time expressed in the units given by `time_unit`.
144        final_time : float
145        Final time expressed in the units given by `time_unit`.
146        time_unit : {"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}, default="second"
147        Unit used to interpret `dt`, `initial_time`, and `final_time`.
148
149        Attributes
150        ----------
151        dt : float
152        Fixed time-step size in **seconds**.
153        """
154        def __init__(self, dt: float, initial_time: float, final_time: float, time_unit: str="second"):
155            super().__init__(initial_time, final_time, time_unit)
156            self.dt = dt*self.time_conversion
157
158        def advance_time(self) -> None:
159            """
160        Increment the current time by the fixed step `dt`.
161
162        Returns
163        -------
164        None
165            """
166            self.step_counter += 1
167            self.t += self.dt

Fixed-step time controller.

Advances the current time by a constant step dt expressed in the chosen unit.

Parameters

  • dt (float):
