  • Time-step size expressed in the units given by time_unit.

  • initial_time (float):

  • Start time expressed in the units given by time_unit.

  • final_time (float):

  • Final time expressed in the units given by time_unit.

  • time_unit ({"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}, default="second"):

  • Unit used to interpret dt, initial_time, and final_time.

Attributes

  • dt (float):

  • Fixed time-step size in *seconds.*

155            super().__init__(initial_time, final_time, time_unit)
156            self.dt = dt*self.time_conversion

160        Increment the current time by the fixed step `dt`.

class TimeControllerParabolic(safeincave.TimeControllerBase): 
171class TimeControllerParabolic(TimeControllerBase):
172    """
173    Nonuniform (parabolic) time controller.
174
175    Builds a monotonically increasing list of `n_time_steps` time instants
176    between `initial_time` and `final_time` by mapping an equally spaced grid
177    through a parabolic function and rescaling it back to the original range.
178    The step size `dt` changes over time.
179
180    Parameters
181    ----------
182    n_time_steps : int
183        Number of time instants (length of the time list).
184    initial_time : float
185        Start time expressed in the units given by `time_unit`.
186    final_time : float
187        Final time expressed in the units given by `time_unit`.
188    time_unit : {"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}, default="second"
189        Unit used to interpret `initial_time` and `final_time`.
190
191    Attributes
192    ----------
193    n_time_steps : int
194        Number of generated time instants.
195    time_list : numpy.ndarray
196        Monotone array of times (in **seconds**) of length `n_time_steps`.
197    dt : float
198        Current time step size (in **seconds**); initialized as
199        ``time_list[1] - time_list[0]``.
200    step_counter : int
201        Index of the most recently advanced step (starts at 0).
202    """
203    def __init__(self, n_time_steps: int, initial_time: float, final_time: float, time_unit: str="second"):
204        super().__init__(initial_time, final_time, time_unit)
205        self.n_time_steps = n_time_steps
206        self.time_list = self.calculate_varying_times(self.fun_parabolic)
207        self.dt = self.time_list[1] - self.time_list[0]
208        self.step_counter = 0
209
210    def fun_parabolic(self, t_array: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
211        """
212        Parabolic mapping used to skew an equally spaced time grid.
213
214        Parameters
215        ----------
216        t_array : numpy.ndarray
217            Input array (typically an equally spaced grid).
218
219        Returns
220        -------
221        numpy.ndarray
222            Elementwise square of `t_array` (i.e., ``t_array**2``).
223        """
224        return t_array**2
225
226    def calculate_varying_times(self, fun: Fn) -> np.ndarray:
227        """
228        Generate a nonuniform time grid via a monotone mapping and rescaling.
229
230        Steps
231        -----
232        1. Build an equally spaced grid on ``[t_initial, t_final]``.
233        2. Apply ``fun`` to this grid to skew the spacing.
234        3. Linearly rescale the mapped values back to the original range so that
235           the first and last times remain ``t_initial`` and ``t_final``.
236
237        Parameters
238        ----------
239        fun : Callable[[numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray]
240            Monotone mapping to skew the spacing (e.g., :meth:`fun_parabolic`).
241
242        Returns
243        -------
244        numpy.ndarray
245            Monotone array of times (in seconds) of length ``n_time_steps``.
246        """
247        t_eq = np.linspace(self.t_initial, self.t_final, self.n_time_steps)
248        y = fun(t_eq)
249        f_min = np.min(t_eq)
250        f_max = np.max(y)
251        k = (t_eq.max() - t_eq.min())/(f_max - f_min)
252        y = k*(y - f_min) + t_eq.min()
253        return y
254
255    def advance_time(self) -> None:
256        """
257        Advance to the next time in :attr:`time_list`.
258
259        Increments :attr:`step_counter`, sets :attr:`t` to the corresponding
260        entry of :attr:`time_list`, and updates :attr:`dt` as the difference
261        between the current and previous times.
262
263        Returns
264        -------
265        None
266
267        Notes
268        -----
269        No bounds checking is performed. Ensure
270        ``step_counter < n_time_steps - 1`` before advancing.
271        """
272        self.step_counter += 1
273        self.t = self.time_list[self.step_counter]
274        self.dt = self.time_list[self.step_counter] - self.time_list[self.step_counter-1]

Nonuniform (parabolic) time controller.

Builds a monotonically increasing list of n_time_steps time instants between initial_time and final_time by mapping an equally spaced grid through a parabolic function and rescaling it back to the original range. The step size dt changes over time.

Parameters
  • n_time_steps (int): Number of time instants (length of the time list).
  • initial_time (float): Start time expressed in the units given by time_unit.
  • final_time (float): Final time expressed in the units given by time_unit.
  • time_unit ({"second", "minute", "hour", "day", "year"}, default="second"): Unit used to interpret initial_time and final_time.
Attributes
  • n_time_steps (int): Number of generated time instants.
  • time_list (numpy.ndarray): Monotone array of times (in seconds) of length n_time_steps.
  • dt (float): Current time step size (in seconds); initialized as time_list[1] - time_list[0].
  • step_counter (int): Index of the most recently advanced step (starts at 0).
TimeControllerParabolic( n_time_steps: int, initial_time: float, final_time: float, time_unit: str = 'second') 
203    def __init__(self, n_time_steps: int, initial_time: float, final_time: float, time_unit: str="second"):
204        super().__init__(initial_time, final_time, time_unit)
205        self.n_time_steps = n_time_steps
206        self.time_list = self.calculate_varying_times(self.fun_parabolic)
207        self.dt = self.time_list[1] - self.time_list[0]
208        self.step_counter = 0
n_time_steps
time_list
dt
step_counter
def fun_parabolic(self, t_array: numpy.ndarray) -> numpy.ndarray: 
210    def fun_parabolic(self, t_array: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
211        """
212        Parabolic mapping used to skew an equally spaced time grid.
213
214        Parameters
215        ----------
216        t_array : numpy.ndarray
217            Input array (typically an equally spaced grid).
218
219        Returns
220        -------
221        numpy.ndarray
222            Elementwise square of `t_array` (i.e., ``t_array**2``).
223        """
224        return t_array**2

Parabolic mapping used to skew an equally spaced time grid.

Parameters
  • t_array (numpy.ndarray): Input array (typically an equally spaced grid).
Returns
  • numpy.ndarray: Elementwise square of t_array (i.e., t_array**2).
def calculate_varying_times(self, fun: Callable[[float], float]) -> numpy.ndarray: 
226    def calculate_varying_times(self, fun: Fn) -> np.ndarray:
227        """
228        Generate a nonuniform time grid via a monotone mapping and rescaling.
229
230        Steps
231        -----
232        1. Build an equally spaced grid on ``[t_initial, t_final]``.
233        2. Apply ``fun`` to this grid to skew the spacing.
234        3. Linearly rescale the mapped values back to the original range so that
235           the first and last times remain ``t_initial`` and ``t_final``.
236
237        Parameters
238        ----------
239        fun : Callable[[numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray]
240            Monotone mapping to skew the spacing (e.g., :meth:`fun_parabolic`).
241
242        Returns
243        -------
244        numpy.ndarray
245            Monotone array of times (in seconds) of length ``n_time_steps``.
246        """
247        t_eq = np.linspace(self.t_initial, self.t_final, self.n_time_steps)
248        y = fun(t_eq)
249        f_min = np.min(t_eq)
250        f_max = np.max(y)
251        k = (t_eq.max() - t_eq.min())/(f_max - f_min)
252        y = k*(y - f_min) + t_eq.min()
253        return y

Generate a nonuniform time grid via a monotone mapping and rescaling.

Steps
  1. Build an equally spaced grid on [t_initial, t_final].
  2. Apply fun to this grid to skew the spacing.
  3. Linearly rescale the mapped values back to the original range so that the first and last times remain t_initial and t_final.
Parameters
  • fun (Callable[[numpy.ndarray], numpy.ndarray]): Monotone mapping to skew the spacing (e.g., fun_parabolic()).
Returns
  • numpy.ndarray: Monotone array of times (in seconds) of length n_time_steps.
def advance_time(self) -> None: 
255    def advance_time(self) -> None:
256        """
257        Advance to the next time in :attr:`time_list`.
258
259        Increments :attr:`step_counter`, sets :attr:`t` to the corresponding
260        entry of :attr:`time_list`, and updates :attr:`dt` as the difference
261        between the current and previous times.
262
263        Returns
264        -------
265        None
266
267        Notes
268        -----
269        No bounds checking is performed. Ensure
270        ``step_counter < n_time_steps - 1`` before advancing.
271        """
272        self.step_counter += 1
273        self.t = self.time_list[self.step_counter]
274        self.dt = self.time_list[self.step_counter] - self.time_list[self.step_counter-1]

Advance to the next time in time_list.

Increments step_counter, sets t to the corresponding entry of time_list, and updates dt as the difference between the current and previous times.

Returns
  • None
Notes

No bounds checking is performed. Ensure step_counter < n_time_steps - 1 before advancing.
